text: Great Breakfast. They have the best chicken sausage. It was just a really long wait. But the food was great.

We originally was gonna go to wildberry, but things didn't work out. We were suggested by a friend to download nowait app to help with the wait time. We didn't realize that wildberry didn't allow us to use their app for 5 people. We were sad. We saw that yolk was nother breakfast place and we used the app here. They offered more people to wait in line than wildberry. So we ended up here. We took about 15 minutes to get there. I used my app to wait in line. Even before our lyft came, it said our table was already ready. That was awesome, so we got into the ressturant instantly and got seated. The staff here was very friend. They all looked like they enjoy their work. The waiters were fairly attentive. They were quick to refill our water jug when they noticed it was empty. I ordered the eggs Benedict and I did enjoy it. It comes with roasted potatoes which I wasn't sure at first that I would like it. I ended up like my entire meal. The eggs Benedict was delicious and the potatoes were crunchy on the outside but soft in the inside! I was a little sad they didn't have an egg Benedict with crab cakes but I was naive to think all places would have it. I wouldn't mind coming here again even if it wasn't originally planned.
Can be a bit of a wait on weekends but worth it. Breakfast most important meal of the day so might as well get a great start.

Huge portions are served.  Food is good.  Kids enjoyed this place a lot. Place is clean, hospitality is good.  Prices were reasonable.  Food wait time wasn't long.  Food was cooked ot perfection.  Good Stuff.  will visit again.

I was pretty happy with this place. Breakfast was pretty good, although the Crunch pancakes were a little too much on the sweeter side for an adult. The coffee is amazing, after all the traveling I have done and tastings, this coffee is really a winner!!! If anything was wrong with this place, that coffee would make up for it. Ambiance is nice, wish there was patio seating, maybe coming soon.

In my opinion, there are three big perks about Yolk:  1) Big menu with lots of variety: even the pickiest eaters will find something they like. I enjoyed building my own custom "scrambler" with the long list of ingredients available. I also shared the very berry french toast, which was very tasty: challah bread topped with strawberries, blueberries, blackberries, honey, granola, and greek yogurt. 2) Portion sizes are VERY generous. The average entree will set you back $10-13, but you'll almost certainly have enough for two meals.  My scrambler came with a huge side of potatoes, plus two slices of toast.  3) Great place for groups. The restaurant is huge and has lots of tables and booths, plus counter seating for singles/couples. Now, for the constructive criticism: Yolk doesn't take reservations. Instead, they use the "nowait" app. However, when I showed up at the restaurant at the time the nowait app told me to arrive, I still had to wait another 30 minutes (the app is a lie!).

TLDR: Get the No wait app, Potato Pancakes (Latkes) were good, probably not coming back if I do find myself in Chicago again, Service was okay considering how swamped the place gets.   Third Day in Chicago and I wanted to try a Brunch place!  So we stopped in for some breakfast and may I say, it was quite delicious!!  We came on a Friday morning and thought there would be no line because everyone is at work still, boy was I wrong.  There was a 30 minute wait but if you have the NO wait app, you can actually sign in without actually being there in person and wait for them to text you when your table is ready.  It took a while to get our waiters attention, but after waiting 20 minutes, he came to take our order.  Our eyes are always bigger than our stomachs so for 4 people we ordered 5 dishes thinking they were small.  The entrees were South of the Border Benny, Cheesy Egg Sandwich, Country Side skillet, potato pancakes, and the farm house.   The size of all the dishes covered our entire table, and just looking at all the food we ordered, made us full.  The South of the Border Benny was okay, I wasn't a big fan of crumbled chorizo or the hash that was soft/steamed potatoes on the side but they nailed the poached eggs.  The Potato pancakes were like latkes, they were really good with the sour cream and ketchup, not so much the apple sauce though.  The Cheesy Egg Sandwich and the Skillet were just overwhelmingly rich and needed something other than ketchup and hot sauce to cut through it all.  The hot sauce that they have on the table wasn't at all spicy, it was smokey and went really well with almost anything we put it on!!  The farm house entree was okay, the cheesy grits and the gravy over biscuts were good.  The food overall was good for what it was, but we left feeling unsatisfied.     The service for the overall meal was decent, considering how busy they were.  If I do come back, I may order something else like an omelet or a simple combo meal.

Delicious food with a big menu!! I ordered the California Omelette, which came with a choice of seasoned potatoes or cheesy grits AND a choice of pancakes, toast, or English muffins! My sister got the Countryside Skillet which also came with a choice of pancakes, toast or English muffins! Definitely very cheesy for both, which I personally enjoyed! Terrific food with large portions; it'll definitely fill you up! Great location near Museum Campus and Grant Park as well!

Overall experience here was great. When me and company arrived we were seated almost immediately because of the lack of people. Before I continue, a quick shout out to the waitress who served us, nicely done and thank you for being kind and not rude at all. I ordered two dishes, waffles with fresh strawberries ($3 is a little much for the amount of strawberries that were layered on the waffles) and because it caught my intention, I also ordered the Nutella crepe. Since the waffles got to my table first I'll start with them. The waffles were shaped well, split into fourths and after an initial bite I noticed that they weren't overpoweringly sweet even with the syrup and the powdered sugar, which is a good thing, in my opinion. They also had a nice crispy exterior with a soft interior. However, something about them just didn't completely blow me away to award it five stars. They certainly had a homemade flavor to them and a relatively tasty batter. But, they arrived a little to cold for my liking and the batter itself used to make the waffle could use a more unique flavor that distinguishes it more from the competition. Again, the batter is good, but not mind blowing. It could have also arrived warmer, since food that is meant to be warm tastes better when it's...... of course warm. Onto the Nutella crepe.... man this thing was excellent. I honestly enjoyed this more than the waffles hands down. (And at only $5 it's a must have) The crepes themselves were well made. They didn't have that horrible egg like taste that happens if done incorrectly and they went well with the perfect amount of Nutella, bread crumbs/nuts, banana slices, strawberries, and whipped cream that are served with it. I didn't even need the syrup. The crepes were also very light, nicely folded, and savory. I'll be ordering this again the next time I come here, maybe you should too.

I try this place with my girlfriend the day after I try wildberry, I see that the waitlist was long so I add my name on the waitlist or yelp. We arrive with 10 minutes of advance and we seat more than 30 minutes later than when our table should have been ready, but was ok because the place was pretty busy. The place was so loud, and talk with my girlfriend was almost impossible, I order and ice vanilla latte that was good and my girlfriend take a hot caramel latte that, don't taste of caramel, zero! For food I take the croque madame with season potato e pancakes and everything was huge and also big, my girlfriend take a all veggies omelette, iron man I think was the name and she say that was pretty good, and her chocolate pancakes was really good. The place was so busy but the service was really good, our server was good, and attentive to us, a good place for breakfast in the south loop.

The breakfast here is first rate. Me, being a two eggs, potatoes, sausage and bacon kind of guy, really enjoyed my meal.  My girlfriend ordered an omelet and pancakes, which she asked for fruit on top.  The pancakes, which were served with strawberries on top, were delicious.  I would definitely stop in for breakfast the next time I stay near this location.  FWI, I usually order salsa with my breakfast, but this time I had the Yolk Signature Hot Sauce which is very good.

Looking for a great place for breakfast this is it. This restaurant reminds me of a local place in Kentucky called Wild Eggs. I opted for the eggs benedict since it's something I don't eat often and my fiancé ordered the eggs benedict caprese which has mozzarella, slice of tomato and basil added. Our food arrived within 5-10 minutes after ordering and was served with seasoned potatoes. Everything was great and the eggs cooked to perfection. We were bummed they don't serve alcohol so that we could order a Bloody Mary or mimosa. I can't take off stars for that because that's a business choice and we could have went somewhere else that did. We opted for this place over others based on Yelp photos, the food looked great and indeed was.

We were in need of a quick bite before sight seeing for the day. This was an excellent option. Serving sizes are HUGE, we shared and we're stuffed when we walked out. Coffee is fantastic. This place can get super busy though, we went on a weekday at 9:30 and there were no empty seats, by 10 there was a line.

Come on people have some standards.  The pancakes are gummy, the pastries aren't even made in-house and are still terrible and the savory items are mediocre.  Yolk is just taking advantage of how demand for brunch places appears inelastic to the quality of brunch supplied.  For the exact same type of brunch, but much better, hit up your neighborhood Original Pancake House.

I was actually disappointed with this place because the name and decor gave me high expectations for a great breakfast spot.  The breakfast was tasteless. The maple bacon pancakes...true disappointment. The pancakes were plain pancakes with a tablespoon of chopped bacon placed on top with a drizzle of chocolate syrup. I guess the maple comes from me actually pouring maple on it myself not that it was cooked into it or anything.  The kale scramble....tasted like bland eggs with grass. They should have cooked the kale a bit before scrambling it into the eggs. Coffee...decent but they only had the highly preserved packets of creamers on the table.  Asked for real cream....none. Asked for whole milk...none. Had skim or two percent. What kind of breakfast spot only has watery milk for coffee?????!!! Add to that a friend paid $18 for oatmeal with fruit. Yes. $18!!!! Barely a spoonful each of blueberrues, strawberries, etc... $1.25 each small spoonful. Plus it was a watery mess....not creamy or thick oatmeal. SMH. It was truly disappointing.

So after a morning bike ride along the lake my son and I needed some good breakfast and we chose to go closer to home and ended up at Yolk. It was packed to the brim and the wait was 40 mins so we decided to  order carryout. When I was checking in on Yelp I realized I could have added myself to a waitlist and that would have got us in sooner, will try that next time. We ordered scrambled eggs and toast to share and a scone. When we finished eating on our favorite bench in Grant Park we looked for a our scone which was missing....later realized I was charged for it . I called Yolk and Ariel was very courteous and remembered us from the morning and promised to leave a note with our Free Scone at the counter. That to me is excellent customer service. We will certainly go back!!

Stopped here for breakfast before heading to the Shedd Aquarium across the street.  You can't miss the bright yellow awning outside and while I had my reservations about Yolk since it is a chain I was impressed on all fronts. The interior was spacious and disco music was playing.  We're talking Friday morning at like 7am.  It was a bit intense before I've had a cup of coffee.  Our server was friendly and attentive.  The food portions were huge and not overpriced.  I ordered the pot roast eggs benedict (I always enjoy a creative take on the classic) and my friend and I shared an order of potato pancakes.  We had a difficult time clearing our plates even though the food was delicious. Yolk wouldn't necessarily be my first choice for breakfast but it's good to know at least this location is always an option for a hearty and affordable meal.  And this location is also conveniently right off the bus line.

I like that you can be texted when your table is ready, so you don't have to wait in line. The service moves quick to turn tables over, without making customers feel rushed out. I got a California Omelette, extra crispy potatoes, delish! Lots of food, good price point, quality dishes. Have been to other Yolk locations, and the service is consistently the same.

We came here for breakfast on a Sunday morning. It was pretty busy, but we were seated immediately.  I was hungry and wanted to order everything, but I went with the Red Velvet French toast. My fiancé had the cinnamon roll french toast. Keep in mind if they ask if you want real maple syrup that each little bottle is $2. Both of those dishes do not need maple syrup and so we took our little bottles home. I also ordered the strawberry orange juice which I loved and now must learn to make at home. Lol!  Next time I'd like to try the eggs benedict. Yum!

Love this location. This Yolk is probably my favorite. Delicious food and EXCELLENT SERVICE. They have awesome staff and incredibly accommodating chefs that are very good with substitutions! Keep up the awesome work.

This was a great restaurant for breakfast. We did not eat lunch here but the menu looked great!!  The wait staff and service all around was amazing, here is why....  we ordered our meals and everything came out in a timely manor, actually quicker than expected!!  I ordered a yogurt to go with my breakfast and when it arrived it tasted just like sour cream, I tried to add strawberries to it and nothing worked, so finally I said something and the waiter and manger were so kind to explain what happened and took it off our tab and decided to upgrade me to the "deluxe!!!!" Which the taste was WAY.... better and the waiter and manger both came back to check on the taste.  Best experience and service that's why I am giving them 5 stars!!!

We visited here about 7:30 Friday morning and were seated immediately. Very friendly and attentive waitstaff.  I loved my Very Berry French toast and my husband said his Chicken and Waffle was great! We would recommend and definitely visit again!
Tons of great breakfast and lunch selection.  Huge servings.  We stop every time we're in Chicago!

Very good breakfast. The wait wasn't too bad for my party if two, but i also checked us in on Yelp before we even got to the restaurant. Between the two of us we got an omelette, potatoes, toast, red velvet french toast, and raspberry lemonade. I did not try the french toast, but everything else was magnificent. My food came out very warm, so warm in fact, that I had to let it cool. This is an important factor for me as i hate when my food is cold. The only things that i would warn someone about is the wait could be long & it's noisy. Enjoy friends

I love yolk :)  I've been here a few times, and the service and food are consistent. I usually get the Very Berry French Toast and bacon, super delicious. Today I decided to venture out and try the burger... I wasn't disappointed! My boyfriend got the salmon scrambled - he said that was a hit, too. The strawberry orange juice is a requirement.  The only thing I'm not a huge fan of is the coffee. It's a medium roast, but I prefer light/breakfast blend.

Ordered ahead for pick up and they give you a time it should be ready. They are just pulling a time out of thin air...like totally made up. And the reason that matters is that you will likely not have a place to legally park nearby to wait on them. Staff seemed unphased while I panicked about a ticket. Someone else had a similar problem and came with a Lyft who she asked to wait for her...Lyft driver gave up and left her. Then they could have multitasked and made the lattes on the order while I waited...instead people stood around and waited for my food to arrive before even starting the espresso. Won't repeat this place for pick up. The only reason they get two stars is that I have really liked their food at other locations. Won't come back to this one though.

No wait. Great service all around never had to wait for anything. Food came hot and ready to eat. Great seating arrangements the booth allow privacy while eating. Parking was not bad at all we chose meter parking paid $4 and parked a block and a half away. I will definitely eat here again. Breakfast was to die for next time lunch.

This restaurant was suggested by the person at the front desk of our hotel, upon arrival we found it very busy but we were seated in less than 20 minutes which was good. The coffee was very good and the menu had many options and I chose the Farm House which consists of biscuits & sausage gravy which was tasty however the portion was very small for the price, $11.50 also got a side of cheesy grits which were absolutely tasteless, very disappointing. We also ordered fries which came out very soggy and not hot. I probably would not go back, however If you're a tourist in the area and want a quick meal on a weekday you may have better luck, seeing as the weekends to get quite busy.
Service was fast.  Food was served hot. I had the California omelet. It was great. We loved our breakfast.

Benedict and mash (8/10)  Pretty good place being a little off the main roads. The egg were pretty well made, along with the potatoes. While the mash/ chip mess was more of just filling rather than delicious. However the waitress was really nice in helping order and satisfying requests. Isn't a bad place to stop by if in the vicinity but wouldn't suggest making a trek across the 7 seas to come try it.

Had a great breakfast before leaving Chicago last Thursday.  Was seated after a short wait.  The taste of each dish was very distinct and even better.  Our server was super.  He had a eye on our table at all times it seemed.  He had many tables but we never had to wait long for anything..  Definitely a great choice.
Ok breakfast food, nothing amazing. I don't think it was worth the 30+ min wait. I would call it a tourist spot. If you want traditional simple breakfast food than this is the spot.
Great food and fast. The waitlist option on yelp was perfect. We had zero wait time.
This place was awesome. Unlimited coffee was a great start to my day :) the scrambled eggs were delicious. Highly recommended.
Hands down the best breakfast spot! Unique selection good service always hopping.  They have never let me down when we are in the city. I have tried so many items and still 5 stars every time.

Fatty fatty fat fat fat. And I don't care. Benedict was great- perfectly cooked. Friends had chicken & waffles and the farmhouse (biscuits and gravy) and we are ALL very happy. The place was packed at 11:30 on a Friday morning so there was a wait, but it was quick and painless. Our server (Victoria) was attentive, efficient and adorable (really, she was).  Any complaints? Meh. Grits could have used more salt and it's kinda noisy to try and hold a convo, but they give you a salt shaker and really, who's talking when your mouth is full of goodness??
Great food, great service. The portions were HUGE! I'm not one to leave a morsel of food on my plate, but I just couldn't finish it. Definitely recommend!
very well managed, especially the reservation/check in system.  very efficient waiter.  Food was great.  Very convenient to the Field museum

My coworkers have gotten into the habit of checking Yelp before they recommend any place to me because they KNOW I'll eventually write a review on it. The pressure is on them to impress ~*~The*Elite~*~ Not really. I'll eat just about anything of any quality. Just feed me and promise me I won't get food poisoning or a tapeworm. One of them found this joint and showed me a picture of the bagel and lox. I haven't had smoked salmon in a minute, so I was hooked. Our little 10-minute walk from the Hilton Chicago (with plenty of sights to see) in the heat worked up an appetite and I was ready! . . . To wait in line for 40 minutes. They do offer drinks from their cafe while you wait, but I'm not trying to fill my belly with iced lattes while I'm waiting for the main meal. The app they use to notify you when your table is ready is cool. Yelp also kept track our place in line. Pretty neat, if I do say so myself.  40 minutes was accurate. Got a text and walked right back in. This is where my review of Yolk gets a little eh. You can tell the front was overwhelmed and not handling it well. Once you receive a text, you get back in a different line to be seated. One gentleman seated the couple two places ahead of us and disappeared. Someone came back around five minutes later and sat my party even though we weren't at the front of the line. Need a better way to get people to their table. Don't tell me my table is ready just for me to wait some more. My tummy did not appreciate that. Anyway, had a cold glass of tomato juice with a slice of lemon to start myself off. If you're a heavy juice drinker, just get the 32 oz. carafe from the get-go. No point in those tiny glasses. Now, despite the front having issues, waiting and the kitchen where on their game! Our, Isamar, server was very sweet and attentive despite how crammed packed and hectic it was in there. Loved her. Out of the three of us, two plates of lox and a regular breakfast plate were ordered. Our lox were so buttery. Just the highest quality I've had in a long time. When I got tired of the toppings, I just ate the lox by themselves. The cream cheese was hard to spread, but the tomato, onions, capers, and bagel were great. My coworker who also ordered the lox opted for a hard boiled egg to top on his bagel. I got three sausage links and two over easy eggs since I'm fat and don't know when to stop. For the All Star plate, he wolfed down some French toast, bacon, sausage links, and two over easy eggs. He was really digging the syrup, too. I always worry about getting sausage patties or links when I eat at a diner-type place because they're either too greasy or just inedible. Not the case here. They were perfect! The first things I ate. The sausage link had a nice texture and the skin had a little bit of snap. Just A+ sausage links and my coworker agreed with me. We left satisfied. Didn't feel rushed even with hoards of people taking over the entrance of the restaurant. Don't worry, though. If I'm even back in too, that's my breakfast joint. Trust me.

Came here on a Sunday the wait was About 30-40 mins if u use the nowait on yelp. Server at the front name Mary was really nice and helpful even though it was crazily crowded. We ordered the iron man omelette which was okay. The side of potato tasted like they were raw so we didn't eat any at all. Pancake was overcooked and a bit dry we were not a fan.
Wonderful, great service !! Excellent food. So very glad we walked down this morning.

Amazing Breakfast for a Great Price!!  My youngest; 11 ordered from the kids menu and she had more than enough but not too much! I had the chicken and waffles... great! Although I didn't eat the gravy. My daughter had the Yolk All Star... She won't be hungry for awhile! My girls and I loved our 1st Yolk experience!!

The food is fantastic and the service is excellent! I had the chilaquiles and was skeptic at first being that I live in a border town between Texas and Mexico. I figured we were way to far northeast to have chilaquiles but was I surprised! Some of the best I have ever had!!! My family loved their breakfast and the jalapeños were surprisingly super hot.  You won't be disappointed eating hear.

Disclaimer: The review you are about to read is written by someone who hates eggs! That said, this is a great spot for breakfast, brunch, or lunch. My husband got the West Coast Crepes and loved it - 5 stars. I had a club sandwich and fries - totally fine but nothing special. I give them four stars for the good service, large portions, and fun ambiance and decor - everything is yellow and blue!

This place is so touristy and generic. Nothing fancy to the food. I'm not a chef and I could make most of this at home better. Especially for the price. The kids mac n cheese was like cheese soup with a few noodles and the sauce was very grainy. Then the BLT supreme + egg was just a big pile of ingredients slapped on soggy bread that I couldn't even eat like a proper sandwich. We had the Reuben too which was very plain and the fries had no flavor. Definitely a huge disappointment from the service to the food.

Still as good as I remember it. Affordable and delicious breakfast. I got the California omelette (substituted cheddar and Swiss for mozzarella) and the berry French toast. Both were delicious. The Greek yogurt on the French toast created a nice balance between the sweetness of the syrup. The servers and staff were also very friendly and helpful.

Extensive menu and great service. My party noticed that all of the staff were happy and very helpful. Made for a pleasant experience. Had a ham and Swiss French toast thing with a sunny side egg on top, delicious but had to remove the egg because it was almost raw, needed more cook time.
not exactly known for the ambiance but when you want some good french toast..go here! I know that I will enjoy my brunch every time.

This is a great go to breakfast place when you are looking for a fast, no brainer breakfast spot. Their food is very straight forward, great tasting and plentiful. I made my own skillet with a variety of ingredients to choose from and my husband has the chilaquiles which he absolutely loved. To which I might add, it's very hard to find good, authentic chilaquiles in the city and these were up there. The well done potatoes on my skillet (per my request) was an added bonus to a great meal. The only downside to this place is the level of noise and their taste in music. If you go during the weekend, be prepared to shout your conversation with your fellow party as it's nearly impossible to hear anyone speak. As for the music, I know it's my personal preference, but I really feel like I'm in a club when I go there. I would prefer something a little more in the "easy listening" category. The noise level and music really just stamped the "club" feel for me which is why I deducted one star. But it's still a great place for an all American breakfast.

Was in Chicago for a conference and was looking for a breakfast place within walking distance to the Hilton. Only a few blocks away. Went on a Monday morning and was seated right away. It was very noisy but the server was friendly and attentive. Food also came very quickly. Menu has plenty of options and are all reasonably priced. I built my own omelette which came with potatoes and stack of pancakes. Delicious food but more than I could eat. Will definitely come back again when I visit!

Fantastic breakfast spot!  My daughter had the strawberry cheesecake pancakes and they were phenomenal ( of course I tried a bite).  I had the croque madame which was wonderful. We will definitely be back!

Loved this place so much the first time I came to Chicago 5 years ago that we had to come eat at the Yolk our second trip here. We met up with some friends for breakfast and arrived before them, but the waiter wouldn't let us sit at a table until they arrived. It was so crowded I was worried that the tables would be filled by the time they arrived. It turned out fine, though, we were seated as soon as our full party was present.  A lot of the menu has to do with eggs, hence the name "Yolk" (egg benedict, scrambles, omelets, etc.) I ordered the berry french toast with greek yogurt and granola with the honey on the side. It was delicious! Too big for me to finish, though, I should have split it with someone. You get six half-pieces of french toast! My friend ordered the chicken and waffles and it was humongous. I stole a bite and it was so good, plus it was the first time I ever tried chicken and waffles. I definitely recommend both of those.  Good service and prices and too!

Pleasantly surprised!!! My and girlfriend were both "hangry" and wanted to try a new place.  Ended up at Yolk. Place is packed on a Monday morning!!! But seated in 5-10 mins (place is huge). Server attended to us promptly. Food did take a tad longer than I am used to (not more than 15 mins though).  Great food. Good prices. Smiley servers. Great coffee. Exactly how I wanna start my day!  And so will you. Try this place, you will leave with a smile.
Wonderful service and food! Very busy place but the staff is highly efficient so the wait is never too long if you forget to make reservations! Highly recommend the chicken & waffles.
Great food and friendly service! Prices are good too for the amount of food you get. I love the decor too; the bright colors give it a happy ambience.

Pretty good breakfast place. It was a little crowded and very noisy, but the service was good and we got our food fast. I got egg whites with broccoli and spinach and a bagel with cream cheese, and it was all very good. The waffle and chicken is good too. The grilled cheese however I wouldn't recommend - they overdose it with tons of goat cheese. Overall, it's a good breakfast restaurant with lots of interesting meals to choose from.

Yolk is a great place for brunch, but they don't take reservations and especially on weekends the wait can be long. As the name implies, they have a wide range of egg dishes and they were delicious. Most of us had omelettes, a kale scrambler, or other egg dishes such as a Santa Fe Frittata (recommended) with an outlier ordering the Nutty Monkey Pancake. The Strawberry OJ smoothie carafe was enjoyed by all.

My friend and I came for brunch. They said the wait would be 25mins, but we were seated in around 10. We split a 5 egg omelet (The Works Omelet) and Steel Cut Oats w/ strawberries since we weren't super hungry. The omelet was actually smaller than we expected but still very filling and also came with diced potatoes. The oats were well prepared and you could mix in your own skim milk and brown sugar. We picked the pancakes as the side for our omelet, since it seemed more shareable than a muffin. The pancakes were a bit dry and the syrup somehow just disappeared into the pancakes but didn't provide much sweetness. I'm sure the actual pancake dishes are much better, but the side pancakes are more just extra carbs. Overall, service was very fast. The main entrees were very tasty and the meal was very filling.

First time experienced this place. What ever came to the table was absolutely amazing. I ordered this steak, eggs, pancakes combo which is only 20$ and it's so good... like this steak was bomb. U cant even have this quality of meat at many steak houses.. i had a chance to meet manager Peter and thanked him for warm welcoming, server was so kind. And food came so quick. First, Me and my girlfriend thought its not our food when server delivered the food, i was like that was quick.. this place is amazing open till 3 everyday.. well done Yolks

If it were based off of the service this rating would be higher and had the service not been as good as it was this would have been a one star. The atmosphere is basically nonexistent. The food was garbage. I got the caprese Benedict and considering this place is called yolk you would think they would have a solid hollandaise...you'd be wrong. Although the 1/2 teaspoon they sloppily placed on top made it hard to tell what it even tasted like I could still tell it was lacking immensely. I wouldn't normally waste a review on a place like this but I went here because of its rating and I am hoping to stop others from making the same mistake.

Love the coffee at yolk. Its always the right temperature. I have so much coffee every time I go because I can't get enough.  I really enjoy the pot roast at yolk. This is a strange thing to say about a brunch place but it is truly delicious. Plus you can get that pot roast in a benedict form which is a wonderful and tasty combination.  The french toast and chicken and waffles are also great choices to make as well.

Service was great. Our waiter was very friendly but not too overbearing. The overall atmosphere of the place was great - perfect for a brunch/lunch place.  My mother and I ordered The Works omelette and the Countryside Skillet. They both tasted great and the pancakes that come on the side were fluffy and great.  I definitely will be going back the next time I come to Chicago!

This place is super good for breakfast.have tried many things from their menu.everything tastes good. Their cinnamon roll french toasts and nutella crepes are out of world. i took a star off because their pancakes although good but are not extra ordinary.i had better pancakes and secondly it was abit crowded so noisy.otherwise the service is very good.
Fantastic eggs caprese. They added spinach at my request. Service counters use was good. Nice and clean. Very happy with my breakfast!

The breakfast was good. But you have to reserve it first, otherwise, you have to wait at least 40 minus in busy weekend morning. And there were lots of people in restaurant, so it might a little noisy. However, I recommend the food.

This place gets super busy, but don't be discouraged.  The wait moved quickly and they will text you when your table is ready.  The food was delicious and worth the wait!  The staff were very friendly.

The service and food was good. The coffee is horrible. After trying our first sips we asked the server to bring us coffee from a newly brewed pot.  After doing so we tried it again...they just have bad coffee. We don't drink it. Our breakfasts were very tasty though.

Every city and/or neighborhood has its A-1 breakfast establishment, and Yolk is the ONE in this area. Don't let the lines scare you, they move very efficiently and fast. A little loud, but the food is worth it!
Great food crazy efficient and open on a holiday.  Win/ win/ win!  I had the bacon waffles which were the perfect salty vs sweet balance.  Yum!!

Amazing breakfast! Less than 10 minute wait to sit at the counter. Hubby had the country scramble breakfast and scarfed it down. I had a bagel (chewy and delicious!) With cream cheese, lox, capers, tomato, and onion. Delicious and great service. I only gave it 4 stars because it's pretty loud and bustling inside.
Great breakfast, great service.  The BLT with avocado is awesome.  Breakfast tea was also very good.

***3.5 stars*** First of all, this restaurant is really cute! I love that they personalize everything - from having their own pens, pancake mix, syrup, bibs, cups, and even their very own water bottle that's labeled Yolk. The interior and exterior is a bright yellow - very eye catching and the inside is nice and open with tables, booths, as well as a counter area.  They had quite a few things on their menu and it took us awhile to finally nail down what we wanted. Not craving any sweets, we went with their South of the Border Benedict and the Pot Roast Benedict. I was excited and wanted to love it, but unfortunately, I was let down...  As a side note, they do not offer hash browns and only serve their potatoes seasoned and diced - which is fine, however, it was not good at all. The potatoes were mushy and felt like they were sitting out for a while. It seemed like frozen potatoes that weren't fried correctly. Strike one! As for both of our Benedict choices, the Pot Roast was definitely the winner. It was so tender and had a great flavor. We thoroughly enjoyed the meat. The South of the Border Benedict had chorizo in it with a chipotle sauce and we thought the sauce was a bit too much. The chorizo already has so much flavor on its own, the added chipotle sauce just made it overpowering. It had a nice kick which we enjoyed, but we could have done without it. The presentation of both our plates were average. Both of our potatoes came looking beat up and unappetizing. I'd say save yourself the trouble and pass on their potatoes!  Aside from the food, we tried their iced vanilla latte with almond milk since they didn't have soy milk. The color was a bit darker than what I'm use and the taste was also off, but it wasn't horrible.  I gave this place 3.5 stars because although I wasn't amazed, I liked the overall vibe of the place and service was good. Judging from the amount of reviews this place has, I couldn't believe the food was just average to me. I really wanted to love it just as much as I loved their decor.  I'll be back though, I'm hoping the pancakes or french toast will wow me next time I'm back!

This place has a cute atmosphere, with a little bit of home. I tried the chicken and waffles (my first time trying - and yes I had to look up how to eat them!) they were very filling, I would definitely suggest throwing your syrup on top of the gravy! My husband had a build your own omelet that looked awersome and some fresh squeezed juice :) They also have a coffee bar which was great because I love me a good latte. We used the early check in option which worked well with their hour long wait. By the time we road bikes there we only waited 15 minutes to be seated. Service was quick and friendly. The only reason I'm not giving 5 stars is because the entrance was wonky and a bit of a cluster to go in and out of a very busy restaurant.
My daughter and I didn't understand why this place has so many good reviews. Food and ambiance not impressive at all and it's overpriced.

I've heard great thinks about Yolk so I thought it was time to come check it out for myself. I ordered the chicken waffles with a friend egg on top and it was the perfect mix of savory and sweet (with the syrup). We were seated almost immediately on a Friday afternoon which I didn't expect and the the food didn't take long to come once we ordered.  I would definitely recommend this place, there's still a few more items on the menu I would love to come back and try. Easily a 5 star breakfast place!!!!!

Yummmm you can't go wrong with Yolk! A big menu with something for everyone. Breakfast or lunch, whichever you want. Attentive, friendly service with a smile. Affordable prices. Go big or go home! I ordered, well, a rather large breakfast one morning (or as our server said as he brought it over, "A breakfast fit for a queen!"). In my defense, I was kind and shared some of it with my friend. Everything was awesome. If you're in a rush, so long as you get a table, they'll get you in and out quickly. Yolk has been a favorite for years!

If you want to come here for a quick bite to eat and walk out feeling satisfied... This is your place.  Came in with a ten minute wait and got a table within that time. They really do get you in and out of here with the fact they stay pretty busy. Our service was excellent and comforting  As for the food... Boy, order anything and you'll be more than satisfied. I do HIGHLY recommend the cinnamon roll french toast. It is more for people with a sweet tooth but add a side of bacon or seasoned potatoes to cut back the sweetness.  Also the countryside skillet is a good choice along with the chicken n' waffles.  Overall a great place to enjoy your breakfast!
Hard working staff and the food was "good." We did experience some dirty glasses and utensils, so I can't rate then above 3 stars.

Wow The food came sooo  fast. I'm super happy right now.   Skillet. The works omelet seas. Potatoes  coffee, toast juice  yummmy.  Everyone is happy and satisfied.  Like most reviews this place is OUTTA this world

I NEVER order french toast. Because I don't even like french toast. I love cinnamon rolls. But I NEVER buy cinnamon rolls. Because calories exist as much as I don't want them to. So when I see cinnamon roll french toast on the menu, the only logical thing to do is to order it, right? RIGHT. This cinnamon roll french toast was the best cinnamon roll AND french toast I've ever had. Actually, it was the most satisfying brunch I've had in a LONG time. Paired with the endless refills of black coffee, I couldn't have been any happier.  I would recommend sharing this with somebody as horrible of an idea as it sounds because even for someone with a huge sweet tooth like me, it was way too sweet. Yet I could not stop eating it. The waitress had to kindly take the plate away from my sight in order for me to stop eating.

Didnt wait too long to get seated ~15 mins. Service was good. The food isn't anything to get excited about, but it wasn't bad. Pretty standard breakfast place. Didn't wow me with all the Yelp hype. Somewhat pricey, paid $40 for 2-person breakfast.
Great food! Love my sandwich! The pancake is puffy too! Service is good and coffee is not bad.

I had an amazing brunch here 5 years ago and wanted to see if it was the same. Good news, STILL DELICIOUS! Honestly, the menu is huge and there are so many things to choose from-- sweet or savory! Many of the breakfast items are easily shareable for two people. I had the west coast crepes, filled with eggs, avocado, etc and could only eat one of the crepes it was so filling! I think the prices are right too for the portion size. $12 for a huge breakfast? Sign me up. The service was extremely friendly. Also if you want to put your name in line for a table and not physically be there they use the no wait app.
Breakfast was just ok but the service was fast and very friendly! Would definitely try it again. I had the Chicken & Waffles! Not the best but not the worse.

I just stopped to get something because I was starving. I ordered a breakfast sandwich that was really good and affordable. I will go back to try the entrees. It always seems packed whenever I walk by so it must be good

Love Yolk, been here many times for brunch. This place is always busy, but they have it moving at a good pace so the wait is never too bad. They have a big selection of food to meet everyone's taste. The food is always good plus the portion sizes are big enough to share .  You can't beat the service, the price and food.

Had breakfast nachos and the yogurt and granola. Nachos were awesome! They get a little mushy but even then very tasty. Blueberry muffin very ordinary though. Service is friendly and efficient. A keeper for breakfast in the Windy City!

I went here a few days ago and I'm still salivating just thinking about it. I was staying at the Congress Plaza Hotel up the street and wandered over to Yolk with my friend when I saw the reviews online. I ordered the breakfast sandwich where the bread is made of French Toast with a side of fresh fruit, and let me tell you -- it was INSANELY DELICIOUS. I am shocked I could even finish it, but it was such a perfect blend of sweet and savory, my stomach made room for it. Our waitress just kept bringing the coffee, which is also a complete necessity when getting a morning start. My friend ordered the Chicken and Waffles and she had no problem finishing her gigantic helping as well. The food here is just ridiculously delicious! And seriously -- every employee here greets you with a genuine smile and conversation. This is just a splendid place and I can't wait to tell everyone I know about it.

Crepes for dayzzz! This place was amazing. We went for Sunday brunch. My son was craving crepes. Got on the waitlist via the app and got a table within 2 minutes of arriving. Fantastic service - friendly and took great care of us. Kept refilling my coffee. Had the super yummy apple blintzes and the Yolk crepe. Couldn't finish either. Everything else looked great too. We will definitely come here again next time we are in Chicago!

My experience at Yolk this morning was OUT OF THIS WORLD!!! Joshua Morales was our server and he treated us LIKE ROYALTY!! He helped us with the menus so well by recommending upgrades that made sense for what my family eats - and his charm and humor made our interactions with him very pleasant! My Mom was so impacted by Joshua's service that she bought 5 T-SHIRTS with enough to give to her friends just so that they can come experience what it is like here!! He also brought our food so fast and was sensitive to our pressed time by getting us our bill in a timely manner. Not to mention Joshua looked FRESH TO DEATH!! I always appreciate a server who looks clean and attractive, but to have someone who looks as good as him and treat us the way he did - SUPERB!!

Phenomenal customer service!!!!! The manager Peter Chabot handles situations very well. I ordered something on the menu and when I received the dish it wasn't what I expected. He comped the meal and gave me something different. He also explained to me about the dish that I ordered was coming off of the menu because of other complaints. The waiter was great, the cashier people are pleasant...I love this location and the staff that runs it! HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

Food was very good and lots of different menu options. Was a little bit pricey, but the portions were good and filling. Service was excellent and our waitress was great. Good place to stop for breakfast.

My 2 children and I ate here on a Saturday at about 9:30. Despite their prime location on Michigan Ave, the wait was only about 10 minutes. We waited outside in the spring sunshine, looking at a sculpture of walking pairs of pants with nobody in them. Everyone we interacted with was very pleasant, and the food was A-MAZ-ING. I love eating breakfast out, and this place did not disappoint. Our server, Natalia, was very attentive, and was happy to accommodate some minor, kid-related substitutions. Fresh-squeezed juices, full coffee bar, and bacon galore! Can't wait for another trip to bring me back.

Excellent breakfast and attentive service. I had the Eggs Benedict, and it was quite good. It was accompanied by some sliced fruit, which was  surprise, but a welcome one. Don't hesitate to visit Yolk in the South Loop.

The yolk berry bliss is one of the greatest breakfast dishes ever for those seeking a healthy indulgence. Amazing berries, Greek yogurt, honey and we get a side of whole wheat pancakes (vs a muffin)  The score here is lower due to their coffee service. All the yolk locations have brown cane sugar at the tables and small cups for coffee. You can ask for Splenda but they are weirdly stingy about it and it is just plain weird and very annoying that they are forcing decisions and limitations on such an important and personal preference drink. It also delays the caffeine intake...you come in and they pour coffee. Then they hurry away (it's always super busy) and it sits until you can flag them down again to get sweetener...the cups are small so the coffee has cooled by the time you get attention.  I've started bringing my own Splenda  Not horrible but not stellar service or atmosphere. We love the one dish and come for that.

The menu is extensive, the food is great and the prices are reasonable, but don't expect to get In quickly during weekend brunch times. Wait times are long. It's loud inside, so you feel like you have to raise your voice to talk to the other people at your table. No alcohol is served, so forget about that mimosa. Also parking is almost non existent. Great food and good service, but that's pretty much it.
It just sucks to be strictly dominated by another rest'rant In case you can't tell the other restaurant is Wildberry. Go there.

This place was crazy busy when I came this past Sunday at 11am for breakfast. It took about 20 minutes to get table. The food was great and service was fast and on point. Our waitress checked on us on a timely manner, she had the pot of coffee ready as soon as we sat down. Portion size was large and worth the money. It was about the same price as dennys but better quality.

Our family was visiting and decided to try this because it was close to our hotel. We all had different versions of eggs and all dishes were really great. Bacon was thick, good quality, same with sausage. Orange bread french bread was unique and sweet. Omelette was very good, hash was great. Service was also very good. Highly recommend. We need a couple of these in Cleveland!
Longer wait compared to what they tell you. Had to  leave while everyone getting seated. Don't recommend yelp usage for this business
Great food and service Make sure to ask for Stephan as your server, her was awesome. Utilize the waitlist online it will cut down your way to tremendously.

I came to Yolk for a quick breakfast since I was craving Eggs Benedict. I substituted smoked salmon for bacon that came with it and in less than 3 minutes (yes, 3 minutes!) my plate was served. I wasn't sure whether to be happy or not since I feared food was not freshly prepared. But after trying the eggs made to perfection, I knew I was safe. The meal came with fruit and potatoes (a bit over salted). The addition of salmon cost me $2 extra, so the whole bill for the meal was around $22 with coffee. A bit pricey for my taste, but you can't beat the proximity to Hilton and the central location of this restaurant. Overall, good service and food, but a bit pricey.

A quick and delicious breakfast with fast friendly service. The menu was pretty standard. A step well above a diner, but not nearly as creative and interesting as my favorite gourmet brunch spots in New England. The atmosphere was bright and happy though. Also, everyone was friendly, making being a morning person, if you're not usually a morning person, a bit more agreeable!
Awesome place for breakfast. The food was delicious and they are fast and friendly. Great customer service here. I'll come back.

I have come here a countless number of times for breakfast. I absolutely love the food and all of the staff that works here. Everyone is so friendly and service is consistently great. I am so glad I live near this restaurant!
Great food, fast service once seated!  Make sure you check in online to get your name on the list, it's an extremely busy place!

This place is incredible! I make a point to eat breakfast here every time I am in Chicago. I ordered the South of the Border Benny on this visit. Everything was perfect, and the chorizo and chipotle sauce had the perfect amount of spice. Warning: I have a high tolerance for spicy food.  Not only is the food delicious, but the turnaround time is unbelievable. The food is made-to-order and the place was packed, but my friend and I waited less than 10 minutes for our food.

I have been eating here since they opened. Nice food, usually quick and efficient service and never disappointed with the food except that there is always more than I can eat. Can that really be a complaint though? The weekend brunch crush scene isn't very pleasant, but that is a result of their quality and success.

My fiancé and I have been here twice! Our first trip we did the sweeter side of the menu, and this current trip we went more savory. I wasn't a huge fan of the Hey Ricky omelet. I like my avocado to be much more present instead of smashed up into a food. The flavor was ok, but just not my thing. My skillet was also really greasy. I got the one with all the meat in it, but i still had to avoid the pools of grease at the bottom of my dish. The coffee (they serve metropolis) was a lot better the first time around. This last time, it tasted on the burnt/bitter side and I couldn't drink it. The service and wait time definitely get 5 stars. We've always been seated quickly, our server has always been pleasant and super attentive, and we've always gotten our food really quickly!  I enjoy the atmosphere here and the creative menu. I feel they rock their sweet treats a bit more than their savory ones overall.

Honestly didn't have the best experience here. Had read a lot of great reviews but didn't think it fulfilled the expectations. I got the cinnamon roll french toast and got 3 small pieces which I found to be super over priced. To add maple syrup it's 2 dollars! My friend got the omelette which was way bigger so fitting to the price. I felt like I was constantly asking for my coffee to be refilled. The staff was polite and friendly so no complaints there but overall it just seemed like a let down for how much we were paying and how long we waited. Would definitely look elsewhere for breakfast/brunch next time we are in town.
Above-average food, good customer service, but most importantly, it's BYOB.  Note: The No Wait app was definitely useful for this restaurant.

I'm not sure why this place is so highly rated? Our wait was longer than expected. We were told about 25 min which actually turned into 40. Once we sat down my coffee cup had pink lipstick all around the rim. I showed the waitress and she just grabbed the cup and tossed it in the dirty dish bin and walked away. She seemed mad at me because of it? We sat and waited a good 5 min before she came back. We ordered our food and she never came back. I had to ask another server for a coffee refill and someone else for ketchup. Our server never even brought the food to us. It was someone else. She did come back to give us the bill. Then we had to go up to the crowded front area where there was a ton of people waiting for a table and other people waiting to pay their bill. It was so unorganized. One person was checking out the entire restaurant so it took forever to just pay. I had the Blt with avocado. It was ok but my feta were cold. I was disappointed and I would not come back.
Delicious. Corn beef hash was home made and it was made perfectly. Even my eggs over medium was done perfectly.  Our waitress was attentive, but not overly.  Today's experience was great.

Yolk is a safe, solid place for brunch. Although I wouldn't come here to be amazed, Yolk never delivers a disappointing meal. While the omelettes are a bit on the expensive side, the portions are quite massive (there's 5 eggs in one omelette). I found that using the NoWait app is great for avoiding a wait (duh). Just place yourself in line about 30 minutes or so before you plan to eat.

Nice atmosphere and very clean. The food was great all around I had the Iron man omelette which lived up to expectations and the rest of the family was more than pleased with their choices too. The service was great and the server took extra care for my families food allergy.

This is a breakfast brunch place with a nice variety of breakfast and brunch dishes. There are some more affordable dishes like the omelettes that come with a ton of food and can be shared between two people and comes with options for pancakes so you can get sweet and savory. Apparently the grits aren't the best here so I stayed away from that. This can be an intimidating place to wait for a table so make sure you utilize the "wait in line" app through Yelp! This is not a place I'd seek out for breakfast since there's not a lot of unique items on the menu but it's great place to go to if you're in the area and looking for a solid breakfast.
Love the omelette here... Also, you can get egg whites without being charged I love that. The potatoes are delicious and the coffee is awesome:)

Come hungry. Surprisingly, my favorite part of my 3 eggs omelet dish was the side of fruit. It was refreshing to have fresh watermelon, pineapples, and sweet bursts of grapes to balance it all out.  I was looking at the Hey Ricky! 5 egg omelet because I really wanted avocados and chorizo. But thankfully, my husband noted there was a 3 egg omelet that was exactly the same but with a different name-El Torrero. The husband ordered the eggs benendict substituting the ham for smoked salmon which was delicioussss. Can't go wrong with this choice if you like eggs benedict. My only pout was the huge dollop of sour cream that sat on my omelet. I wish I had asked for it on the side. I also chose pancakes but wish I had asked for toast or an english muffin. There was so much flavor going on with the omelet, a less flavorful counterpart would've played better rather than sweet pancakes.

Fabulous service. Recommend getting your name in early with Yelp app on the weekend. That really helped us get table and decrease wait time. Love the strawberry orange juice. Gorgeous red velvet French toast for my daughter. I had standard eggs toast and bacon. Excellent. Other daughter had nutella crapes. Good coffee!  Great atmosphere. Thanks, Yolk!
We were out to yolk for breakfast, service was but slow. They were out of spoons oh well looked understaffed - all tables were occupied. Food was well prepared

We came on the public recommendation of a few of the Cubs players, who enjoy Yolk here and elsewhere. Fifteen minute wait at 11AM on a Sunday - thank you, nowait app. It isn't often that we are the oldest people in a restaurant, but that was the case Sunday. We can deal. Our server Annette was as attentive as she was attractive. In fact, all the staff was attractive - except for the dude running around behind the counter screaming at the cooks. Maybe that's by design. Maybe the food doesn't come out correctly otherwise. But dude might explode back there someday - I hope he doesn't.  Anyway, the food is everything you would think it would be. I followed a suggestion from Y L for the Croquet madam, which would be a Monte Cristo if it were swimming in butter from a Wisconsin diner. So, since it was not drowned in viscous fatty substance, it was the best Monte Cristo I ever had. Because I don't typically abide by boundaries, I looked at several other offerings by the people seated near us.  All of them LOOKED scrumptious! Go Cubs, and go to Yolk on South Michigan!

If I could give this more than 5 stars I would. My first time in Chicago & Yolk is right around the corner from my hotel. They were jam packed when we entered, we didn't mind waiting but they seated us within two minutes of waiting. Every waitress/waiter and hostess was attentive, with perk in their step. Our waitress gave knowledge about the menu and the specials that day, and their amazing strawberry fresh squeezed orange juice-definite try!! Background music was upbeat and we received our meal within what seemed like 5 minutes. My man got the pork belly Benedict which was the special that day and I got caprese benny, delicious pesto mozzarella atop your basic benny. All around bet breakfast I've had in a long time and wonderful experience. 4 thumbs up to Peter Chabot the manager and his wonderful staff! This place is a must
I come here every visit to  Chicago! Never disappointed at the service or food. Also just found out it was BYOB!!! Amazing...

Aesthetic is open with high ceilings giving a great vibe, with a 90's type of decor. Service wasn't the friendliest but prompt and professional nonetheless. Kale scrambler was absolutely delicious, fresh ingredients and cooked to perfection. Fair price for the amount and quality of food.

The perfect time to come is when they first open up. I came here before I went to work. I love the seats & the colors. Very high booths & very open. I ordered the steak & eggs, really good & tender. Everyone was really nice & helpful. I had been trying to get here & we finally came. We'll be returning again.

We got on the waitlist through yelp but it seemed like people who just walked in were being seated ahead of us. The volume was so loud that we couldn't hear each other at our table. The food and the service were basic but good.

Brunch is a key pastime for me and my friends on the weekend. Yolk is always our go-to place because of the menu selection, excellent service, cute scenery and BIG portions. You could honestly split many of the main plates with a friend and still be full. But most of the time we get our own cause we are selfish and the food is that yummy. Be sure to plan in advance as the line can get long during peak hours and you can't be seated until the whole party is there.  Everything I've eaten here has been delicious from the crepes, eggs Benedict, chicken and waffles, and omelettes. I didn't care too much for the skillet or ordinary plates you can get from other restaurants, but I can assure you everything here is as great as it looks!

Sausage links were cold and tasteless. Cheesy grits weren't good and were kinda dry. Over medium eggs were very runny. The ham on the eggs Benedict tasted like bologna. I couldn't eat it! I just picked the ham off. It was so gross! I had better potatoes the morning before at the free continental breakfast my hotel offered! Everything my friends and I ate here was gross. We won't be returning. Try eggsperience instead. That's my go to when visiting Chicago because the food is always so good!  I regret trying yolk.

I went with a few friends about a half hour after opening. The service was excellent--food arrived within 10 minutes of ordering. Water was refilled several times, as was the coffee. I ordered the chicken and waffles--highly recommended. I tried a friend's South of the Border Benny and it was also great. The portions are huge, maybe big enough to split with a friend.  Overall, it was a great experience, especially since we got there early. By the time we left, there was a sizable crowd waiting to be seated, so I can't speak for the wait time during peak hours.

The berry quinoa bowl is so delicious, and it's a huge and filling portion. I found the cheesy egg sandwich and potatoes underwhelming, but the pesto on the sandwich is a good touch. My friends and I ordered takeout on a Sunday morning around 11 am and it was the right move; the lobby was crowded and I heard the hostess mention a half hour wait.

A Chicago tradition for me. They have a huge menu and everything I have tried is always good and fresh. The staff is friendly and the service is great, even when they are busy. The portions are large and the prices are affordable. I will always return when I am in Chicago.
Delicious food for a great value! I got the el torero scrambler (which I couldn't even finish), grits, and pancakes for 11.50. Great service as well.

This review is based on my visit back in June 2016. It's very much delayed, but after just recently joining Yelp, I knew this had to be one of the first few places I had to review.  It was my first time in Chicago, and my friend and I were looking for places to eat breakfast, and man, were we glad to have found Yolk! Our server Christina made our experience 1000x better with her suggestions, friendly demeanor, and overall enthusiasm. We asked her for suggestions as it was our first time there, and we couldn't decide on what to order since everything looked amazing. She recommended that we try the West Coast Crepes, which were unlike anything we had ever tried before. The crepe itself was sweet, and the filling of avocado, mushrooms, and eggs was the perfect savory counterpoint. We also ordered the Classic Eggs Benedict, and while it wasn't as mind blowing as the crepes, it was a solid meal and perfectly balanced. The portions were more than enough as they are very generous with the fresh fruit and potatoes that were on the side with our meal. Christina checked in on us frequently, always making sure we had enough coffee and that everything was up to our standards, but without being overbearing or anything.  As for wait times, etc, we didn't have any issues getting a table right away, even though we went on a weekday around 9 or 10 am. The restaurant at the time was decently busy, but the servers and the kitchen had a nice flow going, so the wait time for the food wasn't long. Amazing and solid experience overall, and I would definitely come back again the next time I'm in Chicago (which I hope is soon!).

Croquet madam is the way to go. You don't be sorry. My experience here was very delightful. The staff is very nice and the service is efficient especially since I was going straight to the airport after brunch. Will definitely stop by on my next trip.
Can't say enough wonderful things about this establishment. Extremely professional phenomenal service and excellent food. If you are ever in the downtown Chicago area you must visit...

First time here and it wasn't busy- we came on a Saturday morning at around 9. All the workers were nice and welcoming and the food came very quick. Portion sizes are good, and I got the fat greek omelet. Definitely will visit here again
Good Breakfast but nothing superb. Toast was stale but eggs cook to perfection and the fruit was super fresh.
Just ok.  The french toast was nothing spectacular, i'd be willing to try again. The real maple syrup was a nice change of pace.
We had "the works" omelet and it was pretty good. The portions are huge, definitely difficult to finish solo unless you are very hungry.
There's always a line, but it moves pretty quickly.  Yolk is amazing for breakfast food, but the lunch items are equally worthy.  Try the chili!
Service was good and fast, love the decor. I had the homemade corn beef hash, and my guy had the Santa few frittata. Decent food nice amount. I would definitely come back.

I used the no-wait app so we didn't have to wait that long for a table on a busy Sat morning. The menu is kind of limited. I had the Yolk berry bliss and I thought it was average (it wasn't bad).  The strawberry orange was delicious though.

My family and I needed some breakfast waking up, so I decided we should go to Yolk, which was only a few blocks away from Essex. I was greeted with a friendly waitress as she led us to our table , everything smelled really good! I was craving something sweet and I went for the Challah French Toast, while my family got a mix of fruits, pancake, steak, and crepes.  We waited which really didn't take that long as the diner was pretty crowded. I got a bite of my French Toast and it tasted absolutely delicious, I recommend it with some fruit of course. My mom got the steak and it was a little over burnt as she did order a well done, but still edible. Everything else from the coffee to the strawberry orange juice like smoothie was yummy.  If you want a good full hearty breakfast, go here. I might say it might be a little on the pricey side which is because it's a diner, so for me it's a novelty, but if you can afford it, you should definitely go once atleast.
Food was excellent.  Service average. Had to ask for coffee refills and wait too long for the waiter to bring.

My breakfast was absolutely amazing.  A large space with tables filled and people waiting.  The wait time was only 15 minutes and they were turning tables fast.  I ordered the yolk special, which came with 2 eggs, bacon, and sausage with my choice of cakes or french toast.  Their french toast is made with Challah bread (my favorite).  Everything tasted great, The scrambled eggs however, must have been prepared and sitting in large batches.  they were "hard" on the outside as if they were sitting in an uncovered steamer of under a heat lamp.  It's not enough to deter me from returning.  They didnt try to go over the top with their menu items.  Also, a big plus for me is when places narrow down their breakfast selections to just unique out of the box "brunch" items.  Great place to go when you're downtown.

I don't rate things much so I hope this stays up.  I am confounded on how the staff stays up with the consistent volume here. They are AMAZING! Try me! Come here alone and sit at the bar and just watch the kitchen orders come out. Watch a server lift a tray for a table of ten like she/he is a damn superhero. During the summer they typically have a long wait so get here early or just be prepared for it. Maybe go next door for a massage. But this place is honestly one of the best breakfast/lunch places in the city.

A must for any tourist or Chicago resident. The quality of the food is fantastic. I had the belgian waffle with chocolate chips and they were absolutely delicious. The coffee is great too. My girlfriend had the omelette and she loved it as well, altough the portion is huge. I strongly recommend this place.

I had the corned beef hash. It was amazing. It was the freshest I've ever had. This stuff is clearly prepared onsite. I got a couple of pancakes on the side as well and they were pretty good. Everything was reasonably priced. I would definitely return here next time I'm in Chicago.
So delicious!!! Everything about yolk was fantastic! Super delicious coffee with raw sugar on the table, food was absolutely amazing, and very attentive class. Look forward to going there again!

Like other reviewers mentioned--expect a wait. Not a bad idea to get in line via mobile device before getting to the restaurant. But once you get to your table and order, food seems to appear almost instantly! My friend and I were both so surprised at how quickly a great meal was brought to the table.  I ordered the Very Berry French Toast, while my friend ordered the Nutella Crepes and the Benedict Caprese. The portions of all our orders were HUGE--definitely much larger than we expected given the reasonable price. We both came in pretty hungry and we're unable to finish the meal.  What I liked about the Very Berry French toast: they do not skimp on the berries, which I really appreciated. If berries are in the name of the dish, there should be more than a few on the plate. The toast was soft and not overly sweet. The added granola gave a nice texture to what is usually and overwhelmingly soft dish.  What I didn't love so much: the Greek yogurt topping. This might be a personal preference, but I didn't feel like the combination of yogurt on French toast made a lot of sense. It was very heavy and dominated my tastebuds, making me feel like I missed out on the actual French toast flavor. I would've enjoyed this dish more if the yogurt was on the side or even replaced with whipped cream.  Friend loved both of his dishes! Despite a very busy restaurant during prime brunch hours on Sunday, our waitress checked in us 5 times and was very friendly.  Would highly recommend Yolk if you're looking for a solid breakfast/brunch with traditional fare. Tons of seating and very family friendly!

I came here with a few friends while visiting Chicago. I LOVED the eggs benedict caprese. The food was cooked great and the breakfast potatoes were amazing. The house coffee was underwhelming at best. My biggest complaint was something small.. the fruit was served as a side to the eggs benedict on the same plate. I would have preferred a side plate or bowl so that the fruit doesn't mix with the hollandaise sauce etc. Overall a good brunch.

Holy cow this place is popular. We listened to the locals and got in line via the app while walking there. Even then, though, we waited a while. They were a bit backed up with the to-go coffee but they also seemed down a worker. Don't come here if you're claustrophobic. The waiting area and outside are packed and the tables aren't far apart. Even at the bar I kept feeling like we were in the way. Sitting at the bar was nice to watch the kitchen work and be up close with our waitress so I could hear her better. The portions are massive and delicious, at a reasonable price!

Really solid place for breakfast.   The wait was a little over a half hour but they use an app if you want to keep track of your wait.  I thought it really helped...I am not a big waiter for breakfast, I just assume grab anything but we were on a weekend adventure so we waited and it was worth it. The chicken and waffles were very tasty.  Mel got the eggs benny-good, but not great...something seemed less than excellent for a benedict.  Lots of fruit on the side-which was a nice touch. Not the best of the breakfast places but a place I wouldn't hesitate to return to.  Oh yeah, the coffee was very good.

Expect a wait but I love this place! Conveniently located in the South Loop and a 5 minute walk from the Roosevelt Orange Line makes it very accessible. I've been here a few times and everytime has been consistent and good. (Yes, places have messed up hard on breakfast food before.)  Anyways, I usually order The Works Skillet or South Benny. Both are delicious, flavorful, and filling. The Works is for when I'm not feeling heavy on spice as the South Benny has chorizo which then I usually douse in their Cholula sauce. I sometimes substitute one of the toppings in The Works for Canadian Bacon or something else. Topping it off with their gravy, man this plate is amazing! The South Benny is delicious with a nice spice kick from the Chorizo. Eggs benedict are made well with good Hollandaise sauce and just cooked well enough for the egg yolk to run over perfectly. The muffin is often seared a little to give it a nice crisp. Overall, a flavorful plate of breakfast food.  Definitely worth a wait here!

Great food and AMAZING SERVICE. Sat at the counter and everyone was so attentive. The bottomless coffee is actually good and they even gave me a cup to go! I'm southern girl and their biscuit is one of the best I've has north of the mason dixon. Highly recommend.
Always a great choice. Great omelets, French toast. Great service and food was served very promptly.
I ordered the potato pan cakes. They were like hash-browns except sweeter. I didn't like it. I wish I ordered something else. I'm sure they have better things here.

Food and service was great! The location is beautiful and clean.  I loeved all the food, but I didn't think the chicken and waffles was a 5 star.  I was really excitednto try them, but they were a bit disappointing.  I have had much better as far as that goes.  All the food was fresh and tasted good.
This place is awesome! I love the French toast here. Portions are large and all of the staff was very friendly.

Sitting right off of Michigan Ave in the South Loop. Yolk is definitely a breakfast spot to try while in Chi-town. Come around 7:30-8:00am to avoid a crowd. I tried their freshly squeezed strawberry-orange juice, which was simply divine. I was in a mood for cheesy grits and eggs so I ordered the protein and eggs combo with a side of cheesy grits. Food came out in less than 7 minutes. Cheesy grits were delicious. I didn't have to add anything to them (I'm a southern girl so if things are bland, I'm quick to add butter or sugar). Eggs were scrambled to perfect and I loved their turkey sausage.  This place gets 5 stars for me for the cheese grits, reasonable prices and friendly servers.

Delicious, clean, friendly. The coffee was very good and the Belgien Waffles were delicious. Plenty of coffee choices with added flavors. I had a very pleasant experience. Prices seemed very fair and the good was fresh. Yum

We've got a couple of Yolk locations in dallas, but I've never given it much thought. So glad my friend brought me to this place! Their brunch is pretty good and worth the wait. My group of four ended up only waiting about 45 min and we spent our time by walking around at the park across the street.  We all ordered something different. We had the blueberry banana pancakes, the red velvet French toast, south of the border benny, and the works omelet. The chorizo Benedict was so good! I think the only miss in our meal was the banana blueberry pancakes - they were the whole grain kind and came off tasting kinda like cardboard (my boyfriend enjoyed this one though).
The staff is very kind. The coffee good. The pancakes though were spongy and not particularly fluffy or tasty. A solid three stars.

To start I would highly suggest downloading the "Nowait app" before coming here. This app allows you to mark your place in line without getting to the restaurant and then having to wait there for an hour ( which you will end up doing here if you don't plan ahead). I received my text from the app letting me know my table was ready, as we walked by the 20 other people standing outside and the 10 standing inside waiting to be seated I approached the host and let her know I've received my text that my table was ready and we were sat in less than 5 min! We started with some tea (jasmine) and coffee (iced French vanilla) which were both great and then ordered our meals. The "all star" meal was honestly more than enough food and is great to get a little bit of a variety of everything (eggs, meat, French toast or pancakes). I got a omelet which was also more than enough and was given potatoes and pancakes. The food was amazing the service was great the environment is great for a Sunday afternoon. I would highly suggest this !
Couldn't ask for a better brunch. The Greek omelette is AMAZING, and we enjoyed their coffee as well. Great service too.

I used the No Wait App to get on the waitlist, and there was a 45 min on a Sunday morning around noon. The app didn't have the most accurate wait times, but called we were seated immediately once inside the restaurant. We ordered the California Omelet (amazing omelet, and a super good deal since it comes with two sides and pancakes are huge) and the smoked salmon scrambled eggs, which also came with two sides. It took longer than expected to get our food, which was kind of disappointing. Overall a good Sunday brunch experience!!

First thing's first - if you want to get a table on a busy weekend, use their waitlist app. We walked straight in and sat down ahead of so many people.  Food was phenomenal - service was top notch.  We had the Ricki omelet, corn beef hash, bacon waffle, and everything was delicious.  BYOB so bring some Champagne and make some mimosas!  Love love love!

French toast was really good, service was perfect, quick in and out.  Victoria G helped us out today. She was great. Very fast and never had to ask for a refill of our drinks. Everything I could want in a breakfast joint.
Soooooooo good. It's a long wait time usually but it's definitely worth it. They have the absolute best fruit and eggs by far and their orange juice is freshly squeezed. Highly recommend!!!

Food was really good, nice big portions, but  man was it NOISY. The only upside to the noise (from the club music and people talking over one another) was that it drowned out the sounds of the screaming, wailing children seated next to us. The place was also PACKED, but they have an app that allows you to secure your spot in line so I had no major beef with that. All in all, I'd come back for the food, but would not recommend for anyone looking to lose their hangover in a plate of bacon and eggs.

Amazing breakfast after a run. I did the skirt steak rare with poached eggs and they executed the dish perfectly. Even ate it before I had time to take a picture. My coworker I came with had the iron man omelette which looked healthy and delicious and he ate the whole thing so my guess it was...we came, sat and ate all within 40 minutes so they are nice and quick when you have a place to be! Definitely recommend Yolk, and will be back next time we come to Chicago!
Tons of brunch options - all were great. Try the cinnamon roll, it was amazing.

This is a great spot for a wonderful breakfast. They get you in & out quickly and efficiently. The food is great. (I wish they'd butter the toast). I have had breakfast here on Marathon Day for several years. They can handle my Huevos anytime.. (read their shirts)
