Ate here the morning after running the Chicago Marathon and this place was packed with runners. Despite being very busy our service was great, the food came out quickly, and was delicious not to mention huge! For a very fair price I got more than I could finish. In fact no one at my table could finish all their food! Highly recommended

First time there, first time to Chicago. The place was packed but we ended up being seated immediately. The service was impeccable. I ordered the Nutella crepe and my dad ordered the eggs Benedict - both were amazing. Highly recommend!!

This was the first restaurant my boyfriend and I hit up when we got to Chicago. AMAZING FIRST MEAL!  The wait: Download NoWait so you can add yourself to the waitlist without actually showing up at the restaurant first. We got to Yolk around 9:30 on Saturday morning and had to wait about 15-20 mins for a table. The restaurant is HUGE, and we had about 20 tables ahead of us, so 15-20 mins was pretty good. The service: Our waitress was really nice. When you're done, you take your check up to the front to pay. Very smart and cuts down on time! The food: Between me and my boyfriend, we ordered the strawberry-orange juice, countryside skillet, south of the border benny, and a side of corn beef hash. - Strawberry-orange juice: Freshly squeezed! Really good and refreshing! - Countryside skillet: this skillet is huge! You'll definitely get food coma after this, especially since it also comes with toast, english muffin, or pancakes. I opted for the pancakes and could not finish everything. Whatever comes in a skillet is always delicious in my opinion. This is loaded with ingredients and just super delicious. - South of the border benny: My boyfriend ordered this. He said it was pretty good, but nothing that memorable. The eggs were poached correctly, so that's a plus. - Corn beef hash: SOOOOOO delicious! This was cooked perfectly, with the potatoes cut into perfect bite size pieces.

This is a must stop for those out of towners such as myself. This is definitely a hopping place! Hubby and I went on a weekday around 9:00. Pros: We had a very minimal wait time. Staff was overall friendly but could have been a bit more attentive. The food was delicious! I squawked at the prices initially but it was totally worth it. I had the red velvet french toast and my husband had some kind of omelet skillet. Both of which were fantastic! Well worth the price Cons: I really didn't like the set up of the place. It was very open and the kitchen was right in the front of the restaurant in view of everything. The whole open concept made it extremely loud and very warm (we went in the summer on a hot day/couldn't distinguish between indoor vs outdoor heat). Turn up the AC. It was difficult to carry on a conversation without having to talk loudly. Tables seemed really close together. I understand wanting to fit in as many as you can but the wait staff could barely squeeze between some of those tables. Overall, we would return, perhaps in a cooler month.

Really like the loud atmosphere. Their food was amazing and my server was fast and courteous. I had the chorizo plate and it was delicious. A couple of tips. First use the "get in line" app and plan ahead. It gets quite busy. Second the place has no alcoholic beverages so that was a bust, HOWEVER, you can bring your own. BYOB, I bought small champagne bottles from nearby store and just ordered OJ and instantly I had my mimosas for a fraction of the price.
Good service, good food and great ambiance. Please put one in Hanover Park, IL - we are truly "hungry" for a great breakfast restaurant.

I had a bad dish,  but I appreciate that this place is probably pretty great.  I may go back tomorrow before I fly out and I'll update from there if so.  I got the west coast crepes and it was one of the worst meals I've had this year, if not the worst.  I'm not sure if they have 2 different crepe batters: one sweet for fruit/dessert fillings and one without all the sugar for the eggs and such.  But...I got the sweet and IMHO eggs and sugar sure don't go together like chocolate and PB.  It was gross.  I had to scrape the eggs and such out of the crepe and eat it like a scramble.  The potatoes with it are pretty great.    The couples on either side of me would agree the presentation looks FANTASTIC.  The first asked me about it and I was able to steer them away before ordering.  The next ended up ordering it, but asked to hold the cheese and it was served with cheese.  As he was getting ready to send it back, I let him know he may want to switch to another option and reorder something else unless he likes sweet eggs. Does anyone like sweet eggs?  Maybe it's me.   This place is HOPPING, they know how to handle the big crowds and they are hustling to make it happen for you.  I liked everything about it but the meal so I do want to give it another chance (but will not order the crepes!).

Came to Chicago for a long weekend to visit a friend who suggested we eat at Yolk. Hands down the best breakfast! I was super impressed how creamy the goat cheese was mixed into my scramble. There was a gracious amount of fruit as a side item. I love Yolk!

Ridic! Seriously. Okay, so I had the cinnamon roll French toast. Now, you need to love cinnamon. You also need to love cinnamon rolls. And, you need to love sweet. I mean insane sweetness. This was like a breakfast dessert like no other. It melted in my mouth and was a beautiful mix of cinnamon sweetness egg and syrup. It felt a lot like the scene where Will Ferrell was making his breakfast with the family in the movie Elf. It was that sweet but I felt like him because it tasted that good. The fresh orange juice was very good as well.  The service was very good. Be prepared to wait though. This is a very popular spot. It's well worth the wait, but you are likely going to wait. Atmosphere, quite loud. Hustle and bustle big open room with hard floors. Sound bounces around everywhere. But you don't mind though because the food is incredible. Would I go back? Absolutely. No question.

Went there this morning. Asked for chai latte instead the server gave me regular latte. And she kind of mocked me saying did u notice a difference. I mentioned this to cashier and all she said was oh ok...sorry. $5 for cup of latte that I did not order.  Would not go back there ever.  If there was an option I would give zero star

the granola with fruits and yoghurt served in a pineapple... is simply heaven after a morning workout. not a big fan of the inner decor, colours and the style BUT... the biggest of their breakfast and chai latte!!!
Arguably the best place in the entire state to get breakfast!!! If you go, brace for a decent wait time but hang in there, it's worth it!!!

Great breakfast at a great price. They offer good originals with their own twist. The pot roast eggs Benedict was delicious!! My cousin had the south beach, which is their yogurt served in a pineapple with fruit and nuts mixed in. Her hubby had the ham steak which he talks about all the time!. My hubby had the corn beef hash which he said was pretty good. Their side potatoes I could do with out as well as the waitresses tude. Still a must try!

It was good, they had a very wide selection and there was a ton of choices and something for everybody. It was incredibly reasonable. It's not a "must eat" and it's not sophisticated dining for chicago but it's good for what it is.
It was exactly what we wanted. The eggs were delicious as were the sausage and bacon. It was busy but we used the waitinline app and we were seated quickly when we arrived.

Great breakfast or brunch spot for omelets, challah French toast and multi-grain pancakes. Service is fast and friendly. Lines can be very long on weekends so plan to wait hours if you enjoy that type of torture. Smart folks dine here on weekdays instead to avoid long waits. This place has a high noise level which is the only negative. I dislike the noise level and don't understand why people talk so loud.  Bongo Room is quieter and has excellent thick French toast.

Pleased with the service. Tasty breakfast. Our table had a wide variety of items and all were delicious and tastefully presented. My only complaint would be that the bottle of water delivered to our table was actually hot. Not very refreshing. Berry French toast and Quinoa bowl excellent.

Excellent breakfast stop. Line out the door, don't let that deter you. Staff is super efficient. I had a seat in 5 minutes and my order was in front of me 2 minutes after ordering. Food was good, but I would rate that alone as a 4. It is superior service and friendly staff that gets this a 5.

On a Thursday afternoon, after a long flight, me and my friend were starving. Being new to Chicago, thanks to a little bit of research on yelp, we discovered Yolk which was only  just a few blocks away from our hotel.  As the name suggests, if you're an egg lover this is "eggsactly" the place to be (sorry for sounding so cheesy) . They have pretty much all kinds of eggs on the menu. Fried, poached, omelet, pancake, you name it. I ordered poached eggs with home fries, bacon, sausage along with chocolate milk. ( I know I'm very adventurous when it comes to breakfast)  The reason why I give it 4 stars is even though everything I ordered was pretty safe, there was some room for error like the bacon being over cooked or the chocolate milk not being cold. However, everything was done pretty much perfectly. Add to that the service was pretty good and the server was very polite. All in all a pretty satisfying meal.

Really awesome food and the service was great! We came here the weekend of Spring Awakening and had a party of 10. Our server handled all of us flawlessly and our food came out super fast! PLUS it's BYOB! So we popped bottles of champagne and ordered some glasses of OJ! Made for a really fun, awesome brunch!

Went today, had 45 minute wait. Was definitely worth it! We ordered:  the works omelet(with fruits as side), and nutty monkey pancakes!  We ate it all!  I loved how the peanut butter went with Nutella... And bananas for the pancakes!  So if you go, definitely order those two!  You will not regret it!   And I ordered, lemonade to drink. My mother ordered, coffee.  Best breakfast place, ever! Will be returning often! (Congrats, Yolk cafe... About having a customer, that will frequently come back ^_^!)

Incredibly brunch! Friendly staff, delicious food, cheery and bright atmosphere.  I've loved everything I've had here, but the Red Velvet French toast was definitely a highlight. It comes out stuffed with frosting and is completely incredible.  All the savory entrees are also great though -- I would highly recommend going with someone else you can split a savory and sweet and not miss out.

We just moved to Chicago almost 2 months ago and we have been to Yolk so many times we have lost count. It is one of our favorites to take people too, fast, popular, delicious. Get the no wait app and put your name down before heading over. Only downside is they are not open for dinner.

The hubby and I went to visit Chicago and I love to Yelp for new restaurants. We visited from California.  However, Yolk! Was one of my favorite breakfast place, we went twice during our visit. The first time I just ordered typical breakfast, stuffed french toast. It was delicious. My hubby in the other hand he ordered an omelette with s'mores pancakes on the side. He absolutely loved. It was something different that we had not tried back home. The next time we went. I ordered an omelette, I forgot what it was and it was delicious!! This time my hubby ordered the red velvet cinnamon roll. Let me just tell you. They were perfection. They were not too sweet it, it did not even need syrup. I recommend you to try them. I wish they would open one back home.

Use the Nowait app. Makes a Saturday morning breakfast enjoyable. Loved the caprese eggs benedict - excellent pesto and well poached eggs. Large portions could be shared. Only downer, coffee tasted old. Was glad I had Starbucks while waiting for a table.
Foods ok, interesting combinations, but be prepared to sweat! It is hotter inside this restaurant then outside! And it's 80 and humid outside.

In my opinion this place was just a meh. When we arrived we were waved to follow a man, the menus were tossed on the table and we got a "you can sit there" as the guy walked away. I almost walked out at that moment... seriously? When our waitress arrived, she was very nice and attentive and took our orders. My husband ordered the chicken and waffles which ended up being rather dry and the gravy... ugh! Come to the South and learn how to make this southern dish! I had the California Omelet which was just okay, but was extremely unappetizing to look at when it arrived. Sorry this was a miss for me.

Service is great! We got several items and shared, so the chicken and waffles are delish, the red velvet French toast is to die for and the breakfast wrap is the bomb! It's a little loud and the temp in the restaurant was a little too stuffy but really loved the place!

I will make a point of visiting this restaurant every time I am in Chi-town. I stayed over at the hotel right next to Yolk and so it was a no-brainer to come here for breakfast. On a Friday morning at 11AM, the place was packed and there was a 15 minute wait to get our table.  We ordered the cappuccino egg benedict, smoked salmon scrambler, and the omelette crepe. All the items were impeccably good and the service was quick and great. Please open a branch in NYC!

You guys, NYC is behind the times. The No Wait App is ingenious!! (We also used it at Wildberry.) My friend lives around the corner from Yolk so we put in our names on the app and we walked over when our table was ready after 30 min. AMAZING. The place was huge, especially with its open kitchen. There's a multitude of seating from tables, booths, and bar seating. Loved the adorable Yolk logo everywhere! The Caprese Eggs Benedict was decently sized with a side of potatoes and fruits. (I didn't like my fruits mixing with my eggs so if you're like that too, ask for the fruits on the side!) But our favorite was the Berry Surprise French Toast. It was such a ginormous portion (6 half slices of toast) with lots of fresh berries, perfectly crispy granola, and fluffy cream piled on top. So delicious!! Solid spot for brunch, especially if you don't have to wait!

My friends and I were on vacation and we were looking for a tasty yet affordable place to could eat breakfast and came upon Yolk! The server Katie was amazing. She was receptive to our needs and knew a lot about the menu which meant a lot to us out-of-towners. The food was very delicious as well as affordable. If you're in Chicago you should definitely check this place out.

Yolk seems like a must-do for locals and tourists. At 11am on a Monday, this place was packed. I couldn't imagine Sunday brunch! It's BYOB and State Street is the closest place to grab some bubbly. The menu is intense. After minutes of scrutiny, I went with the Santa Fe Frittata with a side of pancakes. Yes, pancakes! I was thrilled to not have to pick between sweet and savory.  The prices seemed a little high...until I saw the portions. It's a huge meal. Come hungry, prep for a food coma or anticipate leftovers.  The avocado was a little hard to find in my frittata but the flavors of everything else blended well together, especially the melty cheeses. My husband really enjoyed his challah French toast with berries and corn beef hash.  The service was adequate. They were busy so that's fair.    Yolk is all it's cracked up to be.
Yolk is a perfect place to chat and enjoy brunch with your friends~

Delicious brunch! Use the no wait app if you are going to go on the weekends, then the app is a life saver! I was here visiting, and boy am I glad that friend who is a local told me about it. We got the corned beef hash, Lox plate, meat plate,  pancakes, French toast, and chai tea. Everything was good! We are spoiled in Detroit with very delicious corned beef hash, so nothing can't compare. Yolk's was still very good just a bit greasy.  I would have to say my favorite was the lox plate because there was a good ratio of salmon, tomato, onion, and capers. I would suggest asking for more cream cheese for your bagel too. Definitely will be back on our next trip!

Great breakfast on a Sunday am in Chicago.  Friendly fast service. Hot tasty food - bacon was excellent! OJ was huge and reasonable. Right across from Grant Park and easy access to Field Museum and Soldier Field.

Delicious food. My Patty Melt was fantastic ... temperature-hot and tasty.  Fries were excellent, too (well done but not too crispy ... just like I ordered them.) My tablemates loved their egg dishes. Fresh fruit was high-quality. Can't wait to come back.
Amazing brunch food with a myriad of options and combinations. Also a nice, clean, large, and well-lit restaurant. Would definitely go back to try more dishes on the menu

Menu: Very good selection. Unique combinations.  Vegetarian dishes are notably marked.  Portions are hearty. French toast was so fluffy! Sausage links were huge, not the typical skinny ones.  Service: Greeted right away, coffee offered right away, waitress came back frequently to check on us.  Conclusion: Something for everyone on the menu. A safe bet that anything you order will taste decent. It's just real loud here.

I LOVE breakfast food and have tried a ton of places around the city.  Unfortunately, Yolk doesn't hold a candle to places like Kanela or Bongo Room.  I ordered a Mediterranean omelette with feta and spinach.  The side of potatoes were great but the omelette itself was watery and really nothing special.
Great Sunday breakfast across the street from Grant Park.  We got right in at 8:30.  Food was delicious. Service was fast and great also.   We will be back.

We are visiting here from San Diego and I was quite impressed.  We got here right at opening and everyone was prepped and ready to go. Everyone in here has been upbeat and friendly, and our waitress was polite, informative and attentive. She checked in on us frequently and kept our beverages fresh and available (p.s. Try the strawberry orange juice!).  I tried the south of the border Benedict, which was delicious! Pretty spicy chorizo which I like, great hollandaise sauce and perfectly poached eggs. It came with fresh fruit, which I love, but it comes on the same plate, which is not ideal for me. Still the fruit was fresh and delicious, the meal was a great portion which was very filling.  Overall I was very pleased with this place and I would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a great breakfast!

I had no wait going in at about 8 am. The food was fantastic and well priced. It's like iHop price for better quality food than iHop. Their strawberry orange juice and lemonade is also bomb. Even the presentation of the jams is cute and clean. I love it.

Had brunch here on a Monday morning. Very crowded, even on a weekday. Everything was great, though.  The chilaquiles tasted great but had no visible sauce.... Coffee was good. Greeter and wait staff did great jobs.
Very delicious sandwich.  Had the yacht club.  Waiter was excellent and food came faster than I expected with no decrease in quality.  All in all fantastic :)

One word....delicious. Went to this location today for breakfast...thinking we'd beat the brunch crowd.Clearly its the other way around because it was a 30 min wait....which wasn't too bad especially since it was exactly 30 mins....but I realized that after 11 the crowd waiting had thinned out so next time maybe I'll do late morning or early afternoon. Got the chicken and waffles with no sausage gravy.....the chicken was cooked well and I appreciated that it was boneless.....don't understand eating chicken and waffles with chicken wings but I digress. The waffle was pretty thick and the little container of syrup was enough. The bestie got the York All Star Combo....she enjoyed it and was glad we came; not a fan of trying new places but said this was better than the place she initially had in mind. Frank the hostess was great and so were our two waiter/waitress who tagged team the table. Pretty efficient ran operation I would say. Would definitely go back!

Great food and not as pricey as I thought it would be. The omelettes are a fantastic deal for the quality. My peanut butter and chocolate pancakes were delicious. Speedy and friendly service. Loved it.
These guys don't skimp, the line moves fast, and the service is on point... but if you come on the weekend, its still going to be a serious time commitment.

I came here three consecutive days on my trip to Chicago. Attentive, friendly service and huge portion sizes. I recommend the chicken & waffles; one of the better ones I've had living on the West Coast and Midwest! I also had the salmon scramble and quinoa bowl. Also incredibly delicious and extremely filling. Don't be discouraged by the large crowds; the service is very quick.  The women's bathroom is also very clean, if that matters to anyone.

The service at this location is amazing and the food is very good. This location is always consistent and I recommend it highly. It can be quite busy on the weekends but trust me, it's worth the wait. The Manger During the week named Peter is very nice and friendly too.

Yolk is always busy and for good reason! It's my wife and i's favorite brunch spot. Their chicken and waffles are huge, their pancakes have fresh fruit, and their omelettes are delicious as well.  Make sure to download the NoWait app to start waiting in line before you arrive!

I absolutely love Yolk, especially this location! The servers there are so delightful and wonderful. The food is just perfect and their mimosas are to die for. By far, one of the best breakfast places in Chicago.

Absolutely delicious! Download the NoWait app to avoid waiting in line. Their chicken & waffles are huge and super filling, their nutty monkey pancakes feature fresh banana slices, and their benedicts rock!

How would you enjoy your breakfast, if you are dripping sweat into your omelette? It was so ridiculously hot there that none of us could eat our food and we all had to get outside into 80plus degrees weather, which felt cooler than inside. And the best part was that when we addressed how uncomfortably hot he restaurant was, the genius at the front replied "yeah, I know, its summer"   Really? How did we fail to notice? The Yolk is packed every day, so they definitely make more than enough $$$ to provide their customers with an appropriately cool environment during July weather in Chicago.  But it doesn't appear like the want to.

Love this place for breakfast or brunch.  Entree options are delectable.  Almost too many great options to chose from.     Everything under the breakfast sun is available.  Decor and atmosphere was very nice.  Yummy!

The wait = ridiculously long (90 minutes).  Tip: come extra early or after 12pm Menu= average, nothing extraordinary ... but the Red velvet French toast was Awesome!  Tip: get the Red velvet toast In summary, it wasn't a bad experience but I probably wouldn't go again. I give it 4 stars because the Red Velvet French Toast really was amazing.

Going to this restaurant me and my partner had high expectations because we have heard much about it. When we got there it was ridiculously hot. Upon glancing at the menu they seemed to have many options so we were excited. The server seemed to be in a hurry to take our order forgetting that the experience is just as important, if not more than the food itself. I ordered the El torero scrambler and my partner chose the smoked salmon scrambler. The food came out relatively quickly. The el torero and the smoked salmon both were small portions, lacked taste, and just looked unappetizing in general. The server failed to check up on how we were doing and when we finally caught her attention for a refill she said that she would get us the water. After about 20 minutes she sauntered over and sarcastically said," Oo looks like you guys need some water." The pancakes also ended up tasting like cardboard and were extremely dry. All around I would not recommend anyone to ever go here.

This place had some awesome food. The wait was about 35 min and we were able to leave our name and number and then be texted when our table was ready. The service was great and servers were very courteous.  My family and I had the el toreo scramble, salmon and eggs combo with fruit and pancakes, kale scrambler with pancakes, and finally the smoke salmon scrambler with pancakes. It was all delicious and very filling.  Definitely going on my list of places to return to.

We loved this place!  I honestly can't get past the first thing I ever ordered: a build your own scrambler with avocado, bacon, onion, and cheddar.  It's perfect for me!  I was really impressed with the huge fruit portions: a big slice of watermelon, a ring of pineapple, two juicy orange slices, and a bunch (literally) of grapes.  Plus, you can choose between toast or pancakes (both are good).  We opted to BYOB (champs) and I appreciated that they didn't charge us extra for that (to my knowledge at least).  Quick, friendly service.  I will say, we came at about 2:15 pm (they close at 3:00 pm) and I felt a bit rushed by our server.  She was nice, but hovered until we ordered.  We'll be back!

A friend and I planned on getting brunch. We originally were planning on going to Chicago Waffles (down the street), they have week day specials that I like. Changed locations after my friend said she wasn't a huge fan of Chicago Waffles, so I thought I would try Yolk since I'd seen the restaurant a lot, with huge lines at their more central locations.  I got the Benedict Caprese. It was more than enough food, the favors were alright (nothing too unique). The potatoes were a little salty. What stood out the most were the fresh juices - I LOOOVEDD the grapefruit and orange blend.  The only reason I would choose to come back to this location specifically is because my server was AMAZING - super friendly, fast service, and checked in on us frequently.  Would I come back? Sure, but I would probably order something else.

Without a doubt the best place we ate on our stay in Chicago. We showed up right around noon & even though they were super busy we were seated right away & our server immediately greeted us & took our order. The food came out quickly & we received our ticket as soon as we were done eating.  The food was superb & worth the price. The restaurant was clean, brightly lit, & the staff was super friendly.  I absolutely recommend that anyone looking for good breakfast or lunch food check this place out.
A-m-azing food here not too pricey either definitely a must have in Chicago...definitely a daily competitor for my breakfast cravings lol

A M A Z I N G place for breakfast/brunch! The pot roast Benedict is go good and I had a bite of the red velvet French toast and literally fell out of my seat of how good it was! Great fast service... Just go earlier we went around closing time and felt rushed and pushed to get out.
This is an amazing place like a well oiled machine. We were seated at the bar waited a total of two minutes. Enjoyed the food especially the Santa Fe fertata, would highly recommend this place

I have learned...When you are in a strange city, and want to know the ins and outs of where to go in the City for breakfast ... You hit up the hotel housekeeping staff. And according to Marilyn, that place is Yolk. On our second attempt to eat here, it was a success. The first attempt had a wait time of almost an hour, and we just couldn't fit that in, our growling stomach's and busy schedules simply wouldn't allow for it. (Monday, on 4th of July, at 11am) The second attempt we walked in and our family of 7 was seated right away.(Tuesday at 9am)  I had a water to drink, our kids had no complaints about the chocolate milk.  My son got the strawberry orange juice, I tasted it. I do have to rave for a minute about the strawberry orange juice.  GET IT!  Seriously!  You will not be disappointed.  It is so freaking good. I want more. Like right now, as I am remembering it.... I got the corned beef hash, over medium eggs, white toast. This was definitely NOT canned, fried CBH like at other establishments.  This was actually corned beef... Like pulled beef shreds, onions, peppers, and potatoes. The flavor was out of this world. It was the best CBH i've ever had... And that's one of my favorites to order So, i've eaten plenty of it. I also tasted the Oreo pancakes, and the smores pancakes (because I am a mom and It's a perk of having to cut up everyone's food)  And they were both also heaven on a plate. I can not adequately express how much I enjoyed this restaurant. The food is so good, and you get a lot of it. You just have to take my word for it, and go. We went to the Shedd, Field Museum and Sky deck while in Chicago... I asked my significant other what the best part of Chicago was...he said "Yolk". I happily agreed with him.
Best food and a lot of it. Had biscuits and garvey with side of two eggs any way you want and taste just I would make at home. We will visit again next time in Chicago.
Very efficient service. Clean, fast paced, well organized restaurant. Food was good but not great.  The service was the outstanding part of this meal.

There was no wait, arrived around 9am. The atmosphere was a little loud but ok. It's spacious. The hostess and waitress were great. The food was great as well, had the kale eggs, potatoes, wheat toast, and turkey sausage (wish they had chicken sausage).
One kids meal was more than enough for two kids. Huge portions. Very good. Fresh fruit for a side. Reasonably 'ok coffee. Large juice selection. Pricey but worth it.

This is simply not fair that I have to leave Chicago and not eat here again.   I came here with a party of seven; I ate the Torero omelette but by virtue of children who were not hungry enough I also partook of the eggs benedict, the corned beef hash, and the s'mores pancake, with sides of bacon and pancakes. Each and every aspect of eating this food is an exquisite experience: the smell, the flavor, the texture, the satisfaction of eating, the desire to immediately bathe your taste buds in another bite of whatever it is you just swallowed.  Even the orange slices were next-level delicious. One thing I would not recommend is the coffee, especially if you first spend the morning drinking Peet's and have accustomed your mouth to THAT, the coffee here is thin and metallic, and out of place among the unbelievably scrumptious food. But yeah, among all the things I got to enjoy about Chicago in my latest visit, Yolk is a highlight among highlights.
Got right in and enjoyed, not overly impressed. I will had we got they at 2:35 not knowing they close at 3. Our waiter was delightful.

This place was busy but worth the wait. I ordered a buffalo chicken wrap with fresh fruit and a  raspberry lemonade. The buffalo wrap was amazing. The chicken was cooked perfectly and the other ingredients only helped the meal. The fruit was fresh and somewhat unexpected. I got an orange slice, strawberry, grapes, and a huge slice of watermelon. The raspberry lemonade is something I wouldn't recommend. It was sweet and almost as if they made it and forgot to put sugar in it.
Nothing to write home about. I had the yogurt, berries and pancakes. Pancakes were not very good at all. Not worth eating unless you really need the extra calories.
Great food!  You can avoid the crowds if you get there early. You get big portions too. but it is a little pricey for breakfast. So I have to give 4 stars.

We are visiting and decided to try Yolk for Sunday brunch. I ordered the chicken and waffles. I really don't have anything to compare it to but it was pretty good. This place is packed and loud. So loud that when my daughter asked for butter the waitress brought peanut butter instead. Both girls got the combo. The bacon was under done and so was my daughters over medium eggs. Not sure I would come back.

Really disappointed with this place. First, we used an app to get on the list and didn't have to wait more than 5 minutes which we great. They sat us, then 10 minutes later, sat the 5 tables surrounding us with one family. They kept shouting over us and getting up, standing at the edge of our table and yelling to each other. Most things I can ignore, but this was insane. The restaurant should not have sat a huge family party surrounding another table. We had to ask them to move us, and had to pick up all our drinks and stuff and transfer tables so the family could be together. That huge party had to be on the list awhile so Yolk could have thought ahead a bit. Anyway, on to food. By no means would I go here again. Their fruit was flavorless, and my meal the West Coast Crepes was the worst breakfast I've ever had and I'm of the opinion that it's very difficult to mess up breakfast. They were very small and I still couldn't choke down half of them. The crepes were meant for a dessert option- they were incredibly sweet and normally I'd love that, but paired with eggs was not the right combo at all. It made it sort of sour and taste like an ingredient was going bad. Needless to say, I left hungry. Also, servers were so busy they never asked how things were or took notice I hadn't eaten a thing on my plate. Everyone else's meals were okay, no rave reviews, no big complaints from them. I will not be back.

Came here on the advice of a friend and glad I did. It was a little noisy but the ambience was fun and upbeat. Service was great and the food even better. Had the caprese Benedict, a great twist on a classic. Coffee is tasty and the food came out fast, even though it was busy. Worth the trip.
Hated the long wait but the food was very good. I ordered a skillet and pecan pancakes. It was delicious. All good stuff here.

Go on a Tuesday, our wait was minimal. Waitress was great and food was very tasty. Portions are probably too big so you ate more than you probably should have. Consider splitting. Kids plates were as big as adult plates at most places. However, the menu is not overly creative. Good value for the area, great place to take young kids.

Don't be scared off by the wait line at this place. When you walk in, just push your way up to the counter to get on the list. The first time we tried, it was so packed we didn't know how to even get our name on the list. But beware, they might overlook you (they overlooked us), so check back in if you're been waiting a long time. We almost walked out, but were so hungry we decided to wait. We are so glad we did! They'd get 5 stars if they hadn't forgotten us and made us wait so long. Hubby and I booth had the smoked salmon scramble with fruit and pancakes and coffee to drink. All of it was fabulous! They didn't scrimp on the salmon and the fruit was slices of watermelon, pineapple, and oranges. The coffee was amazing and they have Truvia for their sugar substitute on the table. We rarely find Truvia in restaurants because it is more expensive. We will definitely be going back again later this week.

I looooove this place! The french toast reminds me of my mother's. Annnd out of all the years I've frequented here, I've never had a less than great meal. Not too fancy, extremely fast service, uplifting atmosphere, and definite deliciousness.

The food here comes out incredibly fast, and it is the definition of fresh flavor. I got the El Torero egg scramble with chorizo, avocado, tomato, cheese, sour cream and salsa with sourdough and potatoes on the side. I'm from out of town and everyone I know who's from Chicago recommends Yolk so highly - and it's with good reason.  The only thing I would say is to ask for sour cream on the side - they went a little heavy on it. I also would probably skip the potatoes next time, and go for the fruit. The fruit looked really good and the eggs are so substantial that I think fruit would have provided a good balance. I'm not a pancakes person, but if you are, pancakes in lieu of toast on the side is still $11 which is a killer deal. Either way, I really appreciated the freshness and speed of the food at Yolk as well as the options to customize your meal with a couple of different options.
Pretty decent breakfast joint. Friendly staff and an expansive menu.

Great spot for breakfast! Pancakes were phenomenal and the Santa Fe Frittata was awesome! Also tried the Eggs Benedict-  if you like your yolk runny, you need to request it as the yolk comes pretty cooked. I would definitely eat here again!

This restaurant is a very busy restaurant! The wait for all customers was about 20 to 30 minutes. However, if you use the app your wait time could potentially be shorter. The food was fresh and never lacked in taste. The fruits that come with the meal was also very fresh. Although this restaurant was busy, the service was remarkable!

The food here is pretty good, but the wait gets crazy, and the staff is not always all the organized in dealing with people. The "host stand" is just a guy standing there and directing people. I had the chilaquiles and added chorizo, and it was great. The last time I went, I had the kale & goat cheese scrambler with a side of banana pancakes, that was good but not great because the cheese was not well distributed. My boyfriend has the Santa Fe frittata and seemed to enjoy it. It was a large, individual frittata and looked yummy.

Yesterday, I was in Chicago for majority of the week and decided to go to Yolk.  OMG!  It was one of the best breakfast I ever had.  This place is a must visit!  I had the CHILAQUILES VERDE House made corn tortilla chips, salsa verde, avocado, jack cheese, red onion, crema.Topped with two eggs any style |10.5 Add chorizo |1 Add chicken |2.5.   I decided to get it with chorizo.  First off, the portion is large and although I was full, I couldn't stop eating.  The homemade tortilla chips with egg, avocado, chorizo just melts in your mouth.  I cannot wait until I'm in Chicago again.  Also, the service was EXCELLENT, we sat right down, no wait and the food came out soon.   There were three other people with me.  Total our bill was $60.  We all were full and happy!

I was really excited to have breakfast at Yolk while I was in town for a conference. Unfortunately, my breakfast was incredibly sub-par. I created my own scrambler which came with red potatoes and I opted for an English muffin over toast or pancakes. Everything was incredibly bland and not noteworthy. The English muffin wasn't even that good.  The service was great - everyone who came into contact with me was kind and pleasant.  If you're looking for a good breakfast with flavor, go a couple blocks West to The Bongo Room instead.

This place is lit. Unbelievable breakfast food! Great staff, from hostess/cashiers to servers. Food came out fast and hot. Greatest omelette I've ever had. My 18 year old daughter says its the "greatest brunch place of all time." South Beach yogurt pineapple with honey was awesome.

We were in town and had a not-so-hot experience at another brunch spot down the street. After looking forward to eating my way through our Chicago trip, I have to admit, I was worried that maybe The Windy City just didn't know how to brunch. WELL friends, that was all blown away when I bit into my Croque Madam. I tried the fiance's chicken and waffles and loved that, as well. The coffee was also awesome! What's not to love?!  Given it was a Sunday morning, it was busy. Still, we only waited for ten to fifteen for our table and the food came out quick! Our server was attentive, polite, and sweet.  Yolk, I see you have a few locations in Chicago... Why not expand out to California?! Please?

We stopped in here for a late brunch around noon on a Friday. We had no difficulty getting a table (although I've seen waits of over an hour on the weekends). Service was quick and friendly. I ordered the cinnamon roll french toast, which I've had several times and loved. The side of pork sausage was flavorful and perfectly cooked. The nutella crepes were quite good, although it took a bit of hunting to locate the nutella (the outer reaches of the crepe didn't have any!).  Two complaints: the waffle in the fried chicken and waffles was pretty bland. It was basically a chicken delivery vehicle, and the chicken didn't need it. (Note, the chicken is also basically a giant fried tender, not a full traditional chicken breast.) The other problem... ANTS! I repeatedly had to flick ants off our table. Honestly, that didn't bother me very much but it's probably not a great sign for the restaurant's cleanliness...

I sat at the bar and ordered the homemade corn beef hash and eggs and got my eggs done over easy. This was the only thing that stood out to me here on the menu. The corn beef hash is very good and I would definitely recommend this. The hash was cooked perfectly and in nice bite sized with peppers and onions. I also got the strawberry orange juice but it was too sweet for my liking and not fresh. (It comes out of a jug). Not a bad place for brunch though.

This was a lovely little breakfast place with a nice and bright atmosphere. The menu is impressive and the food was delicious. They offer everything from omelette to crepes to pancakes. I definitely will be returning!
Service was fast, waitstaff was attentive. Their food was served quickly and it was good. I had their two eggs with bacon and pancakes. It was enough for two people. Their coffee was really good too.
Great American food, lots of options, many vegetarian.  Quick service, but make sure you check in on Nowait app early as it's very popular.  Great price for what you get too.

My friends and I stopped by yolk on a Monday morning and we were seated immediately. Is it just me or does the decor remind you of an ihop but a little nicer? The service was great and the the food came out SOOO fast. We were impressed. I had the pot roast Benedict and the pot roast was so tender and delicious. I know their hollandaise sauce is something they're known for but I thought it was kind of bland. Also the side of fruit that came with my meal was covered in it. But it was bland so I ate my cantaloupe covered in hollandaise sauce and didn't ebb notice a difference. Make sure you order their strawberry orange juice and get a large. It's delicious and refreshing. Also their CHILAQUILES VERDE was BOMB. I'd skip the Benedict next time and just order that.

If you're looking for a great, filling breakfast spot look no further. This is my favorite breakfast restaurant in the city. The Santa Fe Frittata is my favorite dish! I sub the bacon for chicken because I do not eat pork. The chicken is always great. I've tried a few different pancakes and they are always a sweet, delicious treat.

Probably the most unique and expansive breakfast menu I've seen in a long time. I wish I could have tried everything. I settled for the quinoa bowl and I was very satisfied. I can't wait to visit again.

If u are visiting Chicago or if u are going to a convention at McCormick Place - then u should stop by here at least once. Great options and great portions. When some relatives from China were in town for a conference - I took them here to see what an American breakfast could be like. They lived the variety and the different styles. We were all waking away stuffed and happy.

Fabulous assortment of breakfast foods!  Staff sooo nice!  Do not miss!!!my 13 year old granddaughter, daughter and I all loved it.  It is EXTREMELY noisy due to absolutely no sound absorption materials!  But for fab food it's super!

Monday morning. First time customer. Ordered chicken and waffles. $15+ without drink. Chicken was so overcooked that calling it jerky would be kind. Waffles were gummy and so dry I could barely swallow them. The whole thing was SMOTHERED in so much gravy  you could not see the chicken. Once I tried to eat the chicken I understood why.  Waiter noticed I was not eating it. He asked me why and I told him. He apologized, and asked me if I wanted  something else. I told him no because I had a time limitation. He then presented me with the check... I asked him if I really had to pay for something that I did not eat because it was inedible. Then I received the " let me get my manager". Manager decided that I didn't have to pay. What a relief... I'm writing this in my Uber as I go back to my apartment. This was 45 minutes of my life that I'll never get back. Avoid.
Great service and open early.  Would reccomend the Ironman breakfast.  Close to the park and hotels.  Coffee good and strong and open kitchen created a god vibe..

Potato Pancakes are big!  The soft texture of the ground potatoes on the inside of the pancake with the crunch on the outside give them a perfect contrast.  Make sure to smother them in the applesauce provided.

We went here after we had already eaten at Wildberry and in our opinion, Yolk is the loser in the breakfast battle. We didn't have to wait at all and service was OK. The French Toast was mediocre and the banana-blue crunch cakes tasted like the whole-wheat Aunt Jemima mix. They were dry and just meh. Maybe we ordered wrong?? We did see some dishes come out that looked good.

Staff is so friendly! Place is bright and vibrant with a great atmosphere. I went with my boyfriend and it was only a 5-10 minute wait @9:30 am on Saturday. We had the chicken & waffles and the country skillet...AMAZING! Will be back!

I went here for breakfast on a Sunday morning. The wait time was an hour and a half. Since the place is so popular, I thought the food would be AMAZINGGGGG! Eh, not so much. It was okay, but it didn't stand out. I ordered an iced coffee and their version of the all-star special. The waitress asked me if I wanted 100% maple syrup with my waffle. Sure - why not? I had no idea it was a $2 up-charge until receiving my bill. I didn't have a problem paying the additional fee, but it would have been nice to know upfront. My meal was meh and kind of cold. I ordered my eggs fried medium - they were super runny. My bacon wasn't crispy. My waffle was delicious, but everything else - meh. I'm not sure if I'd try this place again.

Visited this place for breakfast while in Chicago and it was delicious. We arrived around 11am, and was told there was a hour and a half wait as it was people out to the street waiting! Luckily, our hotel was right down the street so we put our name on the list and then went back to the hotel. This was fine since they send you a text when your table is ready.  I chose the Pancake all-star and everything was good. The other people in my party enjoyed their food as well. They weren't too pricey, which was good for the quality of food that you get here. They have an option to 'upgrade' to 100% pure maple syrup instead of the high fructose corn syrup stuff for $2. I can see why they get slammed.
Very Yummie breakfast! loved the Mexican breakfast tortilla, so fresh and spicy!!! and did I mention the crossiants . Make sure to grab one on your way out
Even if it's a bit of a wait, don't feel deterred. The skillet is more than worth it. At least when I was there, it was an upbeat atmosphere.

Probably my favorite breakfast in Chicago. I loved this place and can't wait to go back. We went on a sunny Sunday morning and there was a bit of a wait but it was nice so sitting outside was fine. Once we were seated our waitress was very on point with drinks and taking our orders. I opted for the California Omelette which I will highly recommend right now. It was made perfectly and was very flavorful. I'd be hard pressed not to order it again. Potatoes came with it and I requested a side of hollandaise sauce because I am a bit of a sauce nut. It complimented the potatoes well.  I thought this place was awesome. The decor was bright and colorful and made you feel happy to be there. The service was fast and friendly and food quality was excellent. And the prices weren't out of this world. Definitely suggest checking it out.

Nice environment. Best pork pot stickers I've every had. The pad Thai was tasty and the service friendly and prompt.  The lady's bathroom is spacious and clean, something I always appreciate at a restaurant.  The cost was moderate. I would definitely eat here again.

Loved this place!! Very busy but the line went quickly. Home-made juices with such delicious options. The red velvet french toast is to die for!!! Loved the service and quality of food. Definitely worth any wait you might have!

Steak & eggs is a sharing 10-oz portion and comes with two eggs. Ordered a side of pancakes which were fluffy. Steak came med/rare as ordered but we'd order med next time. Overall, good service & food but not 5 star quality (7-11 coffee creamers & log cabin instead of maple syrup for pancakes).
Food and service were fast, but my waffle was not cooked completely and my eggs were not as ordered, barely over easy when I ordered over medium

Visiting Chicago we happened to stumble across this place on the way to our hotel. The food is amazing! I got the corned beef hash & Eggs(probably the best I've ever had). It was delicious! Also had a side of French toast that was very good. My brother-in-law asked the waitress for a recommendation between a few options... "Definitely chicken & waffles" he was not disappointed. The look on his face when he tried it, he was glad he asked. We were stuffed as we left there and our server was excellent! Very bubbly and gave us good tips on places to see while in town. The girls at the register are very pleasant also. We enjoyed our experience enough that we came back the only other day we were in town. Another great server. We both ordered the farm fresh (biscuits and gravy) and left just as happy. Do yourself a favor and give this place a try!

Whenever I have a serious craving for brunch, Yolk is always there for me. It is well known that brunch-type restaurants tend to get insanely crowded during the weekends (like the eternal 2+ hour wait at Wildberry). Yolk definitely has more customers coming in during the weekend, but the line here moves pretty quickly so you will not be waiting a ridiculous amount of time before you eat. The menu here has a decent selection but I found myself getting tired of it after the tenth visit...(no wonder). I usually order the Nutty Monkey Cakes because I love peanut butter and pancakes. This time, I also ordered the corned beef hash, which I thought was actually not that great. The beef tasted a little bit sour which made the dish hard to eat. Also, the server got my order wrong and gave me scrambled eggs instead of sunny-side up :(. If you have a very strong desire to eat brunch and cannot bother to wait in long lines, I would recommend Yolk.

I wish I could give this place 10 stars!  Breakfast was delicious.  The food was fresh and the Nutella crepe was amazing!  The restaurant was clean and the staff was friendly.  I wish we had a Yolk in St. Louis!

Anytime I'm in a different city, I NEED to find a great brunch spot to start my sight-seeing/tourist-mode day. Thanks to Yelp, I found Yolk! I wasn't sure which location would be best so we chose the one closest to where we wanted to be for the day. I also learned about a nice little No Wait app that helped us save a spot in line while we looked for parking! Brilliant! I love how Chicago is so mobile app-friendly. Our wait time on the app was about 30-45 mins. By the time we parked, fed the meter and headed to the restaurant, we waited only 10 mins for our party of 4. Our waitress was so nice (I think everyone outside of NY is generally very nice to their patrons) and went over the menu with us when we asked for some recommendations. We ended up ordering an All-Star breakfast (which is pretty much a little of everything), the southwest benny, a skillet, and the croque madame, with a side of red velvet french toast. Everything was really delicious. I think the savory choices really knocked it out of the park. The red velvet french toast was also good, but I don't think I could eat a whole meal of it. Overall, I highly recommend it! Make sure to download that No Wait app, and start your day early if you're going to visit on a weekend!

Service was fine. Selection is good. Cooking, not so much. I ordered the Salmon Scrambler, with egg whites which I thought would be an omelet. Instead it was a conglomerate of egg whites, under cooked salmon and way too much cream cheese. They also provided capers to place on top and I think those were too warm. Long story short, I spent the rest of the day throwing up all the food I had just consumed.

Awful. Came here thinking it would be good, because of its rave reviews. My gf is a local and came here before years ago and it was good. Now we've been told by local friends that it's not what it used to be. The food looked good, but it didn't taste good. My pancakes didn't taste fresh, and they were rubbery. And my ham didn't taste good either. Both my girlfriend and I felt sick all day after we left. Never again

Nice location. They have the text system set up so you are alerted when your table is ready if you want to leave, etc. the food was good and hot when it arrived. The tea was amazing and great for a cold day. The hot chocolate wasn't so hot, but liked great. The atmosphere was energetic and busy. Went on a Sunday morning and it was packed. The restrooms were clean, but they could benefit from air freshener. The waitress was okay... She was very happy but she could of stopped by to fill water etc.

I am in town for a day and decided to stop by here for breakfast. I was greeted warmly! I sat at a bar and ordered a chicken and waffles. The food came pretty quick. I enjoyed it and my server was very attentive to me. It was a bit pricey $19, but I can see myself coming back here again on my next visit!

A Chicago (and now Dallas and Indianapolis) institution! Excellent food, huge portions and on point prices. The staff is always friendly and efficient, so glad they are doing well and expanding to other cities. I make a point of bringing out of town guests here for breakfast or brunch. Be prepared to wait 30 minutes but you won't be disappointed you did.

THE FOOD IS SUPERB!!!! The pancakes are fluffy, the French toast is delectable, and the sausage links are THE BEST I've ever eaten in my 63 years!! The service there is excellent and they are very friendly. Each customer is a king or queen, and are treated that way. I was so impressed with it, I went back two more times in six days! I even bought a t shirt so I could advertise for them!! I CANNOT RECOMMEND THIS PLACE HIGHLY ENOUGH, FIVE STARS ARE NOT ENOUGH!!!!

Yolk is one of the closest brunch spots to me, so I have eaten here a few times but then also ordered carry-out in order to avoid the crazy lines.  (On weekends, there are generally huge numbers of people waiting both inside and outside for their tables).  My prior experiences here have probably been around the 3.5-star mark: The food is good, the service is fine, and the atmosphere, albeit nothing special, is clean and friendly.  This morning, however, my experience wasn't so great... 11:02 AM: I ordered carry-out on the phone and was told it would be ready in 10 minutes. 11:15 AM: I arrived at Yolk to pick up my carry-out, which was not yet ready. 11:25 AM: I checked with the host to see where my food was; I was told it would be ready in 5-10 minutes.  Umm...? 11:32 AM: I finally received my food! I'm not sure what the problem was, but needless to say, it was not an ideal situation to be waiting in their crowded lobby for almost 20 extra minutes, for food that was supposed to have been made within 10 minutes originally.  Hopefully Yolk can remedy this issue!

Every other weekend I would come here with family and friends. & no doubt about it I always leave satisfied. At first I order the bacon waffle, which is to die for. But lately the Sunnyside skillet has caught my attention. The veggies and the meat combined together with a sunny side egg. Makes my mouth water. But unfortunately today I was disappointed. My egg wasn't cooked fully it was watery. To think it would taste different than it looks. Sadly it didn't. The spoons were not probably cleaned smelled like someone else's previous meal. Has me thinking should I come back here after I told my family its the best breakfast in Chicago. Might just go back to cozy corners.

Absolutely amazing restuarant. Perfect brunch spot with great service! We had a group of 5 and the food only took about 10 minutes to come out! Make the reservation online via the "no wait" app. We ordered red velvet French toast to share, and some of our entrees included the caprese eggs Benedict, Santa fe skillet, Nutella crepes, chicken and waffles, and croque madame. Definitely a spot to check out when you're in chicago!

Let me start with the food is good. I will give them that.  However, if you build a restaurant with all hard surfaces (meaning little sound absorption) and combine it with a young brash clientele, it equals a truly ear-bleeding dining experience.  First, it was the troop of young occupational therapists in for a conference. My wife and I got a full lesson in the meaning of therapy as they yelled-slained it to a young gentleman who somehow got caught in their snare.  Second, upon being seated, we found ourselves a couple seats over from the hipster day-drinking twins. Four people, two (now empty) bottles of wine, and the twins who proceeded to bellow to their table the latest in tight pants, beards, bicycles, chest hair, and irony.  Finally, the couple next to us. Who argued for the entirety of our lunch about whether or not a marathon racer could sue the city for ice on the racetrack. She, between humble-brags about her running prowess, kept saying that you sign wavers and run at your own risk. He, between wolfing at his food like a wild hyena learning to use a fork, would continue to say that you could sue. "There's a branch on the track and someone trips on it, I would sue the city". "All it would take is a $50 bag of salt to get rid of the ice".  "What if someone dies and another person dies and another one, they could all sue". You get the picture.  In all, like I said at the beginning, Yolk had good food. We've eaten at a couple of them since moving to the city. However, eat at this location at the risk of your hearing and sanity, but I guess you could always sue..............

This place was fun. Big Noisy. We were on our way to an event at McCormick Place and met people here for breakfast here first. I had high hopes. In the end I was disappointed by what I ordered. I got their Chilaquilles - which is like breakfast nachos - because I've had them a couple other places and really like them.  When the dish came to the table it looked OK at first glance, but turns out the whole thing was very runny and strangely wet - super unappetizing. Not sure exactly what was even causing the problem. The eggs that come on top were also very under-cooked. Others thought their food was fine, but nobody really loved anything.

Pretty much one of the only places I look forward to eating breakfast at. Second time here and it was just as good both times. Parking is a pain but it's Chicago. Big, quality breakfast with fast service. Definitely get the strawberry orange juice and then any breakfast plate. I had success with the salmon and all star.

My daughter had chocolate chip pancakes that were partially burned on the bottom, I had a meal off their special menu, sweet potato hash with ham and eggs. The sweet potatoes were not hash, they were large cubes and barely cooked. Was really disappointed because the last time we were in town and ate here I remembered it being good.
The best breakfast in the south loop area. Love the food, service, and the interior of the building. Plus the lovely view of the lake can't be beat.

We were in town for a volleyball tournament and ate at Yolk twice for breakfast. We loved it! The servers were so friendly and inviting - always smiling and very attentive, which was so nice on mornings we had to be up and eating breakfast by 6:00 am. The food was wonderful and even though Yolk can get crowded, it was well worth it! We are from Dallas and had no idea they have a location in our home town, not to mention one coming soon in Ft. Worth. We highly recommend Yolk!

a homey restaurant that I always strive to come down to. I live in the suburbs but when I come down to the city, this is always a stop! wonderful food, nice waiters, and good prices make for a great ambience.

HAIR in THE FOOD! We asked a server to talk to the manager of this place about hair in my friend's sandwich and all we heard was "sorry. Can I get anything else for you instead?" Well.. At least I expect not to charge her for that sandwich and to remake it for free. But she wasn't even offered a discount. I already finished my food when they brought her the sandwich with a wrong side..Not to mention that they didn't bring her any silverware and we had to wait for it for another 5 minutes. I just feel bad for my friend who got such a poor experience and had to pay the whole price. Once I found hair in a pizza place and they were sincerely apologizing for half an hour offering next two pizzas for free. This is how you are supposed to do it, if you want to keep people.. Yes, I got it, it is a busy place and losing 2 customers is not a big deal. But this cafe needs to think about negative word of mouth that will keep away their potential clients.

I live right by Yolk, but this morning I decided to visit this place for the first time. Well... I was really disappointed and discussed to find hair in my good looking tuna sandwich! I'm not going out to eat to pay for hairy food. Gross! Highly doubt I'll ever come here again
Great food but long lines. Not worth more than 30 min wait but delicious if you are patient to stay. The earlier you can go, the better. French toast was awesome. Crepes were good too.
Awesome place! Great food and great service! Way better than the hotels around here! The 5 egg on letter are over the top! Very fresh and cool atmosphere.

God. The food is so heavy here. I normally eat like a cow but I can't even get through all the food I ordered (this rarely happens, ok?) I came here with a guy friend who likes his brunch southern. I am a Californian who prefers my brunch light and fruity. So here's what we ordered, (oh also the server got my order wrong. I was going to substitute fresh fruits with fresh berries but instead she just got me additional fresh berries. I'm not complaining but I just couldn't finish it so I had to take it home) Me: El toreto scrambler with side fruits and toasts(3.5/5): I liked the flavor but the amount of cheese and sour cream on this is just too overwhelming. Otherwise this could've been a good scrambled egg dish. The smash avocado made it creamy and chorizo added in the accents of flavor. I never got to the toasts coz I can't finish it... Fresh berries: well they're just fresh blueberries, blackberries, and (sliced) strawberries. You either like them or not. Strawberry orange juice (4/5): This is pretty good! You could tell it's freshly made from the pulp and seeds of strawberries, Him: Chicken 'n' waffles (4/5): Oh my god. This dish looks like a plate full of cardiac arrest and diabetes. But don't get me wrong, it was savory and tasty. The fried chicken was crispy on the outside and juicy within. Topped with gravy, it was p heavenly. Oh, did I mention they serve *bacon* waffle?
Very delicious eggs menu. Great eggs benedict and kale scrambler. I would definitely go back.  I really loved this place.
Best breakfast ever! I come to Chicago to visit my friend once in a while, every time I come to Chicago, I come to this place and eat brunch!!! I love it!!  Best food!!^.^

I live two blocks away and have really gotten to know local brunch options. Yolk is toward the bottom. Way too loud, no decaf espresso or decaf tea, poor vegetarian options, greasy & boring food for pre-diabetes... Our server was kind and chipper, but that's about it. Both Bongo Room and Wildberry are better, although Bongo Room is pretty loud too.

I pass this place everyday on my way to work and decided to stop in this Saturday afternoon. They were busy but service was quick and everyone I interacted with was friendly and helpful. My food was delicious and prepared perfectly. Decent price for very large portions. I'll be back!

Yolk serves pretty standard breakfast fare but does it well and service is good as well. My wife and often share a breakfast to save on calories. We were informed by the very kind and attentive waitress that sharing would incur an additional $2.50 charge no matter how it was shared. After talking to the manager he kindly reversed this charge.  The policy should be reviewed. Must we order too much food so we can pay more and the food can go to waste (or go to waist)?

Pros: -Great service -Fresh squeezed orange strawberry juice!! Get it! -The owner comes and checks in to see how everything is  -healthy options -a lot of food for the price  Cons: -The egg in the Benedict was hard! Poached eggs should be runny  -the pancakes were burnt on the bottom and the onion in my scrambler was basically raw. It seems like they have new/untrained cooks... -the coffee is just okay. Subpar compared to the Intelligentsia coffee that Wildberry and Bongo Room serve -some grapes were so mushy and smushed like raisins. Yuck We'll probably frequent Bongo Room and Wildberry from now on, but Yolk wasn't bad. Just not amazing!
The Roast Beef Eggs Benedict  (sauce on the side) was fabulous. The beef was tender and flavorful. Awesome attention from the staff. And the coffee was good! I'll be back.

Fantastic breakfast! Came here for business and ate here every morning. I got the build-your-own omelet and it came with a generous portion of fresh fruit and toast or pancakes. Worth every penny. Will come here again...probably every morning that I'm in Chicago.

One of my favorite breakfast places in the city! I come here almost every Monday. Waitstaff is always nice and friendly. Thank you so much for taking care of us! You all are amazing. Food is great!! Well cooked and plates are always nice and clean. My favorites from the menu are various fruit parfaits, salmon salad and steak salad, Tour de France French toast, I tried their Reuben and Iron Man omelet. Will definitely come back. Such a great atmosphere here!

My boyfriend and I go here all the time and love it! Today was different though, because it was the first time I've been since learning that I'm lactose and egg intolerant and gluten sensitive. I had no idea what to get, since almost everything on the menu was off limits to me. The waitress was incredibly nice and accommodating, she went back and forth to the kitchen to ask them questions for me and suggested some corn tortillas, sausage, bacon, and potatoes to make some breakfast burritos, something that wasn't even on the menu. I was so grateful. I got a small cup of kale to put inside of them and used some of the syrup and hot sauce from my boyfriend's meal and it was soo good. It made me love this place even more than I did before.

Yolk is brunch for everyone. Walking in, you will get a sense that you walked into a diner rather than a brunch establishment. It's busy. Very busy. If you come at the wrong time, your wait might be longer than what you would want to wait for pancakes, french toast, or greasy meats. Thankfully, Yolk has a decent sized waiting area so even in colder weather you won't find yourself stranded outside. The service is friendly and fast. It's amazing how many dishes they churn out with the number of customers they have. This is the kind of place I would take my out of town friends but not my significant other. It's just a little bit too noisy but you will get your food pretty quickly.  The menu is expansive and the portions are large. If you choose a "side" of pancakes with your meal, you will feel like you ordered two meals. This was my second time at Yolk and food quality is good. The food presentation is good and even surprisingly artistic (see South Beach pic). But I find their item menus to sound much better than the actual taste. Yolk will satisfy your much needed brunch fix but it won't wow you. Yolk is a solid 4 star brunch place. It's menu selection and food quantity will help propel it to be a local's favorite in many areas. It's the go-to place when you want to get your money's worth. It just won't be THE brunch place to go to.

I came to Yolk on an insanely busy Saturday and sat at the bar. Despite the crowd, my waitress was attentive and friendly. I had chicken and waffles, with the most beautiful bowl of fresh berries I have ever been served. The bacon waffle was crisp on the outside and soft on the inside, and the chicken was pounded, tender, and coated with a delicious breaking. I am impressed!

This is seriously one of the best breakfast places I've ever been to in my life. The wait is a bit much on a weekend, but it's definitely worth it. The service is quite prompt and we had no issues once we got a table. The food is ridiculously good (not to mention fairly cheap) and the red velvet French toast is drool-worthy. Everything is great here and I will definitely try to come here every time I visit Chicago!
My friend and I went here today and it was wonderful. Had the Nutella crepes with strawberries and bananas, it was one of the best I have ever had. Will definitely go back.

I've been here 4 times and it's never a disappointment! I always get the Pot Roast Eggs Benedict and it's always amazing!  My husband got the Challah French Toast with a side of bacon and a side of those delicious red skin potatoes and be enjoyed it very much! If they built a Yolk on Long Island I'd be there everyday!
The food here was delicious. The waitstaff curteous and sociable. That wait was not bad for as busy as they were. Will be back agian when in the area
Went here today for breakfast and it was phenomenal... the red velvet french toast was extremely good ... I will definitely be back again

We love the Yolk. I am just now writing a review after eating at the yolk 4-5 times. we've had dine in and carry out. The servers are always great with great personalities, very personable and on top of things.  We've had the omelets, french toast, apple blintzes, and red velvet french toast. All are excellent. They give you a lot of food.  Oh and the pancakes! Its worth the upgrade to the pure maple syrup!!!!!!! Great place.

Came here after 3 years and boy the quality has deteriorated! I don't mind waiting but at least serve edible food. We asked for a patty melt and got char burnt meat with super burnt toast. NEVER AGAIN!

Family breakfast on a weekday. Much more pleasant place than the boring restaurant next door in our Best Western. Huge menu. Service was fast. They covered our whole table with plates, very pretty looking, my daughter loved it. The smoked salmon hash with eggs with fruits was fantastic. Hot tea was really hot and in a teapot. Crepes were OK: too much crepes and not enough berries. Greek yogurt was simple and very tasty. I'd come again any time.

Go tell your mom that this food is bomb! - I ordered the Hey Ricky! omelet and it was amazing. I always order the Mexican style omelets at most diners I go to and this place is up there among my personal best. 12/12 would eat again.

We had a table of two with my girlfriend and myself. I had the "South Shore" which was half a pineapple with Greek yogurt, nuts, and strawberries. I love fruit so this was perfect for me. My girlfriend got French toast which she was very pleased with as well. Service was also very good. Would go back again for breakfast!

The food was decent. It came out quickly and was cooked to order. The waitstaff was friendly and attentive. The restaurant was clean and welcoming. Overall a nice experience. The food was only ok though.. While it was not bad, it was just nothing amazing.

Went to Chicago for my husbands bday weekend. We ate at several restaurants during our stay. Yolk was our favorite. Staying in downtown Chicago its hard to find a meal that is just "regular," we are from indiana do naturally we really just wanted the breakfast basics that didn't cost an arm and a leg and that didn't have funky ingredients. We wanted regular food. We loved it. The sausage looks strange and rather large but it was the best sausage i ever had. The food was phenomenal. Service was ok, our waitress was clearly from another country, which is absolutely fine but she spoke very softly when she did speak at all but I gather she may have been Russian. She needed to speak up. The decor is very nice, loved the colors although they could fix the cracks in the drywall. Overall I would def recommend it to anyone wanting a very yummy breakfast.

This place is big and boisterous!! Lots of tourist traffic from the nearby hotels makes it good people watching. The food is delicious !!! I especially love the Iron Man Omelette. Very generous portions. A little pricey, but typical at this south loop location.

This was a classically decent brunch spot, but it didn't blow me away. It was really packed when we were there, but I wasn't totally sure why. The menu wasn't anything too creative but the food was good. The eggs Benedict was good and the cinnamon roll was a little dry. For what you get, I thought it was a little overpriced.

Someone recommended me and my boyfriend this place while on vacation. The staff is friendly and the service is great. I ordered the potato pancakes and they were pretty good and my boyfriend ordered a egg skillet dish and he enjoyed it. All in all it was tasty but I don't think I would return since it was nothing to ride home about.

Came here on a Saturday around 1ish for brunch. There were a few people waiting for a table, but my friend and I decided to sit at the bar so we were seated right away. I'd say this place is pretty similar to Wildberry, although not quite the same since the menu items vary a little bit. I ordered the Caprese Benedict and added bacon. I liked this creative twist on a classic, and thought the pesto especially added a nice touch. The flavors of the mozzarella weren't as strong as I would have liked, and I think the dish could have done better if they switched the english muffin for something a little more 'Italian inspired.' However, it was pretty tasty overall, and the portions here are huge for the price (only $12.49!).  If the wait at Wildberry is looking a little too long, I'd definitely suggest this place as a pretty decent alternative.
The Best for Breakfast and Lunch. Try the Veggie Burger. Great Pancakes and the Strawberry Orange Juice is awesome!!! The Onion Chips with Honey Mustard Sauce!!!!! xoxo
The food is amazing! Try the red velvet French toast or the huevos rancheros! At lunch time they are pretty busy, but the staff is pretty good about being attentive.
After eating bad hotel food for 4 days. This pace hit the spot. Breakfast was amazing!
I dream about this red velvet french toast. Good service, good food. What else can you ask from a breakfast joint?

My absolute favorite breakfast spot in all of Chicago! The service is always on par and the food always fresh and hot! If you're looking for a yummy place for brunch then I highly recommend this place!!!!

When you're in the mood for sweet breakfast try Yolk's red velvet French toast. Yessss! Though definitely decadent this toast was substantial and didn't leave hungry again in an hour.  Loud setting in fast paced atmosphere. Tons of options no matter your tastes.

Hmmmmm! So good so good so good! When we got here the wait was about 15 mins for a table. Given the crowd that was fast. I had to catch a train in an hour and 15 mins that I planned on missing. Nope I made it! The food was great. And the potions were huge while my bill was small. Overall I was very pleased with my food the customer service and the time. I will be back!

The waffles were hard to chew and the chicken tenders are too hard. The French toast was too tasteless even with a lot of maple syrup. With the popularity of Yolk, I expected better food. Probably won't visit again.

Extremely nice staff members, everyone was very welcoming, making my experience a great one from the start. The wait wasnt as long as expected. My only issue was that most of the menu does include egg, which explains the name of the restaurant but I still loved it. Had the chicken and waffles which tasted wonderful. If you aren't an egg kind of person, I highly recommend it with a glass of orange juice to top things off!

The service is incredibly quick and the food is AMAZING! I had the cinnamon roll French toast and my husband had the Farmhouse biscuits and gravy. They were both excellent, and the perfect amount of food. I would order them both again, except I want to try the rest of the menu!
Long wait. Food was great. I love this place but it's always busy. Juke busy busy.  Plus the owner has a great tan.

3.5 I mean this in the nicest way possible but Yolk to me is like a high-end IHOP. While the food at this chain is slightly above average, the vastness of the menu was more impressive than the quality of my meal. It seems that I am in the minority as Yolk was voted best breakfast in Chicago. Also, it was ridiculously packed during my visit. Wait time was an hour!  As I said earlier, that menu is rather extensive and there is something for everyone. For those with a sweet tooth, Yolk offers a variety of pancakes, waffles, crepes, and french toasts. Luckily for me, they focus more on savory items such as omelets, benedicts, scramblers, skillets, and a myriad of specialty options.  I opted for a scrambler with a side of fresh fruit and an english muffin. ( yelp.com/biz_photos/yolk… ). Mine had turkey sausage, spinach, and mushrooms. I really appreciate that they will use egg substitute upon request without any additional charge. It was just ok but the turkey sausage seemed like some generic jimmy dean breakfast item.  I also had a bite of Christina C's Irish Bennedict ( yelp.com/biz_photos/yolk… ). It had corned beef hash and roasted tomatoes. Not bad at all. I enjoyed it more than my own order.  My other friend ordered a skillet. Normally, this guy can pack away food but he barely got through half of the order. That skillet was so heavy that he couldn't even look at the side of pancakes...that poor soul haha. Be prepared to share if you decide to go this route.  Fresh strawberry orange juice was a hit with us! Definitely check that out.  I think my favorite part of this restaurant was the location. It was around the corner from my hotel,down the street from the train station and a short walk from the museums and other attractions.  Overall, Yolk is a decent choice but there is one other breakfast spot in the area I'd rather go.

Would give this place 5 stars, but I guess their success has been a bit of a hinderance. Nothing bad really, just the wait times on a weekend can be pretty lengthy. It's all for good reason, cause this place is a wonderful breakfast stop. I recommend all to come and check it out for yourself. I've been dining in and ordering out for pick up (not sure if many know that option exists) for years. My favorite breakfast place, and i'm not a big breakfast eater.
