This place is yummy! Everything we had was incredible.  Our favorite was the red velvet french toast.  It was most and had a topping. I believe it was a cream cheese frosting as well. One would think it would be too sweet,  but it wasn't. The flavors were well balanced. The wait can be long and the waiting area is outside (as it's too small to wait inside in the front) But it is worth the wait!

I just wouldn't go here. I love diners and this place is pretty lackluster.  The good: -No wait at nine on a Sunday morning -They're quick with the coffee -The sausage was very good - the nice thick sort -Service was quick The bad: -My ham and cheese omelette contained no ham. I pointed this out to the server and he apologized for not hearing me and offered to bring a plate of ham. No dude. I don't want a plate of ham and a pile of scrambled eggs with cheese on top. I want the ham and cheese omelette I ordered - bring me one. I may be a low talker, but that doesn't mean I have to eat the mistake you left in from of me. -My cheese omelette didn't have cheese inside. It's not an actual omelette. It's just a pile of scrambled eggs that they put cheese on top of.  -I was charged for this foolishness (to be fair, I never asked to have it taken back or removed from my bill - but I didn't eat it and it was flat out not what I ordered. It was kind of befuddling to me that I was charged for it. I shouldn't have to kvetch, you should figure that out on your own.) -When we left around 9:40 there was already a very healthy wait forming. -My wife's eggs where cold. -The coffee was weak.  -My hashbrowns were cold.  -No splenda (though they did have Stevia, which is likely even better in my book).  -Cream consisted of those annoying little packets - not actual cream. -It's expensive. The average breakfast dish is $12 to $16.  --------------- I live nearby and we had high hopes for this place. This is the first time either my wife or I have walked into a restaurant in recent memory where we just have no desire to return (it's not just the omelette... everything else was just lackluster). It's not awful. It's just not good. There are much better breakfast places in the area.

What bad could I say about this Yolk? Great food, great ambience, great people. The California omelette (with garlic) is my fave. I've tried a few different meals, and all of them have been good. You can't really go wrong with much here.  You may have to wait depending on what time it is on the weekends, but it's usually never too long, no more than 20 minutes.

The first thing you notice about this place is that it's always packed. However, thanks to the factory-like efficiency, you don't have to wait much to be seated or to your food to arrive. The food is fantastic. I ordered waffles with chocolate chips and sausage links and both were great. My girlfriend ordered chocolate chip pancakes and they were also splendid.  The atmosphere is fantastic, the food is second to none and the service is as efficient as a luxurious restaurant.
Great Nutella crepes - the best ones this side of Paris!  Super fresh fruit and ingredients virtually left off the plate and got. In. Mah. Belly!

Good eggs. Toast was burned. Canadian bacon was cold and hard. The stars are for the amazing pancakes.    Second visit much different experience! Wonderful wonderful service, sat in the back so do not feel so crowded and rushed. The eggs Benedict with roast beef were awesome pancakes are delicious I'm so glad I went back.

Was in Chicago for a conference and wanted something tasty and local for breakfast. Yolk was recommended and I decided to try it even though it was a chain. A short drive (or 30 minute walk) from that Hyatt Regency.  It was busy, definitely the popular breakfast joint. (I went on a Sunday). Was able to sit immediately at the bar. Quick and friendly service. Ordered the nutty monkey pancakes. Could only eat half, it's a lot for one person. Delicious!

I went here for breakfast before heading to the Blackhawks' 2015 Championship Rally (so you can imagine how busy it was), and the food and service was great! Definitely somewhere I'd go back to for breakfast.

My second visit to Yolk was sadly to say..underwhelming. This time I stopped in with another good friend who actually made the suggestion for Yolk. Considering my first experience i gladly agreed. When i arrived, seemingly as always, Yolk was having a busy morning but i considering my arrival was early i wanted to save a table. Unfortunately I was seated in the back near the bathrooms which I am positive that anyone would be dismayed at thos placement, there just weren't anymore options except for the bar and i couldn't risk that because of the noise. After all the objective is good food and convo. So i agreed to the back table. Our server was friendly and as soon as my friend arrived we were tended to efficiently. It took a minute to decide on a plate but i eventually went with the breakfast sandwich of egg cheese and bacon and home fries. In this case I experienced one of those food follies where you realize it's probably better to go with what you know is good for i was not really pleased with my selection. The bread was a bit wilted, the egg a bit dry, the bacon a bit rubbery and the fries a bit tasteless. I failed to finish my plate. On the other hand my friend's plate looked satisfying. She went with a favorite, french toast and fries. I should've taken her lead on this one. So overall my experience food wise was fair this time but not so bad that I'll never return. That would be a stretch. Yolk is generally a decent choice if your hungry and in the south loop. My suggestion: opt for a battered breakfast

This is the first time we went to Brunch at Yolk. Didn't know what to expect. But we were surprised to see so many people waiting. We thought it would take 30-40 mins to be seated. The hostess said 20 mins wait so we stayed. We ended waiting for only about 15 mins. Their coffee was great. We ordered Pumpkin & Roasted Apple Soup with Bacon, House Made Sweet Potato Hash, and Countryside Skillet. The food was pretty awesome. Our waiter was nice and the food came out quickly. The place was loud though. And we had to go pay for the food by the cashier. I guess it was to speed things along. Wish we interacted more with the staff. They all seem nice. We just went there during busy times. We will probably good back and try other items on the menu!

A friend and I came to this location for brunch. The atmosphere was very calm and peaceful. Our order came out just the way we wanted. I highly recommend the pancakes! Our server Gloria was very nice and pleasent.

This is a great place for breakfast. They give you nice portion sizes and everything I had from the potatoes, the pancakes, the sausage and the eggs were fresh, hot and flavorful. I was impressed and left with a full stomach! They have a menu with a wide variety of breakfast choices. Great ambiance and pretty decor inside as well! I will definitely return soon!

Food is good and quick but could get most of the same at Denny's. Waiters are friendly and has good pricing. Can't speak on the other locations but this one was clean and had alot of space. The coffee is delish. The bacon waffle is something you might be skeptical about, but it's a must try!!
I had the thanksgiving special turkey burger.  It was awesome. Very hard workers.  All jump to serve you

Very good. The food was delicious- no vegan options, unfortunately, but you kinda expect that with the name "Yolk." So I broke and went veg instead. Benedict caprese was pretty dang good. The West Coast Crepes were overpowered by how sweet the crepes were, it was hard to taste the filling, but good too. So loud and busy though, nearly impossible to hear people. The service was good and quick, but they forgot a side and it was nearly impossible to interrupt how busy the flow is to get it. Pretty decent brunch place, I would return.
Great food and great service! Got seated right away and had great suggestions from our server. I definitely recommend the cinnamon roll french toast.

Great place to go for breakfast or brunch. Waited a half hour the first time we went, but that was due to the fact that there was a Bears game. The bottomless coffee is great. Both times I went, the coffee was amazing! I got the 'two eggs and meat' option. It came with two sides. I got the red potatoes and English muffin. Great place. Was definitely worth the wait!

I L.O.V.E Yolk!!! I discovered this place the day after my bachelorette party.... We needed a place that would get us in and out because we had massages scheduled and NOT ONLY WAS THE FOOD AMAZING (everyone RAVED about it) but they got us in and out I no time!! I order the 'Cheesy Egg Sandwich'--- AH MAZ ZING! With the potatoes.... Delish!!  I've been here twice and one of the other locations once. They're my new favorite breakfast spot!  This time, I was with my hubby.... He's hooked too! :)  One word.... YUM!

This place was one of the highlights of my trip to Chicago. There are hundreds of options to choose from, and the eggs were delicious- came with fruit and an English muffin, but there were other choices too, like potatoes, toast, bagel, or even pancakes as a side. I sat at the counter. The only issue was that the coffee creamer was the artificial kind, they didn't have real half-and-half.

Delicious breakfast. The orange and strawberry juice was delicious. I liked the atmosphere and the wait staff were great. The food came quickly and it was a good portion and it was delicious. There are so many options that you are sure to find the perfect meal.

This restaurant used to be a favorite. Unfortunately, they have made the menu smaller and many of my favorite brunch items are gone. If you prefer savory dishes to sweet, then I'm sure it's still fine. But for me, the loss of those crepes that other restaurants don't offer, puts it in the category of "all the rest."

Nice place.  I was 1/2 hr early before they opened. And they let me come in from the cold and wait at a booth until service started.   Had the Irish Benedict.   Very tasty.  Good sized portion.   Lots of fruit on the plate.  Wish they had hashbrowns.   Like them better than cubed potatoes.  But that's me.  That did taste good anyway.   Excellent coffee.

We ate here two days in a row.  The first day I had an omelet called Hey Ricky. It was so delicious and perfectly fluffy.  It came with tasty red diced potatoes and toast. I also ordered a pumpkin latte that came in a very tiny glass and cost over $4. I do not recommend the latte since the flavor was ordinary and the value was horrendous. My bf had the seasonal sweet potato hash. He loved it.  It was a little on the sweet side for me because the potatoes were tossed in a maple glaze. It was still very good though.  Day two was not as impressive.  We both ordered the corned beef hash that looked and tasted like it came out of a can. My toast was so burnt it was black on both sides.  I would consider going again but stick with the omelets or egg dishes. The vibe was cool and the waitresses were quite friendly.
Love. Food is good and there is so. Much. Of. It. Lovely place. Eggs Benedict leaves something to be desired but they serve the world's most perfect pancakes. So fluffy, so light. Pure perfection.

Service was phenomenal! Our waitress Alex was very courteous towards our group and knowledgeable on the dishes. She also kept our glasses topped off and accommodated to our every needs promptly. The food was also fantastic! I had the country side skillet which was flavorful and filing. The south of the border Benedict was different with a Mexican twist from the sausage they used. Smoked salmon was also very tasted. Our waitress suggested the pumpkin swirl french toast and red velvet french toast. They both were just the right amount of sweet and we didn't use the syrup provided.  The place is a tad loud because it's pretty busy. You could barely hear the music even though I'm sure it was blaring. There's a slight wait, but honestly not that bad. The hostess said 30 minutes whereas we only waited 10ish. Overall an excellent dining experience and highly recommended!
Long wait but worth it. had their insane red velvet cake french toast. it fed me for two meals  - the vanilla cream cheese filling was insanely awesome.

Stopped here for brunch with my wife based on the excellent reviews and the brunch did not disappoint. I had a delicious omelette "the works" with the strawberry orange juice and enjoyed every bite and sip. Huge portions and great service. Yolk is definitely on my will be back list.

Just had a great breakfast at Yolk. We are in town for a conference and wanted to get out of the hotel and voila. Service was great and the food was awesome. Crepes were thin and moist and the eggs were perfect. Can't say enough. Great atmosphere, great food and service.
Staying at the best western grant park it was just around the corner - reaaaaaally good breakfast. Only had it once - but i d totally go there again!
Breakfast selection was amazing, wish I could go back to try different things like the red velvet French toast

I usually don't know what makes breakfast places so wonderful. An egg is an egg. Pancakes, coffee, toast, fruit. So what? But this place has a big menu, lots of great options, healthy options that are unique and tasty, so many breakfast entrees to choose among. Usually I am underwhelmed, but Yolk does it right and the buzz was worth it!

Great breakfast place, I wish they had one next to my house.  The place is really noisy but the service was great, and the food was fast.  They really try to get your food to you in under 7 minutes.  It is not a place to bring your laptop and sit quietly and work on your computer.  It is quality food at a good price

Came here for breakfast October 11 and OOOOOOOOOOOHHHHHH MY GOSH!  It was simply the best! Had the Salmon Scrabbler with a side of potatoes and pancakes.  It was a pretty huge serving and beyond delicious!  Randu was my server, very attentive, kept a big smile on his face.  I'm definitely coming back my next trip!

Delicious!!!! I've had this place on my list of breakfast spots to try for a long time.  Finally, I got my opportunity during my vacation week.  I was a little skeptical because their is no parking, however we had no problem finding a spot on the street.  We were seated right away.  The waitress wasn't that friendly, but I didn't let it get to me.  I had the Eggs Benedict, which was my first time and it was fabulous!  Hubz had the bacon waffle which he complained they were stingy with the bacon, but otherwise it was tasty. I will definitely return to try out more menu items.

If you love breakfast and brunch, this is a place you must try. I routinely visit this location on the weekends, and the food is always top notch. Unless you go very early, or near closing time, expect a decent wait even for small parties, but it's definitely worth it. I haven't try any of their other locations, but I would recommend this place for sure. The portion sizes are great. I've personally had the classic waffle, eggs with potatoes, pancakes, and French toast. Everything has been excellent. The staff is friendly, is this is a great place to take your out of towners.
Excellent! Ate here at 11:30 on Chicago Marathon Day, just across Michigan Ave from the finish line. Still seated within 10 minutes. Food was delivered quickly and was delicious.

Amazing option for breakfast. Had the Biscuits with Grazy and 2 Eggs Over Easy on top. Unreal how remarkable this tasted. Options to have fruit instead of home fries! Why is this not a thing everywhere else! I found out about Yolk from Googling "best Chicago breakfast" and this place absolutely held it's title with us. Only negative (but not worthy to remove a star) is the amount of people traffic this place gets. It's packed here constantly, but the lines do move quickly. Keep this in mind and understand that the wait is totally worth it.

I love going here for breakfast on the weekends. Though it is usually very crowded, the service is quick and the food is fresh and hot. The breakfast skillets are very good and filling. The only downsides are that you have to valet your car to park near the restaurant and there is always a wait for a table (indicative to me that the food is good).

A local friend of mine recommended this spot. I was able to have my parking validated, so instead of $22, it cost $12.  It took several minutes for anyone to come over and acknowledge me. When someone finally did, it was to bring a water and fill the empty coffee mug already placed on the table. I came after the lunch rush. There were still a handful of tables and a couple servers at the computers. I imagine they were splitting checks and that's why it took so long to get service?  The coffee was impeccable. Tasted fresh, hot, and delicious. I finished my first cup before my entree arrived. I ordered the stuffed French toast. It was a special that day. It use to be on the menu. I see now why they took it off. The inside of the toast was basted with cream cheese and raspberry preserves. It was a nice idea, but poorly executed. There was WAY too much cream cheese.  I'd go back for the coffee and to try something else like eggs benedict, or their Greek omelet.

Great breakfast place quick and good food visiting from California again Yelp didn't disappoint us stop in if your in a mood for good breakfast. We enjoyed the service and our server Cynthia that way always on topping off our coffee and making sure that we had everything we needed, love this place might stop in tomorrow to try something different. This place is get busy fast so get here early and enjoy your breakfast.

Quinoa bowl!? Amazing! It was such a breakfast treat. Warm, creamy, rich quinoa in milk and cream,  topped with baked apples, peaches, cinnamon, cranberries and pecans. Huge place, friendly and quick service, lots of choices and long hours. The decor is a little casual and not super warm and cozy, but it's a good stop in a convenient location!
Excellent breakfast and service! We drive out of our way to come here. I have to add more to make this a review. Lolololololololololollolololol zxzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzzz

All I've got to say is WOW! Came here for a late brunch on a Friday and there was no line, so we got seated right away! Woot woot! We ordered the red velvet french toast and the South of the Border eggs benedict with chorizo. After we ordered, it felt like only 5 minutes had passed when our server brought over our dishes! Our food came out amazingly fast! We tried the eggs benedict first and boy was that deliscious!! The chorizo had a nice kick to it and the eggs were cooked perfectly. We dabbed some hot sauce on there and just devoured it. The red velvet french toast was just as divine and melted in my mouth. They do put a good amount of cream cheese in there, but I didn't mind! It was so good and not too sweet. My BF and I were so stuffed by the end of our meals. This is definetely an excellent brunch place to come check out!
Very salty, greasy, and satisfying. The corned beef on eggs comes with pancakes, which checks off everything I wanted to try for breakfast. Everything tastes great!

This was one of the best breakfast places we've ever been to! I had the cinnamon roll French toast and my fiancé had the eggs & hash. Both were delicious! Highly recommended for anyone. The wait time wasn't bad either - the staff is super efficient and we're constantly moving.  The service was great too - even considering they were slammed, my coffee cup never went empty and our waitress checked on us multiple times. This was an overall great experience.

Went there for breakfast .. We had to wait for 25 minutes before going in.  We ordered California omelet and French toast.  The omelet was good .. The idea of adding guacamole was great . The French toast was average and a bit oily.  Coffee was great and the staff are friendly

Open early! Greeted me right away, accommodated my diet restrictions and didn't make me feel weird about it. Offered to add in options that I could to make up for my no dairy, flour, fruit diet day! Super nice and accommodating. There is plenty of seating, a nice view of the park, it's bright and cheery. The iron man omelette that I ordered was great. I normally dislike egg whites but they did a great job adding veggies and salsa to liven it up. Bravo! Way better service than and vibe than Chicago Kitchen.

Giving only 4 stars due to the wait and to the sheer food factory this place is (felt like eating in a giant cafeteria), but otherwise, its definitely a great bet for good breakfast, a lot of selection and appeasing a big appetite.  I think I saw someone else's post - if you're two people -  you can probably get away with ordering only one item - like a scramble or an omelet with a side of pancakes and you'll leave completely full.  My husband and I both got scrambles each and only got through about 1/2 - and ours looked like less food than other selections.  The problem here is that there's a million different things we were dying to try and we had to only settle on one!  TIP - if there's just two of you and you don't mind - sit at the counter.  It's fascinating to watch the food come out - like a delicious, well-orchestrated circus - we were mesmerized and drooling by the time our order came out.

I guess is a first and last time for everything. I went in very hungry and left disappointed. I ordered an egg white omelette, A side of fruit, and some white toast. The omelette was bland and rather tasteless and the fruit was old and soggy.  I was not a fan of the decor also. The look is A little to cold for me also.  I won't be back.
This place NEVER disappoints. Great service, quick food and always tasty. Had the French toast yesterday and it was phenomenal!

Not usually a fan of breakfat/brunch places as they tend to be just eggs, pancakes, bacon, and waffles.  Don't get me wrong these are great but the markup on these items is way more than what I would like to pay for and when I can make these simple items as home.  HOWEVER.... Yolk's Quinoa Bowl is amazing and is definitely NOT something I can make at home and is delicious. I didn't have time to wait for a table so I decided to do a to-go order.  The wait from what I could hear was 10-15 minutes and this was labor day Monday.  I will say that they need to put some benches in the waiting room area as currently it's an empty room with no sitting area at all! I don't really understand why the restaurant couldn't invest in some chairs/benches to put out there to make it comfortable for people waiting - you basically see a bunch of people just standing around.   The breakfast quinoa bowl is fantastic as I love the combination of the quinoa, creaminess, fruit, and nuts.  I've never had quinoa like that before and was so glad to see such a different breakfast item available on their menu.

The food was awesome. I ordered west coast crepe and it come with two side dish. I took potato and pancake, both of them was delicious. We was seated close to the big window which is good, but the only thing bother me that I waited 30  min with my son"toddler" and there's no chair available so I was carrying my son while I was waiting.

We had a fabulous breakfast at Yolk. Our server Lisa was very attentive and pleasant.  Loved my pineapple with fresh fruit and Greek yogurt. Had to take the muffin with me, I was so full.  The only thing missing was an outdoor seating area that their other locations have.

Come hungry for amazing food! I give it a five stars for the food,  portions and price. I got the El Torrero Scrambler it was full of flavor and a generous portion. My husband got the all star breakfast, the bacon, sausage and pancakes were amazing! Pricing is great for the amount of food you get. Expect it to be very loud if it's a busy time. The food is worth it, in my opinion! Despite the full tables, they bring your food out hot and on time! Not the best place to go if loud and busy atmosphere is stressful to you.

The front desk employees were extremely rude. The food came out quickly but some of it was cold. The whole objective was turnover of tables and high volume. Not a pleasant experience. We will not go back.

Good news, I found the garden of Eden. It's here. The eggs Benedict is on point, with deliciously fresh fruit that instantly makes you healthier. And the coffee is phenomenal. This is the place that proves breakfast is the most important meal of the day. The second I walked out of here, the sun was brighter, my pimples disappeared, my teeth were whiter (great coffee, right?), and birds attended to me like in the Disney movies. So maybe give this place a try.

I feel like this is an average brunch restaurant. Nothing here really stood out to me. I waited maybe 30 minutes to be seated for a table of 2 on Memorial Day weekend so I expected it to be longer. We ordered the Pot Roast Benedict and the Nutty Monkey pancakes which were both just okay. The potatoes that came with the Benedict were very plain, I added hot sauce to give it some spice and flavor. The coffee was also just meh.  When I visit Chicago again, I don't think I'll be returning here. I'll be checking out other brunch joints.
What a wonderful find! Excellent food and full bodied coffee in a cup that never went empty. Add to that a very friendly attentive waitstaff, and the Yolk becomes a must! Highly recommend.

Was looking for a good breakfast outside my hotel and I got a fantastic one. Yolk was super busy with about 50 people just waiting for a table so I knew it had to be worth the wait. Great coffee (and its local), superb ingredients, this was an all around fantastic breakfast. I came back the next day and the next.

This is a must if you are on this side of town. Excellent food. Way too much though. I had the French toast, which I didn't realize came with eggs and bacon and sausage. I could only eat the toast and eggs. My husband got the skirt steak and eggs. It also came with a full order of pancakes and fruit. He could only eat half the steak and half the pancakes.

This place had everything to deserve 5 stars. The service was fast and efficient, good selection, delicious food, relaxing/comfortable ambiance and reasonable prices.  We had a group of 4 and only waited 15 minutes to be seated on what looked to be a very busy day. Once seated our waitress came right over and took out drink order; she was friendly, efficient and knew the menu. I ordered the Chorizo eggs Benedict which was PHENOMENAL (very spicy, so I wouldn't recommend to someone with a low tolerance for spice). One of my friends was not enjoying her meal so the waitress noticed and offered to switch her meal!  Overall a great experience and I will definitely be back next time I'm in Chicago.

I was here with four friends at 10am on a Saturday and the wait was only 20 minutes long. Atmosphere:  I really liked the ambience of Yolk.  It's exactly what I would imagine when I think of a brunch restaurant/diner from its bustling diner feel to its modern decor/design.   Service:  The service was one of the best I've had at a diner.  The waitress was very sweet and patient and let us know about different menu options and upgrades.  The wait for the food was probably a bit longer than usual but not terrible (maybe 20-30 minutes) and she checked in with us to let us know the status of our food during the wait.  She also checked up on us multiple times to make sure we were okay and enjoying the food. Food:  I ordered a California omelette with a side of nutella crepes.  The omelette was rather strange... it was mainly a thin tortilla-like egg layer wrapped around A LOT of stuffed cheeses.  After eating a bit more than half of the omelette I had to stop, not because I was full but because I felt so weighed down by all the cheese.  I didn't care too much for the overwhelming stuffing-to-egg ratio, especially for a stuffing with that much cheese.  The crepe on the other hand was delicious and provided a nice sweet touch to contrast the savory omelette. I liked most things about Yolk but the omelette was a big miss for me.
We are up from Las Vegas and stumbled upon YOLK yesterday. It was so good we came back today. You have to go of you haven't already, they are the best!

My first visit to the Yolk (another location) was great, hence the three stars. However, my experience there today was awful. We went in a little bit after 1 for lunch. We weren't greeted and I had to go to the cashier to get someone's attention. The man who sat us down basically threw the menu on the table and left us. We ordered the Nutty Monkey cakes and the Swiss burger. The pancakes were a bit too wet but overall edible; the burger, on the other hand, was horrible. The meat was dry and tasteless, the buns are burnt and extremely greasy, the sautéed mushrooms in the burger are too greasy as well. What's worse, the fries that came with it were soggy and wet. We got so grossed out that neither of us finished half of our food. My girlfriend even got a horrible stomachache from the food.  Overall, I think there are so many other breakfast restaurants that are better around this area. The yolk is not worth it at all.

I visited Chicago a few months ago and stopped by Yolk for breakfast. Their breakfast was was amazing and service was great!! Next time i'm in town I will definitely stop by Yolk and recommend anyone traveling to Chicago to give it a try. You wont regret it!!

This is a breakfast of convenience, at least if you're at the adjacent Best Western. I didn't think it would be a classic, but with morning food out of the way there would be more time to explore Chicago (including but not limited to Italian beef and hot dogs). Signs of non-seriousness included the plastic spoon, the convenience-store packets of half and half instead of a typical container and the t-shirts about "handling your huevos." But I have no complaints about my egg sandwich with cheese, tomato and pesto sauce, and the kale thing I sampled seemed pretty good.

One of the best breakfast spots in Chicago. We had the All-Star Breakfast with French toast and California Omelette with fresh fruit. Both were amazing! Best French toast I've had in a long time, really nice and moist. Chicago-style modern decor and excellent service. Will be back again for breakfast.

Expect to wait, but it goes swiftly. The hosts know what they are doing. Selection is amazing and portions are huge!  The potatoes are yummy, but the fruit that comes as a side is less than meh, skip it. Pretty decent coffee is a bonus. The place is very very loud. Service is solid. I'd go back if I lived here.
Yolk is a favorite eatery of mine when I am in the city. The breakfast is amazing! They use fresh and tasty ingredients! I recommend any of the skillets and scramblers!

On every visit to Chicago, Yolk has never disappointed. They serve classic breakfast foods, in large portions, at a decent price. I stopped into this location midweek around 7:30am, and the place was not busy at all. The service was fast, and the food was tasty. A win-win for everybody

This restaurant is located near to many hotels including mine in Michigan Ave. I wanted to try something "local" but since we were on a rush we decided to walk to this place, and well, it did not disappoint! The service was fast, server was friendly, and the portions were HUGE, the pancakes were delicious, coffee was hot and fresh, and the omelets were yummy. I got the El Torero Scrambler and it was "ok" I wasn't a fan of the avocado smashed with chorizo, my husband got the California Omelet and it was delicious! The diced red potatoes were really good too. I suggest you share an entree or at least one should pick the potatoes and the other person the fruit to be able to try both. I'm serious, expect HUGE PORTIONS! I wish my town had this place...I'll be back Chicago!
Awesome food!! First time here will definitely be back!! Here on vacation happen to run in to this place. Will be back again before the end of the trip.

Waited for an hour to be seated but Cinnamon Roll French Toast was delicious as was the coffee and the strawberry OJ.  Omelets looked very good as well. Portions are HUGE!  I'd return here next time I head to Chi-town.

I was really looking forward to this coming to this place but the guy at the front of the counter who puts your name on the waiting list is the most terrible, rude person in the service industry I have ever encountered. He flat out yelled at us for wanting to change seats from the counter to a booth. The counter seating was simply too loud with all the noise from the kitchen and utensils clunking. Mind you we did not just get up and go to the booth on our own, we were directed by our server to the booth. This tall guy was so unwelcoming and unkind that I lost my appetite. He was not apologetic and made it seem like it was our fault before even assessing the situation. I understand this place is busy and stressful with all the customers but under no circumstance should you yell at your customers. Inexcusable!  This man needs to be fired because he is incompetent at handling the stresses that come with the service industry. People come from far away to visit your restaurant and wait a long time in line. Would it kill you to smile? Our server and others we encountered who work here were kind and polite, however. It's truly unfortunate that one guy ruins my impression of an otherwise reputable restaurant.
One of the best places I've had so far had the huevos rancheros and a tortilla soup it was top notch. Not a long wait, fast service.

Great breakfast place! Friendly waitstaff with plenty of drink and egg dish options. I had an iced latte with the Build Your Own Scrambled with chorizo, mushroom, and swiss cheese. It comes with fruit or fried red potatoes and also English muffin, toast, or pancake. Scrambled eggs were good! The pancakes are tasty and fluffy! They do come out with no butter and a little powdered sugar on top so tell your waiter if you don't like that nasty white stuff (although that might just be a guy thing. My guy in particular). Overall very good, close to the museums, and clean bathrooms!

I have been to Yolk twice for lunch during work, and both times have been great! I had the corned beef hash and eggs both times, and WOW is it delicious. Many of their dishes also come with fruit/potatoes and toast/pancakes, so you get a ton of food. Service both times were excellent, and the food came out incredibly quick! As a bonus, the mints they have by the register are my favorite mints too!

This is an awesome breakfast/brunch place, I love it. It's usually pretty crowded so you have a good amount of time to wait but it's not too bad, we were seated in 20 min. Service is good, and the food really find you up and its very satisfying no wonder everyone wants to come here!

Excellent food.  You cannot go wrong. Good and fast service. Most likely you have to wait, specially on weekend, to be seated. Then on flip side, it's not place to seat and enjoy meal relax and be engaged in conversation. It's loud environment and they bring you a check before you are done eating.

Had the eggs Benedict -eggs were perfect potatoes were burned but overall a great experience. Was worried about the noise level as grandson doesn't like noisy areas but he focused on the background music and loved the pancakes.

Awesome breakfast spot. Marisa our server was great and so far the best service we have had in Chicago. Lots of menu options. Huge portions and reasonable prices. Would highly recommend. Only complaint: wish the a/c was on higher was warm inside. But that's it!

Yolk is solid and this location does not disappoint.  The menu is large and friendly to those with diet restrictions - I had trouble deciding what I wanted. I got a skillet with green pepper, jalapenos, and kale and chocolate chip pancakes. Both were exceptional. The skillet was just the right amount of crunchy, and did not skimp on the 'fillings' as some places do - there were lots of vegetables. The pancakes were wonderfully chocolatey on the inside and out, and maybe a tiny bit too sweet (luckily I had the skillet to balance things out). I was very sad I was unable to finish all my food. Service was quick and friendly, and there was no wait (although it was a Friday afternoon). As an added bonus, we could hear some music from Lolla as we walked outside.

This is a crowded place on a Saturday afternoon.  Nonetheless, they are well-staffed and organized so expect to be seated pretty quickly.  The food is really good and the portions, humongous.  The 5 egg omelettes are no joke.  Come hungry.
Way more than a diner. This place is amazing. Humongous portions. I got the scrambler and will get it again tomorrow! Wish this place existed in Sacramento!

Wow this place is so overrated its crazy. Service was rude and our food was sloppy and unremarkable. I have no idea why this place is rated so high. We came in at around 1 pm on a Friday and had the corned beef benedict and a bowl of the chicken tortilla soup. First off, the soup was actually pretty good. Nice flavor and spice level. But there was literally two kernels of corn and 3 beans. So not a lot of stuff other than some fried chips and shredded chicken. While the poached eggs were cooked perfectly, the plating and the cook of the hash were not. My dish came with a side of fruit and not one piece of the fruit didn't have hollandaise on it. So TIL that hollandaise and pineapple, watermelon, and grapes do not go hand in hand. Also, the hash was not crispy at all and basically dissolved in your mouth. No chew or bite to them whatsoever.  Service was pretty awful as well. The hostess showed us our seats and tossed the menu on the table and walked away, our server, while not bad, could care less about us, and when we went to go pay our bill, our cashier rolled our eyes at us when we asked which color mint packaging had chocolate and which one was regular.  See ya later Yolk, not that you guys care.

Portions are HUGE, food is great, and service is even better. Don't let the waitlist scare you away they were quick to seat us and food comes out fast! Shout out to our server Victoria she was amazing!
Great breakfast.  Fast friendly service.  Ask your server for options because there are too many to choose from on the menu.

Great food, big portions and the food comes out very quickly after ordering. Was in need of utensils and the cooks noticed us looking around and called the manager. He then came to our table and asked he noticed we might need something and how can he help.  He went and got us some extra spoons himself. Busy place so our waitress was tied up, hardly see others being attentive to tables if it isn't the "waiters area" but this place was great on service, food, and well priced

Absolutely amazing. The food was delicious, and their Cinnamon buns were total crack. The servers were really nice as well. The only two problems were that the tables weren't big enough, and it was so noisy I couldn't hear what anyone was saying (and we were all seated very closely)

Very family friendly place. They are open for breakfast and lunch only. The server was friendly and the food was good. They were really busy when we went, but they have an army of servers taking care of everyone.

In the past couple of years my food was always cold when it got to the table and the eggs were seldom cooked the way I requested so I stopped going for a while. But today I decided to give them another try.  The food was awful (oversalted and overpriced).  It was $3.00 more than the price on the online menu.  I had the Countryside skillet.  It did not seem fresh and everything was soggy and greasy.  This review will probably not make it to the posting stage but if it does, please know it is a sincere and truthful opinion.

One of the most delicious breakfast, Brunch restaurants in the USA. Their meals are satisfying, delicious and well crafted. My favorite is the " build your own omelette" The strawberry pancakes are phenomenal.
The work omelet is always my favorite. But I usually take off the onion. I've been thinking the omelet with more baked bacon would be much better!

I ate here many times while visiting with my boyfriend in town on business.  It is perfect for someone eating alone.  Sit @ the bar that overlooks the cooking/prep area.  Fun people watching, high-energy staff.  Fantastic food w/ generous portions.  Delish.

The most important thing you need to know about this place is that it is BYOB with no corking fee! Bring a bottle (or 3) of champagne and order a glass of their freshly squeezed strawberry orange juice.

Great breakfast, it makes your day better. Their decor is simple modern diner. I like the view of the open kitchen, and their kitchen is pretty good. I am a person, who likes to observe things, some of the waiter accidentally touch some of the bread or foods without gloves. It is not a big deal for me but it might be for someone else. Overall i loved it

Knowing its Mother's Day I was expecting a long wait anywhere we went. So we decided to give Yolk a try. The wait was not long at all as long you get there early. I ordered the steak medium well and scrambled eggs which comes with pancakes, I also ordered a side of hash browns. From the moment we sat down to the time we left the service was excellent and the food was amazing! Def coming back!

Love this place!!!! Every time we visit Chicago we have to come here. Service is always great and fast and food is always on point!!! Red velvet French toast has to be one of the best items on the menu.

The breakfast is fantastic. As is the atmosphere. The last time I went, they were giving out stickers and cool bracelets with "Yolk" on them. Which might sound cheesy or unnecessary, but it was a really nice touch.  I recommend going early, with the expectation that there will be a wait. I have been lucky enough to get seated almost immediately every time I've gone, but I know that isn't always the case. The fresh fruit included in most breakfast dishes is a nice touch. And all of the Yolk establishments are in really nice buildings, with lots of windows and natural lighting, nicely decorated walls and pretty painted walls.

Went with friends for a late breakfast.   Had the eggs over medium with the low fat turkey sausage,  potatoes, and toast.  I was very impressed with the sausage, which had a really nice spice to it.  The potatoes were cooked perfectly and had a great flavor.   Definitely one of the best breakfasts I can remember eating, so deserving of 5 stars in my opinion!

I visited the South Loop Yolk the day after the 4th of July holiday. Why!!? I dunno...I just wanted something to eat I guess. Anyway, the place was pretty crowded and kinda loud but I delt with it. The host was polite..asked me if I wanted to sit at the counter, or did I need a table, and seated me quickly. The waitress was prompt and polite...took my order, and served me coffee. She was prompt with my order. No problems!!... I had the Red Velvet French toast quite tasty!!..They served it with a side of syurp. I didn't think it needed THAT!! It was sweet enough. I didn't wanna be bouncing off the walls!! lol..Anyway. I also had scrambled eggs with cheese.& sausage links...that were kinda on the size tip of POLISH SAUSAGES!!!...but they were tasty, tender, and well cooked. Over all I was pleased with my dining experience, and if I find myself in the South loop I wouldn't hesitate to return. I guess if the crowd wasn't so loud I would have enjoyed it more, but maybe it was me. What did I expect complete silence??..
Great service and food was fantastic.  Great place to fill up for walking around Chicago.

Honestly I always have a pretty great experience here- nine times out of ten. Maybe once I had a so-so experience, but the good outweighs the bad. The one time that was so-so was because of the service. I think my waitress forgot to put in my order. It was dead in there, and my food took a while. Being a server, I can usually tell what went wrong. With that being said, all in all, the service is pretty good.  I always get an omelet (I love the California, veggie, and Mediterranean). I usually sub egg whites because the use FIVE whole eggs - sometimes they let you do some whole eggs and some egg whites, but usually not on weekends. They don't under cook egg whites like some breakfast places do.  I've also had the kale scramble- that is DELICIOUS! I love goats cheese.  You can get fruit instead of hash browns for no extra charge and can also get multigrain pancakes instead of the buttermilk pancakes for no extra charge, as well! When I'm feeling indulgent, I love the Tour de France. It's a trio of various sweet breads made into French toast. It's been a while since I have had it, but I remember it being unreal. Very sweet, though.  Bring an appetite. The plates are large. Also, be prepared to wait if you come during the busy day morning hours. But I promise you-- the food is worth the wait.

Perfect for anyone looking to eat breakfast or brunch! Before I get into the food, I first have to talk about how cute the place was!! The inside is super bright and sunny with a lot of booths and tables, and the colors inside just made me really happy. The waitress that was helping me out was super sweet and really paid attention to us. Also, I came in on a Wednesday at 9AM and I didn't have a wait, if that helps anybody.  Yolk has a really expansive menu, and even though they serve up all the favorites, they seem to cater to tourists (ME!) who are looking for something a little bit of everything. My mom and I ordered the Tour De France, which has three different type of french toasts, and the countryside skillet, a hodgepodge of different meats, vegetables, potatoes, with eggs on top. They were both sooooo goooood. I loved the three different french toasts, but my favorite has got to be the lemon poppyseed one. I personally didn't like the gravy that came with the countryside skillet, but it doesn't diminish my opinion of this place. Also, portions were HUGE, but my mom and I still managed to eat everything.... but we weren't hungry until 7 hours later LOL  Another thing to mention was that the coffee was great! I usually don't notice how coffee tastes in diners/brunch places, but I thought this place's coffee was excellent.  Check this place out, you won't be disappointed!
Amazing restaurant! I am eating the most flavorful omelet I can ever remember eating. We waited 45 minutes for a table.

Yolk won't wow you, but it has all the favorites you'd expect. The portions are huge. I asked how many eggs are in the omelette; the server answered that it's supposed to be 3, but that they usually they put in a lot more (I'm guessing 5). I really liked the Hey Ricky! Omelette, filled with avocado and chorizo. Since it comes with pancakes, it's easily enough for two meals. The place is big and has a bright atmosphere -- exactly what you want in a diner. Lines are crazy long on the weekends. Overall there's not too much creativity at Yolk -- just solid food that won't offend anyone.
Place is cute, brightly colored and well lit. Plenty of tables. Service is prompt and friendly. Our food came out in 3 minutes, literally. Was yummy!

This is the cutest little breakfast/brunch place I have ever seen. The vibrant yellow and blue just makes you feel like you're in a fun place. The Yolk logo is so darn cute and the little fried egg inside the building is overly adorable. I just loved the color scheme here! It even goes all the way into the bathroom! There are a lot of people coming in and out and it's a little confusing as to what you're supposed to. You wait and then you will be seated shortly. The menu is filled with so many different things that it'll be so hard to choose which one to get. But when I saw the very berry french toast, I knew that it was calling for me. The portion sizes are big here and I barely even made a dent in mine. The french toast came with five pieces of half toast smothered in honey, yogurt, granola and berry explosion. There were blackberries, blueberries and strawberries everywhere. I think I made it through about 2.5 pieces of half slices before I caved in. The pieces of toast are buttered and so fluffy on the inside. They don't get soggy, which I love. The yogurt has a nice tartness that balances the sweetness from the honey and berries. Berries are really fresh and in season! I loved it berry much! My friend got the chicken and waffles and I was surprised by how big it was. The waffle is so fluffy and has pieces of bacon scattered throughout. The pieces of chicken are tender and perfectly crisp on the outside. I think it could have used a little bit more gravy, but it was decent enough to get through the entire dish. Who knew that chicken, gravy, waffles and syrup could make such an awesome combination?! My friend also ordered a side of potato hash which came out well seasoned and nicely cooked.  Our server was friendly and did check up on us here and there. Our water was refilled promptly. We were just slightly confused as to how we pay since many people were coming up to the register (you can order takeout which a lot of people do). The server will bring you your check which you then bring up to the register to pay. Most of the dishes here range from $10-15 depending on what you get. The portion size is very generous, I could have definitely shared. Overall, it's a perfect little brunch place. The place is clean and I couldn't stop looking at that adorable fried egg on the wall!

This place is definitely worth checking out if you love breakfast! They have anything you can imagine. I ordered the two eggs and meat meal. This comes with either fruit or red potatoes and then a choice of toast, pancakes, or an English muffin. Of course I chose the pancakes and I decided to get fancy and order the nutty monkey pancakes. Of you are a fan of pancakes, bananas, and peanut butter then these are for you. They are rich and fluffy covered in peanut butter and chocolate sauce. My sister created her own skillet and chose her own stay own style of eggs and toppings and I gave that a try as well. Definitely recommend it! Another item I tried on the menu was the red velvet french toast... need I say more? Cream cheese filling and moist french toast is to die for!  Our waitress was great and we were served very quickly and seated right when we walked in. Now we did go on a Monday morning so that could be why there was no wait. I have heard if you try to get I  on the weekends it could be a bit of a wait. Check this place out if you find yourself in the southern loop of chicago!

I love breakfast and I especially love creativity in breakfast food. The menu is pretty big and there are many dishes to choose from. Many of them intrigued me, but I went with the corned beef hash and eggs. The meal was tasty and the portion was perfect. My cons are that the line to get in was long and the waiting area was very busy and crowded. I also felt the drip coffee was just ok as was the service. But overall a nice clean restaurant and I will stop in again.

This is such a popular place and considering its proximity to the museums, I can image how busy it gets. Luckily, the waiting is not long, ten minutes most.  I ordered the red velvet French Toast and my boyfriend gets the South Border thing. It is so good! The chorizo fits perfectly with the egg and English muffin. I cannot hep but keep eating....The french toast is a bit sweet but great taste with the creamy texture. You may want to check it out.  Great experience and will definitely come back.
Food was delicious!! The waitress was really sweet and very attentive even though it was super busy since the Blackhawks parade was going on.

All I have to say is...smashing challah french toast, super sunny atmosphere and wait staff with a lot of gumption. It was just a yolky good time for all- a real gem- a tasty breeze in the windy city. HIP hip horay.
Great food, good service and would definitely come back the next time we are in town!

The omelette was meh .. Latte was amazing! I had two of those . Would give a 5 star for the coffee, but my omelette was more avocado than egg, and therefore wasn't balanced in flavor . Would give it a 2 star.

Besides the fact I got to sit by the window with an awesome view of Michigan Ave (what person would not love that) the place looks awesome and the food was amazing.  This reminds me of the Chicago version of First Watch in Florida.  The service was great and the food came out fast.  I got the nutella and banana crepe with sausage, bacon and chorizo. Delicious!!!  My boyfriend loved his french toast meal and so I do not sound like a complete glutton I did split the chorizo with him lol.  When I return to Chicago with my friend in July I will make her have breakfast with me here!  Heck I would totally come alone because this place is awesome!

If you're in Chicago and you want breakfast/brunch, come here. It is clean and fresh and they offer fresh fruit with every meal! They have a large variety and coffee comes with free refills. The waiters are very diligent about refilling too! My friends were debating about trying Yolk or Wildberry Pancakes and Cafe and chose the latter. I had time to try both and I definitely prefer Yolk! I wouldn't even recommend the other place to my friends. West Coast Crepes- Delish! They were so generous with the amount of avocado, I was thoroughly surprised. If you love avocados then you will love this dish. It does not come with any meat, but if I get a chance to go back I will order it with turkey or something.

Great place, we went early on a rainy Sunday so there was no wait and we had an awesome waitress. Portions were HUGE we definitely could've split 2 breakfast plates between the 3 of us. The red velvet French toast was OUT OF THIS WORLD. Nutella on the side is a must-add.
The food was excellent the sausage was excellent even the potatoes were good and I'm like hashbrowns not home fries. However this has to be the noisiest place in the city.
Went for a brunch and it was worth every penny.i ordered for a red velvet French toast and it was delicious ! It was a very tasty beginning for a weekend. Yummmm!
The food and atmosphere was good. The side of hotcakes were bland. Service was fast and friendly.

We enjoyed an excellent breakfast this morning at Yolk in Chicago.  Food can make a vacation great, and I'm happy that this restaurant helped make our weekend special.  Yolk has a fun casual decor, with bright yellow and blue walls and an open, comfortable and modern feel.  When we arrived we were told there was a 30 minute wait, but we were seated more quickly than that.  Coffee was flavorful and delicious.  The kids menus are fun -- my kids ordered a breakfast combo, grilled cheese and "happy cakes"  The kids reported that the pancakes were very good.  My husband had a southwest scramble-type dish and I had West coast crepes. The portions were large and the fruit served as my choice with the meal was fresh and good.  Our server was pleasant and smiling.  Overall, a great breakfast!  We were so pleased.
Awesome! Chicago's best for breakfast and brunch. I LOVE coming here when I'm in town. Portions a huge. Staff is friendly and service is great. It can be busy. Food is awesome.
Amazing Benedict - the caprese was delicious! Fast, pleasant service in a really busy environment , and if you sit at the counter, the show with the cooks is worth the price of admission :).

So I went to yolk with my girlfriend for breakfast I've never been there before but she told me it was great. So we go in at around 1 o'clock on a Saturday it was busy but we got seated within 5 minutes. We sat down our waiter greeted us and gave us water. He let us look at the menu for a moment and went on to other tables. The atmosphere was very nice the thing that was a little weird was that the kitchen was actually visible to all the customers, me being a culinary student I've actually never seen that before I thought it was an interesting idea. anyway we order food our servicer is really nice, takes our orders and heads off. The food takes about 20-30 minutes for  our food to get to us not long considering the time. So I ended up getting the frittata I thought the flavors were well balanced, ingredients were very fresh plating was really good. nothing really special though that I haven't eaten in another restaurant all the food was decently priced. It was very good but it wasn't anything fantastic or amazing it was mostly for the atmosphere it seem like a very trendy food place a lot of what's "in" in the food industry right now. I would I go there again I guess if I passed it or if one of my friends wanted to go there  wouldn't be opposed to it. all in all though I give this place 3 out of 5
Great food I had the yolk special everything was fresh and tasty a little loud  but I like this place its great energy

So glad we got to eat here! This place is known as the best breakfast joint in Chicago.  So many options on the menu, you really can't go wrong with any selection.  Parents both had omelets with pancakes and I was pressured into getting the red velvet French toast as per the waitress who was super sweet and informative. I'm allergic to eggs so I didn't want to risk getting French toast but she had the chef not dip it in the yolk and milk mixture they use and it still turned out the same, rich and delicious. It was too good. I also thought the coffee was great.  The restaurant is always packed and there is usually a wait but ours was only 20 min. They also have a parking garage near by that they offer a discount for .   This place is a must if you ever visit Chicago!

We dined here every morning for breakfast during our three day visit to Chicago and loved it. The people working here from Kevan, Sophia to Lana were all very nice, helpful and on the ball taking great care of my wife's and my dining needs. I found all the dishes we chose to be made with fresh ingredients, wonderful flavors and great presentation. My first day I selected the Tour de France from the sweet side of the menu. It was three different varieties of their French Toast including banana with peanut butter, orange bread with strawberries and lemon poppy seed with blueberries. I enjoyed all three but the poppy seed was my favorite.  Day two I flipped to the savory side of their menu and chose a hearty Santa Fe frittata. It turned out to be huge and I was unable to polish it off. I enjoyed this dish as well with a good bit of spiciness to it. The last day I went old school and just picked their scrambled eggs with bacon and wheat toast. This dish too was yummy and well prepared. The eggs weren't to dry or runny but just right.  They have a nice variety of juices to pair up with your breakfast. I stuck with OJ but one time I got a strawberry OJ mix that was a nice change. Their bacon is thick and meaty and not cooked too crisp just the way I prefer.  Plenty of tables and booths to seat everyone are available without a wait during the week at least. I found their prices a tad on the high side but well worth it in terms of the quality and quantity of food served. We will definitely return on a future visit to Chicago.
Fast and nice service, great portions, a bit pricey ($$) but worth it. Group of 4 came in around 1pm, got seated right away.
Love it as always! So does my husband! We are definitely planning to try everything in Yolk!

Delicious breakfast spot in Chicago! Only downside is the long lines and wait on the weekends, but it was worth waking up early to make the line and get a table within 30-40 minutes. Yolk was one of the top restaurants on my to-go list during my first visit to Chicago; mainly for their Red Velvet French Toast. We were a large group of friends so we each got something different and were able to try a little bit of everything. I have to say that my favorite dishes were the Banana nut bread with bananas & peanut butter and the Red Velvet French Toast. On the savory side, I really enjoyed their Pot Roast Benedict.
Great food, great prices.  The biscuits and gravy are a must.

Good food, but they had mediocre coffee and service. Our waitress was outright dismissive to a slight order modification. The menu offers eggs benedict with ham or salmon. I asked for one of each so i could try both and she plainly  said "We can't do that."    Then my food came out cold. She offered to have the dish remade and was more attentive after that.  I am not sure if the special order issue was with our server or the restaurant policy.

I am really displeased with the fact that none of the cooks were wearing any disposable gloves. One of them even has a bandage on his finger. Who's the manager. Who's training them. Where is the health inspectors

The place is packed. Good location across from the park. Extensive menu and food comes out quick. I think the French toast made with challah bread was pretty good. It's a very generic breakfast place.

The atmosphere is electric. From the fast paced service to the open area between the kitchen and the restaurant all worked to give the ultimate experience. It  was great call to visit for breakfast. The wraps, the cakes and the build your own scrambler were all phenomenal!

Really great breakfast place! We visited Yolk on Sunday morning before our returning flights back to the east coast and there was a 30 minute wait. There's a good amount of space to wait inside, but because the weather was so gorgeous that day we waited outside where they announce your name over a microphone when your table is ready.  It was just under 30 minutes when we were seated. Our table was near the back of the restaurant (close to the restrooms) and this area was LOUD. The restaurant is very open and tables are close enough to each other without being uncomfortable.  The noise level drops half a star for my review and the coffee drops another half of a star. I'd say it was just a bad pot but after drinking half of my cup and getting a refill it was just so bad. Burnt? I don't know. How do you ruin coffee? We headed to Starbucks after... but I digress... The food was really good. I ordered the Caprese Benedict. Poached eggs on top of pesto and grilled tomatoes with the English muffin and Hollandaise. The pesto made the dish and of course I always love a perfectly poached egg with a gorgeously runny yolk. Was it the best Eggs Benny I've ever had? No. Pretty sure it's a store bought English Muffin (womp), but it was perfect hangover food after an open bar at a wedding the night before and was conveniently located two blocks away from my hotel. All in all - you should go. Timing was good, food was good and I left with a full and happy belly. Just don't order the coffee.

After walking past Yolk every day for months, I finally decided to stop in and give it a try. I wish I hadn't waited so long. The interior is fresh and clean, and the staff is friendly. You also get a great view of Grant Park while you eat. But while certainly nice, those things are all extras. I'm interested in the food. And it was delicious. I had the South Beach, which is a halved pineapple, gutted, and filled up with pineapple, berries, nuts, homemade yogurt, and granola. Everything was as fresh as could be, and the ingredients go together perfectly. You also get a LOT of food for your money (the dish comes with your choice of muffin as well). My buddy had the Irish benny. While I can't speak to every aspect of that dish, the hash was on-point and the eggs were poached perfectly.

I had visited this place 2 times this month. Coming in for a brunch is not as crowded as in the morning. I can't expect too good of a service when this place is busy. But surprisingly, the first time I was very please with the service. However, the second time I came with my fiancé, we has one of the worst service. When we seated she rushed us to ordered, I said we needed a min, so she left. For over 10 mins, she didn't come back to check on us. Then I had to ask the other waiter to place my order. The strawberry orange juice didn't come with a straw like last time, so I had to ask for a straw. She came back 5 mins and DROPPED the straw over my head and said HERE. She was so rude, at the end she gave us the check and told us to wait in the long line to check out.

3.5 stars. Some interesting menu like red velvet french toast (which I had), but the taste was nothing special, rather blend. Wait can be brutal during lunch hour on weekends but if you avoid those obviously-crowded hours, you should be seated right away.  Overall, mediocre brunch spot in South Loop imo.

Very popular place, so it tends to be loud, but that's no fault of Yolk's. I've always been seated right away (in the same place, weirdly enough!), and the service is usually friendly and prompt. Their coffee is delicious, and the food portions are large. Most times I end up having to take something home with me. It's a good place to take visiting family members for a nice breakfast. The price is fair, considering the area.

There are very few reviews that I start without knowing how many stars I am going to give them ahead of time. Yolk is one of the rare exceptions that I will write my experience, and then attribute a rating once I have completed and re-reviewed my own experience. I was in Chicago for the HIMSS ' 15 conference this year, and needed so find some quality eats (not hard to do in Chicago). For the morning of my departure from Chicago, I decided I wanted a nice breakfast, so I ran down to Yolk South Loop for some Eggs Benedict. Food: The food that I had was fresh, vibrant, seasoned perfectly, and undeniably tasty. This is undoubtedly one of the best Eggs Benedict that I have ever had, even with some of the weird issues surrounding my order. First, I ordered the Pot Roast Benedict. There was a massive margin of error here because so many components of Eggs Benedict can be easily messed-up. First the bad. I ordered, and (I crap you not) 3 minutes later my Pot Roast Benedict arrived -- lukewarm. It seemed to me as if they prepped all of these ingredients well-in-advance, or had an extra one lying around and quickly reassembled it and gave it to me. The lack of it being hot was a major indication that my dish was likely re-purposed to me in some way. Super disappointing, and I was expecting it to taste like old Eggs Benedict; but it didn't. Though it was lukewarm, the egg yolk was cooked passably-well, the muffin could have been crispier, the hollandaise could have had a touch more lemon; but the pot roast -- oooooh, the pot roast. Talk about elevating a dish to the next level! The pot roast simply made this dish. It was moist, tender, and seasoned to perfection.  Also lukewarm, but still delicious. I firmly believe that had this Eggs Benedict been cooked and assembled fresh, it may be the best I have ever had. Unfortunately, I will never know. Additionally, my meal was served with home fries (small cubes of potatoes), and fresh fruit. The fruit was incredibly fresh, but it was sloppily put on my plate and had hollandaise on it. Additionally, the fruit was not chilled and was also lukewarm. Very strange. The potatoes were under-seasoned and terrible. No salt, no pepper. They literally tasted like potatoes. Potatoes do not taste good without the proper seasoning. Food: Pot Roast Benedict 4 / 5 (4 / 5 +1 for amazing pot roast, -1 for temperature) Potatoes 1 / 5 (they weren't even crispy!) Fruit 3 / 5 (Fresh, but warm...?) Overall Food: 3 / 5 Service: Again, I have a favorable opinion of Yolk, but this is going to hurt the overall rating as well. First, my server was not personable. Not even a 'hi, ho are you', or a 'good morning', or 'welcome to Yolk'. Just a 'what can I get you?' And, she was training someone! LOL! Not only was she completely impersonal and lacked the fundamental skills of being a server, but when I asked if they did half portions of the Eggs Benedict, she simply stated 'no'. No reason behind that, ma'am? Then, when I ordered and OJ, she didn't ask what size, and served me a large. If I just asked for a half-order of EB, do you think that I want a large OJ? Why would you assume that? The difference of the small and the large came out of her tip. Service: 1 / 5 (completely ruined the experience) Atmosphere: Despite one of the worst service experiences I have endured in a while, the atmosphere is clean, inviting, and lovely. I could totally see myself dining here at least once per week if I lived in the area, and did not get stuck with a crap-server.  Atmosphere: 4 / 5 Price: For what I got, which was lukewarm Pot Roast Benedict, Fruit, under-seasoned potatoes, and crap service -- the price I paid 18.00-ish was outrageous -- regardless of how good the EB was.  Price: 2 / 5 Final Thoughts: Despite the bad experience, I still see the potential in Yolk, and feel as if I was just very unlucky on this particular day to get a crap server, and (possibly) old food. Honestly, I would come back one more time; but I am severely dissatisfied with my last experience, and cannot fully recommend this place based on my experience. It seems like my experience was an outlier, and wish you better luck when you check it out. I am rounding my 2.5 rating up to a 3 on the merits of the pot roast alone; but I hope that Yolk reads this and takes better care in hiring individuals who actually want to be at work and do a good job.
SUPER busy! most likely a tourist trap for people like me lol food was good overall, service was ok, but the wait was very long.  it's clean, yay!

The staff was really nice and considerate despite our group's size fluctuating and such.  I went to the other location on Ohio Street and they were much more crowded.  I had the chorizo scramble and it was perfect. Really liked the seasoning on their potatoes as well. Another friend ordered fruit instead of potatoes and I would usually get that but I didn't feel like I was missing out at all.  The pancakes that you can choose as a side were a bit too dry and bland for my taste but I was already happy and full with my main dish. My friend ordered the muffin which looked really moist and perfect.

Place is average at best. Overrated and hyped up in my opinion. Waited 45 mins for bad service overall. I've had better breakfast food at IHOP and Denny's. Save your time/money and go to the Bongo Room which is a short walk.

Come hungry and enjoy! Great breakfast. The pictures tell a thousand words. We enjoyed our breakfast - all was cooked well. I really enjoyed the all star breakfast, though the cinnamon roll French toast is too sweet for my tastes.   Eggs, bacon and sausage were all good and served in about 7 minutes after our order. A great place for breakfast - but come on a weekday since weekends are surely a long wait.

Great hometown diner atmosphere (but without the run down diner look). Excellent food with a wide range of wonderful tasting health to decadent choices. At 7am on a weekday the place wasn't very busy, so service and food was quick. I had the quinoa bowl - very good combination of flavored.
Service was great.  We had the egg Benedict, crepes and pancakes. Everything was tasty.  Kids had a good meal and enjoyed the fruit. Good food.

I had a great time here! We visited on a Tuesday morning and it was nearly full. However, we were seated right away and has our orders taken. I drank the strawberry orange juice I had heard so much about and it was pretty good. We ordered and food was back out quickly. The crepes were delicious, and served with a good assortment of fresh fruit. You also get another side and I chose pancakes. The pancakes were DELICIOUS!! They serve HUGE food portions. I highly recommend this place.

More like 2 1/2 stars for this experience...I would like to start by saying that I love Yolk. Love, love, love Yolk. Any time anyone visits or suggests breakfast/brunch, the first word out of my mouth is Yolk. However, I have never had such a disappointing and negative experience in your restaurant as I had on Saturday morning (3/7/15), around 11 AM.  Service was good, my waitress was good, friendly, attentive and the food was delicious.  My issue is in regards to the hostess, an older woman with short gray hair. I put my name in with her and she said the wait was about 20-25.  That was fine.  I requested a table/booth and she asked if I wanted to sit at the counter. I hesitated with saying no, because it may have meant a shorter wait, but in the end I said no, I would prefer a table/booth.  She responded with, so no counter then? And I said no.  Her tone was not merely inquiring, but more hostile.  It's busy, Saturday, nice weather, etc, so I understand it can be frustrating dealing with customers who may be indecisive. But I was not rude but friendly and smiling. After waiting a while, my friend and I hear what we thought was my name being called over the intercom (we were waiting outside) and so we go in and go up to the hostess and I said "I'm Lori, did you call us?" And she looked down and said "No, that was for counter only." In a rude manner, so I said "OK..." and my friend and I go back outside to wait.  A minute later we hear my name being called again, along with "Last call for Lori." So we rush back in and instead of apologizing or realizing her mistake, she looks at me and the guy (tall, blondish hair) who seats customers takes us to a table and practically throws the menus down. I am not sure what warranted such rude behavior and I was completely taken aback since I had never experienced this type of service before, having frequented this location many times in the past. This incident occurred at the South Loop location.  I hope that this was an isolated incident and that my future trips to Yolk will be more positive. The hostess is the first person you interact with when dining at Yolk, and this experience just left a bad taste in my mouth, no matter how yummy the very berry French toast was.

So I came to this established because it's highly recommend by someone who lives in the building. Ordered the skillet, it was great. When we asked for boxes the waitress said sure thing. Twenty minutes later we asked where our food was? She said I thought you said your done. She then said I'll make it new for you as my friend and I only finished half of it...  We paid got our new food all is good. 4hrs later I was thinking of snacking on my skillet until I opened to find my old half eaten skillet that the waitress said she threw away. Then proceeded to tell me that there's going to make new... I'm scared she told me thAt it was in the garbage then said that they would replace it with a new order then I find my old food that you said was in the garbage.  Please beware.

Do not let the wait deter you; I was told that I might need to wait 30 mins, but it turned out to be less than that. Yes, this place is busy and touristy, but the food is really good. I got the Tour de France French toast sampler, and all the flavors were really good (my favorite may have been the sweet orange bread). The service is brisk but fast, and you'll get your great food in no time.

2You have to try this place out. It is really a great place to have breakfast. But DO NOT come a Saturday or Sunday at peak times. Wait can easily be 2 hours then your expectations will be too high, you will be grumpy, you will order and omlette thay doesnt quite wow you and you will be dissapointed. If it sounds like i am speaking from experience i am lol.  But i have been here many times since and loved it.  Really nice options especially breakfast options with chicken which is a rarity for some reason and the COFFEE IS GREAT which to me is a hugggge bonus.
All day breakfast is served here. I came in around lunch time to eat my breakfast. Ordered eggs benedict and coffee and it was really good. I will be back when I am in the area.
Get the Hey Ricky. SUPER GOOD and it has a nice kick to it. Also do red velvet French toast is good.

Great spot for breakfast. We didn't have to wait on a Monday morning, but I imagine weekends are jam-packed.  The kids menu was filled with high-calorie, kid-impressing options. Since we were on vacation we let the kids indulge on s'mores pancakes and Oreo pancakes. I had a good eggs Benedict, though it was slightly under seasoned. No biggie! My husband loved his five egg omelette that he barely finished.

My sister and I went here for breakfast today and the service was the bare minimum. It was very clear that our waiter, Maks, was either having a bad day or just didn't want to be at work. Or maybe he didn't like me and my sister. As soon as we sat down, he asks if we want anything other than water to drink. My sister wants a coke and I was fine with water. At this point something seemed off but I wanted to give our waiter a chance. He leaves with our drink order and comes back with the soda and then before we could say anything, leaves again... He didn't even ask if we were ready to order. Ten minutes pass until he comes back to take our order. During that time, I tried to flag him down and he just seemed oblivious. He takes our order and never checks back in. Same thing happens with the food. He drops the food off and walks off. Doesn't even ask if we need extra napkins or condiments. Nothing.  At this point, my sister and I were doing okay. It wasn't a big deal. I just felt like we weren't welcomed. There was a point when we both needed refills but neither of us could spot our waiter. So we didn't get refills. So my sister and I continue to eat when he suddenly appears and hands us our check. He simply puts it on the table and leaves AGAIN. He didn't tell us to take our time, that there was no rush like any other waiter would usually do. He didn't even wish us to have a good day. It came off as rude. We never asked for the check and we clearly weren't near being finished. It was like he wanted us out. Since we obviously weren't done, we continued to eat. My sister clears her plate and Maks' final appearance was so off-putting. He literally comes up, picks up her plate, and walks away. He didn't even ask if she was done. I don't mean to be picky but both my sister and I work in customer service. If you're having a bad day, you fake it till you make it. That's my motto and that's the motto of a lot of people who work in the service industry. You don't show customers your bad side. It was very clear that our waiter didn't want to be at work or didn't like us. He made that very clear as soon as we were seated. Food was great but the experience not so much and that can make or break a place for me.

This is my first review for Yolk, but probably my 5th or 6th time here. There is a reason why Yolk is my breakfast joint of choice, time and time again, whenever I'm in Chicago. There is a consistent quality across all of its locations and this one in the south loop is particularly convenient - just off Roosevelt station.  I can't do this review justice like the many native Chicagoans that frequent place. I will say that there is not a better breakfast meal than their corned beef hash with eggs done over easy. The fruit, which seems to be seasonal is a nice touch to balance the amount of greasy deliciousness. The service is fantastic as with all Yolk locations. If you're coming with a large party, expect to wait quite a while on the weekends. Otherwise, smaller parties should get through within 30 minutes.
