Food service is blazing fast but there never seems to be a rush to kick you out despite the droves of people waiting at the door. I can't wait to be back!
Amazing food and ambiance!   Got the eggs Benedict with the chorizo, awesome!  Friend got the French toast, it was perfect!

I usually come to this location on the weekends. Expect to wait 20 mins. or more due to the weekend and downtown crowds. I suggest parking at a meter on Wabash and walk over. I'm a stickler for good, strong coffee and I'll give this place a solid 3.5 stars out of 5 - with 5 being the best. The waitstaff are always cordial and efficient.

Yelp guides me to a fantastic place yet again! The red velvet French toast is incredible. My girlfriend got  an omelette which was amazing as well. The avocados in the omelette were great.  Awesome service too!

This place is pretty standard. The French toast flight is nice, but how can you screw that up. The cinnamon roll French toast is just a mash up of everything that makes breakfast awesome. The Ironman meal is also great, and the bottomless coffee warms my heart and stomach.  My gripe with this place is mostly wait related. It takes forever to get a table, and there's no where to wait except outside. Not a great scenario for hungry kids.
The food was just okay-nothing fancy or special or great.  Food I could have made at home but better.

This location is always busy, but it was especially busy on St. Patrick's day. We were seated right away. I'm always more excited by the thought of going to Yolk than I am by the food itself. Our food wasn't bad. It was just adequate. We had the Irish Benedict and corned beef and eggs. They tasted exactly the same. And the hollandaise was not as good as our own that we make at home. But I am full, and the waitress was very nice and attentive.
Decent, standard breakfast. Fast. Would not order the huevos rancheros again. Bacon was good, but not crispy enough. Coffee Luke warm.

We were looking for a good breakfast place close to our hotel so we headed to Yolk and decided to go there every morning of our stay. The food never disappointed us and even though we had to wait ceveral times it was always totally woth it. I would recommend the all star breakfast which offers all the breakfast basics such as eggs, bacon and sausages and also something sweet. As a tiny woman, I have to say it is really filling and you won't get hungy until late afternoon so if you plan a long trip Yolk will be a good place to start the day. Today I had the belgian waffles and my boyfriend had some crepes and we were really happy about our choices since they were as delicious as all the other things we tried out at Yolk. I will absolutely come back the next time I'm in town!

Not really bad, but Yolk didn't stand out nearly enough to justify the long wait. We started with a delicious cinnamon roll which was warm and not overly sweet, and hoped the rest of the meal would measure up. Sadly, this wasn't the case. South of the border benedict ($12): Eggs benedict is my go-to choice for most brunches, and this fell flat. The eggs were slightly overcooked and the entire dish ended up just being dry, with the exception of some extremely greasy chorizo which I could have mistaken for ground beef with taco seasoning. The chipotle sauce helped, but couldn't save this benedict. California omelet ($11): My friend ordered this omelet and I got to try a few bites. It was huge but unremarkable, the avocado was plentiful but the omelet was smothered in too much cheese, making it too heavy and oily.  Overall, there are much more interesting brunch options in Chicago to merit having a safe, run-of-the-mill meal at Yolk.

After all the good things I have heard about Yolk, I was not impressed. I came on a weekday morning and was seated right away. There were a ton of workers waiting around. I had the iron-man omelette (egg whites with mushrooms, avocado, tomatoes, onions and green peppers) came with a side of watery salsa. The omelette would have been very bland by itself.
Too many avocados in the California omelette. Too much cream cheese in the pumpkin French toast. Just too much.

All I have to say is, good food, good company, and good prices. Nothing beats this place for brunch after a long Friday night. Lines do suck but they try to get people in and out as fast as possible. Highly recommend the wide selection they have which is creative and will make you want seconds!!!!

I eat at Yolks whenever I am in Chicago.  I usually have eggs over medium well but today they came out over easy. The waiter scooped up my plate apologizing for the mistake and gave the plate to the manager. A few minutes later the manager returned the the correct order apologizing profusely. I have always had good service and delicious here and will continue to come to Yolks.

This place has a modern diner feel and was slammed on Sunday morning. Had a make-your-own omelet which was giant and delicious. Unfortunately it was served with a side of fruit which included dried up orange slices. We split the "tour de france" which was a sampler of 3 types of french toast - the banana bread french toast was delicious but the other two tasted more like overly sweetened cake. Overall I felt like this place was good, but nothing special...

Overrated, overpriced, but still good. No longer have the option to add steak to the skillet, if you want the steak they make you buy the whole skirt steak. Portions are just right but for the money, a rip off. Guess it's the location.
Great service. Good food. A little pricey compared to a greasy spoon diner but food is a lot better. Breakfast special for $8.99 a great deal. Get the French toast with it!

There's no sort of breakfast places in Chicago, and it can often be tough to choose amongst the many that are within walking distance of wherever you are in the city, but Yolk is a standout and definitely worth trying out at least once. The one i tried is located on michigan Ave. My friend and I were hungry and wanting breakfast on a Sunday morning. She suggested Yolk just based on seeing a couple of different locations while walking throughout the city. She heard great things about the place so she wanted me to try.. When we called to inquire about the wait, I was told 30 minutes. We decided to go ahead and walk there, hoping the wait would be less longer during the walk. When we got there, it was definitely busy! We were told the wait would be about 10-15 minutes, but in less than five minutes, we were seated.  We were quickly given waters and greeted by our server. Coffee was poured almost immediately (which was excellent!). We looked over their big menu and decided on the "Hey, Ricky" omelette for my friend and the "West coast crepes" for myself, it cost about 12 dollars each so i strongly believe it's an affordable price.   Food was great and well-priced for the HUGE portions you receive! My friend was very impressed with her omelette and the fact that they used fresh jalapenos. She loved her pancakes as well. My plate was a sort of eggs omelette, served with sweet crepes and i also ordered a side of fresh fruit. Service was great! Our server was friendly and paid just enough attention to us so that we didn't feel ignored, but didn't feel like we were interrupted every two seconds. Everyone there was friendly.  My only complaint is the noise level, which is high during the peak service hours. It's an open kitchen though, so you're not only going to hear the patron chatter, but also the kitchen staff. We were seated at the counter, so of course it would be a bit busier and louder. I'm sure if we were sat at a table away from the kitchen it would have been a bit less noisy. This definitely shouldn't be a reason not to visit Yolk, however. This place is clean and you won't be disappointed.   I would definitely visit Yolk again in the future, as I live in Chicago now and would recommend anyone else to this place!

Yolk is a great breakfast place. There's usually a little bit of a wait but it's worth it. Once you order the food comes out very fast and is delicious. You also get a crazy amount of food for the price.

Ordered the caprese Benedict and it was amazing!! My friend had the Tour de France and it was delicious. The service was really good and the food came out very fast and delicious. The place is really cute I highly recommend it.
Great place for bfast easy way to prep up for the park and museum as it's nearby.
Great way to wake up, nice view n close to my hotel, just around the corner, definitely will come back,

Popular breakfast place.  Good specials.  I had a trio of french toast.  I was expecting a bit more flavor, but it was still good and I ate too much which is easy to do.  These are located all over town, so if you want to go, you should be able to find one close by.
I can make better eggs than Yolk does. I don't get what all the hype is about. Still, it's not bad, per se.
Order a skillet or scramble w/ a large glass of oj. Friendly service.
Never fails. I always leave satisfied when I dine at Yolk. It is short walk from my South Loop residence. Can beat the prices either.

This is a great breakfast place. You have many options that are all reasonably priced. I've been to this location twice and had no issues. Great food and great service. The line was very long but it didn't bother me. I would definately try to go early next time.

When we were in Chicago a year ago, we were told to try Yolk, but when we arrived, there was a line out the door so we didn't go. So yesterday, we were back in Chicago and we went with high expectations but we came away somewhat disappointed. It wasn't that it was bad. It just wasn't anything special. My wife ordered a side of pancakes with her breakfast and they were tough. She  only took one bite and left the rest. My omelette was okay but nothing to write home about. Interestingly, my wife said the best thing on her plate was the little orange slice. The service was good and the workers friendly. Parking is on-street but the side streets were not too crowded. So like I said, it wasn't bad but quite honestly, we won't go back, simply because we have eaten at places nearby that were better.
Always the best. I usually come to this location and they are consistent.  They serve you great food and they serve it fast. The staff is always the same and they are always very friendly.

How many synonyms are there for amazing? Huge menu! Over the top good food. Huge staff that is super friendly and a kitchen that hums like a Swiss watch. Excellent coffee.  This is a must-stop breakfast experience for foodies and non-foodies alike.

I love going here when I am in Chicago! This place is a solid 4 stars because the food is delicious and you receive large portion sizes. I have been here numerous times during conferences and they are decently priced, plus they also split the check which is nice when you need a receipt to keep for reimbursement.  However, it can get really busy so if you are on a tight time frame, I would call ahead of time and see what the wait is.
Great service. Busy location. Blueberry crunch cakes.  3 of us ate there and we all loved our dishes.  I now look around for a Yolk when I'm in a new city.  Truth!

Absolutely adore this place. Wish we had one close to home!! We went here 3 different mornings during our stay in Chicago last summer. I LOVE the homemade Greek yogurt, husband had Benedict, kids enjoyed pancakes. Get there early, especially on weekends. Fills up quickly!!

It would have been 5 stars, but they don't serve alcohol!!!  They are BYOB, which is weird, and seems more dangerous, but I didn't know this until we'd already gotten there.  They should sell bottles for those of us who come not knowing.  It was my birthday when I went so that was upsetting to not be able to get a mimosa.... I've always enjoyed my food here, though, and besides the crazy wait on weekends, it's always a good experience.

No matter what the wait is, it's worth it. This place is fantastic! I went here on New Year's Day with 2 friends and it was incredibly crowded and the hostess told us it would be 25 minutes. After only 10 minutes, she called my name so that was a great surprise. They turn tables over very quickly here so you won't have to wait nearly as long as you think. Each one of us enjoyed our food. I got a Belgian waffle and the batter they used was slightly sweeter but it worked perfectly. If you can, get the red potatoes as they will hit the spot perfectly.  It was not very expensive and had great food. I'll be back!

Loud.  Crowded.  And gloriously perfect for your breakfast and brunch needs whether you are dining alone or with a crowd.  Even though the weather was nasty on this Saturday morning, the masses still arrived hungry for the kale scrambler or the pot roast Benedict or the blueberry oatmeal.  The kitchen master is an organizational genius as he bellows out the orders and they arrive perfectly minutes later.  Great service and many healthy - and not-so-healthy - choices.

I had an eggs benedict with salmon. It was alright and certainly passable. The English muffins were rather tough to cut and even to chew. The hollandaise sauce wasn't particularly flavorful. The salmon, however, was quite good. I don't think the whole dish, plus an orange juice, justified over $20. This wasn't the most thrilling experience.

O-M-G. So this place is so good, I walked 4km up Michigan Ave to get to it! Not to mention, I came all the way for Toronto waiting to enjoy the breakfast here again. The service is amazing every single time and the food too!! I wanted some make me feel horrible about myself stuff after I eat it, and I GOT IT! Red velvet french toast with icing? YES PLEASE. Make sure to get it. It will make you love eating it but  hate yourself after lol. Definite 'must go to' in Chicago.

I found a Unicorn - Christmas Eve morning with no waiting at Yolk. For those that have not had the pleasure, this place has a ridiculous wait time during the warmer months. While the food is good, it's just not worth the wait. If you get in, great. The menu is extensive and filled with all the brunch staples, including some unusually good twists. For example, I opted for the Irish Benny (eggs Benedict with hash instead of Canadian bacon). The portions are good, which for brunch, is always nice.

This was my 2nd trip to Yolk for brunch and they failed to disappoint again! I ordered off the special menu and for the Potato Skin Skillet. It was a very nice combo of breakfast meets appetizer topped with two perfectly cooked eggs. Delicious! The fresh orange juice is a nice touch.  Yolk can get a bit busy, but with high quality breakfast food like this, you can see how they would be packed to the hills. Expect a wait on weekends. Tip: don't shy away from the bar! Both times we walked right in and were seated right away. As a bonus, you get to see all the kitchen action with a cast of at least 6 cooks!
Really great array of options, absolutely loved the California Omelette!

AWESOME!!!!!!! Ate here twice in one week! Had the Ricky Ricardo with side of bacon first time. second time french toast. They were both fantastic! anytime im in chicago, ill be back! Only thing......for the price of a side of bacon, should get more bacon. Kinda steep. Some of the best french toast! LOTS of food..............be warned! :)

I heard this place was really good. I don't think I ordered the right meal tho to give such a solid rating. Maybe that's my fault. Good eggs, and bacon, and sausage, and average French toast i think. We got right in and food came out fast. Everything else was good.
One of the best things about visiting Chicago is going to YOLK for breakfast!

Oh. My. God. This place is in my top 10 of all places I've ever been and probably top 3 for breakfast. We walked in there on a Sunday morning December 2014 and had to wait about 15-20 minutes for bar seating for two. I ordered the Yolk All Star Breakfast and the bae got the Irish Benny. I tried both and I can assure you they are nothing short of amazing. All star breakfast: for $8.99 I got two sausages, two bacon, two eggs and choice of pancake, waffle or crepes. I opted for the FLUFFIEST CREPES IVE EVER HAD and I have never been happier at breakfast. That sausage is heavenly too it's not the crap Denny's sausage that you get, it's legit tender, juicy sausage. Eggs and bacon are hard to mess up. Irish Benny: if you love corned beef hash and any form of Eggs Benedict.... Game on. It comes with fresh fruit and potatoes too! Yum. The mouth is salivating as I leave this review. Go to yolk, you will not be disappointed. Worth the wait. Soo worth the wait.

I was staying next door and thought this place looked interesting.  I had the Farm House which is biscuits and gravy.  The food was good and I can imagine other items are just as well prepared.  When I order biscuits and gravy the gravy doesn't have to cover the plate but it should cover the biscuits.  At least two of my five (not sure they got five on my plate) didn't have gravy. Also when I order eggs up I expect the yolks to be runny not the whites. Food tastes great and terrific service but I wouldn't recommend the farm house at this time.

Wow. The waitress was really nice here. I feel like she did a very good job.  The food was pretty good. I ordered the Kale Scrambler and thought it was pretty healthy. Although, the fruit could look better. I would definitely come back here.

Inside the restaurant we were greeted by welcoming staff and seemingly happier customers. The service was amazing. Seated and ready earlier than expected with very kind servers. Prices were very fair for the amount of food you get (ie: a lot). Food was served in a timely and efficient manner. The oatmeal, omelets and pancakes were all great with no disputes, very appetizing. Only problem we encountered was with splitting our checks as there was an error, although it was quickly resolved. Great place to start your morning and (hopefully) meet some attractive people.

Welp, searching for a breakfast spot that serves a full breakfast is actually quite difficult to find in this area. We were lucky enough to stumble upon Yolk. The good portioned, full breakfast was wonderful. We sat right away and were seated at the bar...fine by us! The waiters were nice and it was funny to watch the chemistry of the staff. There were a ton of flirts and they all seemed to be in love with each other. Hilarious. And I loved their t-shirts. Yolk...Handling your Huevos since XXXX. Had to get one. Definitely go to breakfast at yolk.

Bland, disappointing, assuming the chorizo in the scrambler was just plain sausage. The biscuit was drier than the Mojave and no amount of butter could coax it to moistness. One star for a marginal cup of coffee. Next time I'll go to the grocery store and make my own breakfast. Please excuse me, there are some damn kids on my lawn...

Delicious.  I ordered the Santa Fe Frittata with multigrain pancakes.  The frittata was like *kaPOW* in my mouth.  The pancakes were scrum-diddly-umptious.  To make matters even better, Truvia packets are offered at the table.  I look forward to my next visit.

First time coming there. So disappointed. Me and my bf went there because the reviews were great and it was very close to my hotel. I ordered the Irish Benedict and there was a GIANT BLACK HAIR!! They said they would make me a new one. They brought it back in 2 minutes. They probably just scraped off the part where the hair was and gave it back to me. I was disgusted. My boyfriend ordered a normal break fast with eggs, potatoes and bacon. The bacon and potatoes were both under cooked. Another disappointment. Then there were little flys flying around our table. They should have comped my eggs Benedict. I was not happy I will not return.

Came in on a Sunday morning. We were told there was a 40 minute wait for our table for 4 but the actual wait ended up being considerably less. They are quite efficient and getting folks in and out in a timely manner.  Food was really good and it was nice to see Truvia as an option as a sweetener.

I went to Yolk on a Friday morning with high hopes and boy, they didn't disappoint.  Service was quick and friendly.  I couldn't decide between pancakes and the South Beach pineapple thing, so I had both.  BF got scrambled eggs and potatoes. We both wound up eating everything on the table. The South Beach is 1/2 pineapple, scooped out, and filled with homemade Greek yogurt, strawberries, pineapple, granola, and nuts.  I couldn't stop eating it, even though I was full.  In fact, I would love to eat it every morning. The pancakes were good and the bacon was meaty and perfectly cooked.  The scrambled eggs were fluffy and potatoes deliciously seasoned.   If I lived in Chicago, I'm sure I'd be a regular at Yolk.  Can't wait to go back!

You can't go wrong with Yolk. The food is solid and and there is a lot to choose on the menu. I had the 2x2x2 combo and it was very much to my liking. I also was able to mooch food off my company and tried some yummy cinnamon pancake thingy but, more importantly, I had the carnita sandwich which I'm still banging my head against a hard object because that was what my heart was telling me to get. Next time I'll get that sandwich with huevos rancheros.  The drawback? The staff seems to be nothing more than an elementary school cafeteria staff broken down my the hard lessons of motherhood and hating life. A minute in our waitresses eyes was ten minutes. There was little to no eye contact or politeness from any of the other staff. The reason this stays a 4 is because the food was good and I'm not a morning person ( it was at 1130 am) so I'd rather not be bothered by the fake was anyways.
The food was ok. Had better. The service was fast and kind. I got the bacon chicken waffles and didn't really like it.
Great place to start my day off. I had the eggs Benedict and it was delicious. Service could improve to achieve a 4 star for me.
Breakfast was delicious. I got the Chicken & Waffles...friend for the corn beef hash. Service was quick and it was fun sitting at the bar watching the cooking staff.

Let me just say, this place was extra busy... The line was out the door. However, this was a solo trip so I was able to get seated immediately at the bar. The staff was great, very nice. The food was also very good. I got the Yolk 2x2x2x2. I didn't like the sausage but everything else was great. The bacon was crispy, the pancakes fluffy and the eggs scrambled well. Good stuff! I would highly recommend people stopping here for breakfast!

Had the Tour de France French toast: Banana nut bread with banana, Sweet orange bread with strawberries, Lemon poppyseed bread with blueberries. Delicious! My friends had omelets which they also loved. The wait is insanely long, but we went on a weekday and so didn't have to wait long at all. --I dream about that French toast!

Split the Red Velvet French Toast for the table. It was incredible! However, I don't recommend getting it as a full meal because you're basically eating a cupcake or dessert of sorts.  Our main dishes came out so quickly, and everyone was happy with their choices: Make Your Own Omelet, Frittata, Croque Madame, and Cheese Blintzes. They were definitely large portions so we left full and satisfied.  Despite the wait, turnover was quick and they have a good system; there's a waiting area and they use a microphone to make sure the names are heard. I recommend ordering a coffee/tea/etc. at the counter for while you wait!  I don't believe they serve alcohol.

It may be due to the high volume of people at the time that I went, however, I found the dishes to be lackluster in taste, and presentation was absent. Certainly not the worst, but it is not a high ranking establishment on my list. Service was also not optimal, friendly staff, but just not enough attention when things were needed of them. However, though I think this may be circumstantial, consistency is important.
Love this place! Fast and friendly service, as well as great food! Favorite option is the good morning burger

Great breakfast place. The atmosphere is nice and clean, open and bright. The menu has a lot of great options to choose from. Big portions and waitstaff was friendly. The food came in a timely manner.  I ordered an omelette which was very good. I would definitely come back again for breakfast next time I visit Chicago.

Oh Yolk, you are the breakfast diner that I've always been dreaming of! Everything was excellent. EVERYTHING! The fresh squeezed Strawberry Orange Juice is freaking amazing. I ordered the Red Velvet French Toast and let me state that I ordinarily do not care for things like stuffed French toast because it's often too sweet. These were so beautifully perfect. They were swirled with cream cheese frosting which had more of a cream cheese flavor rather than an overpowering sugar flavor. Unfortunately I was only able to eat one of the three pieces because it's all my stomach could handle, although it would have been worth gorging myself to the point of getting sick. My husband ordered the 2x2x2x2 and everything was so good! It's amazing that something as simple as breakfast can be done so deliciously. I will without a doubt be returning since this is now one of my favorite breakfast establishments! Mmmmm...

Bongo Room, Yolk, and Waffles are all in the same category (and within a few blocks of each other) for brunch.  Great food, but expect to wait a while for a table during the weekend brunch rush.  None of them serve alcohol, so if you're craving your mimosa or bloody Mary, you're better off heading to the nearby Eleven City Diner.   I'd probably edge Bongo Room a little ahead of the other two, but you really can't go wrong with any of them. From a comparison perspective, Yolk has a bigger space and a more traditional/familiar menu than the others.  It's also the noisiest and cheapest of the three.   Something else to keep in mind: Yolk offers catering!  If you're having a bunch of people over to your house for breakfast (after a wedding or whatever), Yolk can save you the hassle!

The food was delicious! We didn't wait at all to be seated, and they seem to accommodate large groups easily. Splitting the check was also not a problem, As the sever was very accommodating. There was no extra charge for a larger party either. For a brunch place it is a tad expensive (eggs Benedict 12$ and you get two small eggs potatoes fruit 1 English muffin) but it was worth it. It's one of those places where when they serve fruit with your meal they serve fresh tasty fruit, that you enjoy eating. Advise to either hold altogether or to have on the side the hollandaise sauce - it is a bit too heavy and everything tastes great without it. Will come back for sure!!

Ate breakfast at the Yolk this morning. I have a new favorite. Solid cup of Joe, great food and fast service. Our waitress, Gloria, was awesome and super friendly. Never had to ask for anything, as she kept the coffee flowing and our needs met. Solid food, great waffles and eggs. Three days in a row and it always delivered. The third day the waitress was disappointing in getting our order and making coffee rounds but the crepes were good.

I absolutely love this place. My boyfriend and I go a few times every month for breakfast, and I have liked everything I have tried. The servers are also nice, and the service, once you are seated, is quick. I would recommend this place to anyone!

OMG. I don't need lunch or dinner today. Everyone told us to come here and it was good advice. Pecan banana waffle with caramel. Wife had waffle with bacon in the batter. Side of diced potatoes. Everything was fresh and tasted great. Alex was our server and had some good suggestions for sharing and answered plenty of menu questions. Amazing breakfast.
Not sure what happened today, but everyone dropped the ball. I've been here before and enjoyed it. Today my entire experience was less than adequate.

I went here two times and the food is alright. I had better breakfast food elsewhere. The service was kinda slow since we had to call our waitress to come and she took awhile. I went on the weekend and even though it's pack the service should of been better. I found out about this place through my best friend. I will not go back to this place since it's not that good.

Yolk South Loop is your basic breakfast joint.  Much better than your national chain brand but not enough to really separate it from the above average to amazing.  I was pretty excited to try this place out considering how many people were there and how long the wait was, but when all was said and done, I felt I was just eating at your typical breakfast joint with a menu that includes a couple unique dishes.  I thought maybe that the way they make their food was the reason behind their fame.  However, when the food came, I did not notice anything spectacular about it.  The service was pretty good, though more professional than anything.. get in, get out, have a nice day.  I do like the layout and the place is kept pretty clean for how crowded and busy it gets.  Overall, I have to say I did not find anything about Yolk that gets me hyped.  They do make their food better than others, but I don't know a good breakfast place anywhere that I could get the same thing I get here that taste's almost identical.  I'll say that if you are in the area and looking for some descent breakfast options or early lunch, then Yolk is a good start.  Definitely a solid backup plan at the least.

Hit this place early on a weekday morning, so in and out no problem. Service was stellar and the coffee was excellent.  Huge menu.  Had the Ironman omelet with multigrain pancakes.  Everything was solid, but not great.  Little disappoint with the fruit that came with the dish and I've had better multigrain pancakes.  Prices seemed fair and I'd give it another try.

This place is sooo gooood! I love breakfast food and this place hits the spot! I had the Santa Fe frittata and my boyfriend had the Big Texas omelette both were amazing! I also got a side of blueberry, banana and granola pancakes those were good!

I'm always coming here because it's so close.. For all the times I've dined in or carried out, I'm never disappointed in the food so Yolk gets 5 stars for me as my go to for breakfast in the area! I usually get the west coast crepes and add turkey sausage, but I've also had their Benedicts, omelettes, frittatas, and French toasts. Their lunch options are pretty good too. It is always crowded on the weekends however so be prepared to wait, try to grab a counter spot, or just get carry out!
I went here twice on my three-day trip in Chicago. Now back in NYC and tried several brunch palces, I really regret I didn't have more time in Yolk. Best egg benedict ever!!!

No syrup needed! Great spot with excellent staff.  Food was delicious. I ordered a red velvet waffle and a side of strawberry-orange juice. (Before you add the syrup make sure to taste, they are flavorful as is.) I would recommend this place to all my friends.

I took my girlfriend to have breakfast we just saw this place then we got in food and service was good... Why I m giving 3 stars cuz we shared the big breakfast plate and they charge 2 extra dollar for sharing I never heard something like that.... I didn't like it.

I'll start by saying that I'm not a big fan of breakfast places. But this is probably great if you're more into breakfast places, like some of my classmates.  Which is the only reason some of us ate there...  Though we only ate there when there was no line. The food is fine and I do like that some of the dishes will come with a slice of fruit :3  I do think it's a bit overpriced for standard breakfast food, but maybe that's just my opinion.

So good for breakfast! It's tradition for us to come here. Come hungry for the generous portions and be prepared to wait about 30-45 mins on weekends. Worth it for us. Great fast service once you get seated. Had chocolate chip pancakes, fruit nut pancake and two eggs any style (scrambled with feta), and coffee. All very good! One last note, because it's so busy it tends to be loud.

Yolk South Loop is a very solid breakfast / brunch choice. The food and service are both very good. The place is large so you can fit a good sized group. However, there is nothing really special about this place. The wait is way too long for what you get inside. I would suggest looking elsewhere if there is a line outside.

Albeit the 30 minute wait on a Saturday, I really enjoyed this place for breakfast out of the places I went to during my trip to Chicago.  I got the eggs benedict with a salad and fruit and I thoroughly enjoyed my meal.   This place is pretty happening so if you are going for breakfast on a weekend, be prepared to wait.  I've walked past this place on a weekday morning and found there wasn't so much a crowd. Large menu, good food, great location for tourists in the South Loop :)

I don't live in Chicago anymore and on the weekends I wake up and cry because I can't go to Yolk. With that being said, when I do visit Chi, I won't miss a trip to this brunch haven. Fast, friendly service and great portions all for a very reasonable price! The stuffed french toast is heaven. The omelettes are huge and the ingredients are fresh. Love you, Yolk.

I have been to this Yolk twice now and am already planning to take my out of town guests here in a few weeks. Yes, it's noisy, yes, there is a wait, but yes, it's worth it all. Finding a brunch spot in Chicago's South Loop is harder than you think, as my boyfriend and I found out the hard way the other weekend. We wandered around for about 30-45 minutes until we came across Yolk. The line outside was daunting, but we decided to risk it and see what the wait was. We were told 30 minutes but it was more like 10 minutes and we were seated at the breakfast counter (our preference).  The food here is so good-it's exactly what you think of when you think 'brunch'. I got the Mexican style scramble and my boy got the breakfast burrito, both were delicious! The service here is great-quick, but very friendly too. I love sitting at the breakfast counter as you can see what goes on in the kitchen. Having used to work in restaurants, I admire the efficiency of Yolk's kitchen. Prices here are what you expect from any other quality brunch place in Chicago, nothing too high but not dirt cheap either. Although I haven't been to any other Yolk locations, I would recommend that you visit whichever once is closest to you as soon as possible for some unbelievable brunch!

As far as breakfast places go, this one is definitely above average. The food is served in generous portions and the wait times are very reasonable(30 min for a party of 6 on a Sunday morning).  With most breakfast eateries your view consists of other buildings across the street, but with Yolk you also get a view of grant park if you are facing the windows, which is fantastic!
Had to wait about 40 minutes but good food and service. Busy atmosphere. Casual dress. I would come back.

Food was great. The portion size and quality was better than expected. The staff was friendly and on top of making sure all the customers needs were meet. I highly recommend this place for breakfast while visiting Chicago, you will not be disappointed.

I came here for brunch I had the salmon salad the bell peppers it was spectacular.  The salmon was not over done and packed with flavor! It was a great healthy start to  our day.  Our server was so friendly and kind! Would come here again!!!
We eat at YOLK every time we are in Chicago. We have never been disappointed. I wish all breakfast places could Put this much pride and attention into their food.

I visited Yolk again and again was disappointed.  The service and the food were mediocre.  The restaurant is hot and muggy and has been since they opened.  A lot of tourist traffic here due to the proximity of hotels and museum campus. I suggest the following nearby neighborhood brunch restaurants that have much  much better food and customer service: 11th Street Diner at 1112 S Wabash - The house french toast and any of their omelettes are amazing.  The owner Brad and his parents are usually working and they and the staff are always attentive. Bongo Room at 1152 S Wabash - Great savory and sweet choices.  Usually crowded but the staff are vigilant and the wait list goes quickly.  Their chicken and avocado omelette is the best.  One minor drawback is their breakfast potatoes are barely heated through. Waffles at 1400 S Michigan - Hands down, the most fun wait staff.  Attentive, funny and engaging.  Known obviously for their waffles, but their savory items are amazing. Little Branch Cafe at 1251 S Prairie Ave - Definitely a hidden gem.  Newer staff are definitely more friendly.  Try the daily special frittata. Meli Cafe at 500 S Dearborn - Relatively new breakfast place.  Family run with efficient wait staff.  Expansive menu.  Try one of their many scrambles.

This was our first stop in Chicago when we came for a long weekend! My husband and I shared the Tour de France because it seemed like we should (three different types of French toast, it was definitely different than the usual but worth it!) and he had the California Crepe (says it melted in his mouth) and I had the South Beach, which was an entire half pineapple carved out and filled with Greek yogurt and granola with pineapple chunks and strawberry slices on top. Awesome.

Avoid brunch time. We were told at the hostess stand that the wait was 30 minutes but we wait an hour. Although it was very busy and LOUD, it was well worth the wait! The Multi-grain Blueberry Crunch pancakes were divine (just wished they hadn't already poured syrup all over it before they served it) The make your own skillet with a side of eggs was the way to go, a huge helping of goodness.  Will go back if ever in the city again.

Super busy but way delicious. They have the best tiny round ice cubes...you ice-lovers out there know what I'm talkin' about. ;) The omelet, frittata, and multigrain pancakes we had were great, and the mint iced tea was wonderful! We will definitely be back! Oh, and don't forget to get mints on the way out...the white packages are butter mints and the brown ones are chocolate-covered butter mints!

Quick counter service, standard fare; nothing to write home about, either crowing or complaining.  Though the coffee was bland, the service was attentive and on-point, and the warmed-up cinnamon roll bumped my rating up just a little bit higher than it would have been if I'd just stuck with the bland caprese omelet I ordered.   Next time I should go with one of their sweeter options - those looked bomb.  Oh, and PS - if you go to sit at the counter to save time, don't bring your knee caps.. they won't fit.
Very good place for lunch! The portion for each is quite massive to Japanese stomach... but it's delicious!
Hearty portions and excellent service. I love the coffee they serve which for me is critical.

Good food and service. Prices are high, but in line with Chicago.  Waits are often an hour or longer.  Breakfast is an easy meal to make, so there are other places nearby, which will be less expensive and with a shorter or no wait.

Awesome breakfast spot and highly recommend. If you want to avoid a wait, get there by 8:30am.  Very nice, friendly staff and know the menu in and out to provide suggestions that meet your needs. The food was hot and super fresh. The cut fresh fruit was in season.

Came here for brunch on a Sunday.  Apparently they have a few locations.  The wait for two people was about 45 minutes. Ordered the  countryside skillet, tasted pretty decent and fresh.  The first few bites tasted really great and after a while, got tired of the dish, perhaps it was what I ordered.  The eggs were cooked nicely, and the potatoes tasted great. Very simple seasoning and not overly cooked.  You can tell it wasn't cooked on the stove and left there to scoop on to dishes as an afterthought.  Had a side order of the banana but bread and can say it is the best banana but bread I have ever had.  Soft, but holds it shape.  Served with syrup or peanut butter.  The peanut butter!! Drool!! Not going to lie, ate the peanut butter on its own after wards.  Service was average for a bustling restaurant.  Don't know if its worth all this wait but the banana nut bread is why I give it 4 stars instead of 3 and why I would come back for just that... If I don't have to wait... And if I find out what kind of peanut butter that was.  Peanut butter jelly time!!
Don't expect amazing food here. The lines may be long but it's essentially close to IHOP in taste. I'm normally not judgmental, but I was really expecting better
Everything you want in a breakfast spot... Great service, huge portions, affordable. We ate here twice while on vacation in Chicago.

Always split a sweet and salty - you can't go wrong with any of their French toast options and skillets! The Very Berry French toast is probably one of the best I've had. Fresh fruits, Greek yogurt, and hearty challah bread dipped in egg. Yolk gets pretty crowded so be sure to call ahead if you don't want a wait to gauge how long your wait time will be. Portions are pretty big.

Worth the wait for perfect brunch. We ordered crepes with scrambled eggs and they were delicious combination of sweet crepe with savory fillings. Service was very prompt and although they were crowded, service was excellent. Would definitely recommend to all, but just be ready for little bit of wait.

So crazy busy.  Plan to wait for at least an hour of a Sunday morning.  But once you get a table, they are pretty fast.  Good thing because parking is only validated for two hours at the lot next door.   The place is really loud because it's packed with people,  so not good for conversation. But great if you need to wake up!  The food was so good.  Based on ambiance and wait time,  I would have given this place fewer stars,  but the food selection is huge,  tastes great,  and portion size is gigantic!  I was able to have a full meal from my leftovers the next day!  Maybe next time I'll carry out and eat in the park... avoid the wait and the loud seating area.
Love this place!!  It's a bit noisy and busy, but the service is still fast and the food is delicious!!  Definitely going to hit this every Chicago trip!!
Brunch items are somewhat standard, taste is just at par. If ur looking for quick eats then better not this place.

Yum! Believe the hype :) If you have the patience to wait and you're nearby, definitely try this place out for breakfast or for brunch!  I got the Countryside skillet which was generous in portions. The buttermilk  pancakes were soft and fresh too! They are known for their pancakes :)  If you are vegetarian, there are plenty of vegetarian options to choose from as well!   Service was friendly and attentive despite how busy it was on Sunday morning.  Will definitely come back if given the chance!

Great breakfast and brunch place right on Michigan Ave in the south loop across from Grant Park. We had the Toscan Fritata and the create your own skillet, both with pancakes. Everything was good. We enjoyed this place better than the nearby bongo room. It's better priced, more options, bigger portions and shorter wait
Pretty good place, had the strawberry orange juice and the eggs Benedict caprese.  Definitely a lot of food but very good. No wifi though.

LOVE it! Was visiting the city for 6 days and we came here twice for breakfast. My kids loved it!  Day 1: We had the Bacon waffle and Tour de France French toast!! Day 2: Bacon Waffle (again), California Omelet and Pot Roast Benedict. The portions are big enough to share. This place gets BUSY on the weekend. Come early or come on the weekeday after 8am. Very kid friendly!

The breakfast here was good/perfectly fine BUT really not any better than a breakfast you can get at any decent restaurant in Anytown USA therefore I just didn't understand the hype and the 40 minute wait. With expectations that high, one can only be let down. It felt like an overhyped yuppy breakfast factory. There really wasn't a ton of ambience and the constant names being called out overhead made it even worse. The food was perfectly good- no complaints there other than it not being something I'd want to wait for again.

Loved our breakfast at Yolk. I had the Egg's Benedict (replacing the hash brown with fruit) and it was delicious. Great coffee too. Very impressed with the efficiency and attentiveness of the staff also. I realise "it's all about tips" as we are told over and over, but nevertheless still makes for a great experience. I hear this place is a favourite of the lads at Waikato Inc. also.
Portions are HUGE. 2 eggs is really more like 4-6, so order light, but the food is extraordinary.

If you love house music with your huevos rancheros, this is the place for you. If you're down with dub step and eggs benedict, welcome. This place is pretty good, but the music will make you want to kill yourself. The waitress said that people complain about it all the time. There are other breakfast places with less aggressive soundtracks around the area. Seriously, it's hard to mess up breakfast food. It's apparently very easy to destroy ambiance.

Never in my life have I had such an emotional connection to a plate of food. In a city that really believes in brunch, we knew we had to scope out the scene.  After some aggressive recommendations from locals we checked out this location of Yolk, because we heard that parking was going to be manageable. The place was bustlin', so we waited for about 30 minutes, which was fine because people watching was ON POINT.  The place was one of those dining establishments where you look around and see folks from every walk of life.  From church attendees to hungover 20-somethings, the place was a morning safe-haven for all involved. Get the Eggs Benedict.  Any kind that strikes your fancy.  No regrets.

You should only go to this place if you have no more than a party of 4. Anything more then that and you will be uncomfortable and have no room to eat. The staff is also very rude if every single person has not arrived. Even if it's just one person. The food is just above IHOP but not bad. If you know how to cook, you can make it at home.  I rate places on food quality and customer service. DO NOT come here if you want to hear the person next to you. Happy travels.

Our family headed here to start our day. We had left our information and were told that there was a 45 minute wait. Since the place was so highly reviewed, we decided to do the wait. The place was packed from 11am, when got there, up until 12pm. We got seated and we ordered our brunch. I went with the Irish Benny. My wife did the bluberry crunch pancakes. The kids got mac and cheese, a stack of pancakes, and chicken fingers. Two words; ALL CRAP. The Benny had zero flavor. The pancakes, both regular and my wife's order, were pastey. The mac and cheese looked straight out of a Kraft box. No place with this kind of food deserves a 45 minute wait. It's like having the same wait to a soup kitchen. Never again. There are MUCH better places for breakfast in Chicago. THIS YOLK IS A JOKE!

Great food - fast and friendly service. The portions are HUGE so bring your appetite! A really busy place, but lots of seating. Don't expect to have an intimate conversation with your group because the atmosphere is definitely louder than most! A must when visiting Chicago!

We ate here almost morning we were in Chicago. Best breakfast in town. Great service and family friendly. So excited they will be opening a restaurant in Austin and offering Gluten free items. So yummy.
Great place for breakfast. Lots if selection and the portions are huge. Kids pancakes are enough for a lumberjack!  Service is quick and excellent. I recommend this place.

I ate here back n June on a Girls Weekend and this was the BEST breakfast Ive eaten..ever. I had the scrambled eggs with cheese, bacon, sauages, and a waffle. the portions were a very nice size for the price and the food tasted amazing. our waitress was very nice and the interior is beautiful, very lively and friendly. i plan on eating here very time a visit Chicago.

I like the variety of items on the menu, well-lit, clean, and attentive staff. Our food arrived in a timely manner too. I enjoyed the eggs florentine. We had a question about what the veggie burger was comprised of and at the time they didn't know, however, they went ahead and called the source to provide the list. Superb service!

Great food. Great service. Food came out in less than 10 minutes and it was busy.  My friend that I brought said he would recommend Yolk to others. I would recommend stopping by if you're looking for quality food at a great price. It can get busy at times, but the food is well worth the wait. I would recommend the Tour De Force french toast platter!

I as in town for a wedding, and ate at Yoke two days in a row. Good hearty breakfast with a friendly efficient  staff. Day one, I sat at the counter Irish Benny, corned beef hash on top of a english muffin with poach eggs, hollandaise sauce, served with a generous portion of fruit. The breakfast I had was wonderful and I enjoyed it greatly, but sitting at the counter watching all the food go by gave me nonstop food envy.  Day two Chicken and Waffles, a bacon waffle, that's right, bacon right in the waffle, topped with some nice crispy breaded chicken strips, that was topped with a wonderful sausage gravy, how can you go wrong. I also tasted the delicious Tuscan Frittata, so big my friend hardly made a dent in it. Eggs baked with diced chicken, sun-dried tomatoes, diced red skinned potatoes, fresh basil and a topping of creamy goat cheese, yummy!!! Coffee and water always kept full throughout the meal. This would be my go-to breakfast hang out if I lived in Chicago. Get there early can get very busy after 8:30 on the weekends.

We were visiting Chicago for a long weekend, and ended up at Yolk based on a recommendation from one of our friends local to the area. The wait was ridiculous... It was close to an hour on a Saturday. But the food really made up for it. The best part of breakfast? The Red Velvet French Toast!! It was incredible during brunch and left overs were still great as we had them I the beach. If you're a coffee freak, like I am, hit the Starbucks and how it while you the wait.
Awesome food, great service and a pretty cool atmosphere. Definitely rate this as a top place for brekkie.  Try the Iron man omelette. Delicious and healthy.

I went here for breakfast with my two kids. I was told the wait was 30 minutes but it took over 45! The food was good. I ordered an egg scrambler with cheddar cheese, jalapeño peppers and turkey sausage. It was good, very spicy. I sent it back at first because I thought if was green pepper instead of the jalapeño that I asked for. My daughter had the crunch berry oatmeal. It was tasty. My son ordered the kids pancakes. I had to pay an extra $1.49 for maple syrup. Although I liked the food, I doubt if I'll go again anytime soon. I don't like waiting more than fifteen minutes to be seated for breakfast.

Great spot for a breakfast that can cure any hangover. Very family friendly (aka they don't serve mimosa's or bloodies). I ate the Zamboni crepe which was amazing.  It's can be a bit pricey charging $4 for 4 pieces of bacon and $3 for a cup of coffee, you are in the loop on the park, what else can you expect.  There is usually a decent wait, so plan on sending a member of your party early to get in line.

We love this place! I can't get enough if the banana blueberry crunch cakes! The food is great, the atmosphere is fun and casual. Good place to take kiddos. The wait is usually a little long, and the service isn't always on point but for a easy breakfast joint you really can't beat this place. If you have the chance I would definitely tell you to stop in and have a bite!
Poorly run. Waited for over an hour while they seated parties that came after us.   Good is bad. Not worth the wait. Skip it.

Open for breakfast on the Fourth of July! Had eggs, toast, and fruit (sometimes you just want simple) and all were delicious. All the fancier stuff I saw go by looked incredible.  Just one problem: the coffee was terrible! Asked for a new cup and it was just as bad. Can't explain why; just tasted off. But server was very nice about it and took it off the bill.
I have gone to this location since 2010, and I still look forward to going on weekends. The menu is diverse, the food is consistent, and the staff is great.

Let's start with the positive: the food is better than average. Now the bad....First, we came in and it was very warm so I asked the server if something was wrong with the AC and he ignored me. Strike one. Second....I asked for a small piece of watermelon for my toddler and he said that was a "special request that required management approval". What?! Mind you, the piece is about 3" and comes standard on all the side plates. He came back and said that we'd have to buy an entire side plate to get the tiny piece of watermelon. Strike two. Third....as we were leaving I asked the hostess what was up with the lack of AC and I was again ignored. Strike three. I will take my business elsewhere. You have to wonder, how does a place with rude, petty people stay in business? In retrospect, I think the place has a long standing issue with the AC and is just getting tired of hearing people complain about it. But a bit of advice.....either fix the problem or apologize to customers who ask about it. Sweating while eating is not good and ignoring customer questions is worse.

Yolk! Decided to try this place out because it was closest to where we had parked early in the morning despite the reviews of this location - since there are about 4 to 5 other locations as well.  The place was definitely bigger than I had imagined for a breakfast/lunch place. The staff were somewhat pleasant - we got asked for drink shortly after we were seated and placed out orders shortly after looking over the menu. We ordered the South of the Border Benny and Yolk 2x2x2x2 Combo with Banana-Blueberry Crunch Cakes instead of regular ones. The South of the Border Benny was delicious and I really enjoy that it came with a variety of fruits as well as diced red potatoes. The Yolk 2x2x2x2 Combo with Banana-Blueberry Crunch Cakes came with regular pancakes. We didn't notice until we actually went to eat them. We asked the waiter if there was a mistake and he gladly put the order back in for the special cakes that we wanted. But is it a Chicago thing that when something was ordered wrong that they take the original dish and toss it out before giving the actual dish? This was the second time this situation had happened in Chicago! Why not save it for us to eat and not charge us for the mistake made?  This location is convenient for those who plan on traveling to the Museum Campus afterwards - only a few blocks away! I recommend this place for breakfast/lunch!

My second time at yolk, my first time at this location. It was bigger than I had expected. A bit of a loud environment. My friend ordered an omelette and I ordered a skillet. Both were delicious and generously portioned. I took home half of my skillet plus the sides. I love that you have so many choices for sides as well! Fruit (a delicious variety of grapes, watermelon, orange slices, and pineapple slice) or yummy red potatoes PLUS pancakes, english muffin, or toast. Each dish came out to be a little over $10. I'd say the portions and the taste were well worth the price! Also, my friend ordered coffee which I had a taste of at the end. It was not diluted and quite flavorful. I will be back here again sometime to try some other items! Their menu is pretty big.

What can I say that 1000 other people haven't already said... This is a solid brunch place. Love the large, bright space. Service was prompt and friendly, though I came in the middle of a Monday, so that statement may not hold true on the weekends. Portions are generous. I ordered the kale and goat cheese scrambler (a summer special) with potatoes and pancakes. I liked the unique ingredients in the scrambler. Potatoes were a bit on the salty side, but not too bad. Pancakes were pancakes. I was hoping they'd have real maple syrup, but it was of the fake, corn syrup variety. The menu is very extensive; I'll come back to try their crepes.

We visited the yolk twice on our trip to Chicago. Very good meal, good service, crazy menu. I had the 2x2x2x2 and it was good. My wife had the caprese Benedict and a traditional Benedict and loved both. The French toast was good along with the sausage and gravy. We had a party of 8 and handled it great. Our second visit we were forgotten about for a few minutes however they were quick to react. We will be back.
Great service, consistent good food, sparkling clean restrooms :) I love their pistachio pancake or French toast I just remember it had pistachio on it and it was very good

I enjoyed my visit to Yolk the customer service was beyond awesome. Also the multigrain pancakes made me want to come back the next day. The orange juice is fresh squeezed which was another plus. My only suggestion would be to get bigger tables because it was a little difficult to use my laptop.

Really really liked this place. Was looking for a good breakfast place and thought I remembered having this place bookmarked to try. Walked on down from our hotel and waited 30 minutes for a table. Wasn't too long of a wait. They seem to turn the tables over pretty fast. We were seated pretty quickly. Service was just right. Food and plenty of it: I ordered the everything omelet which came with potatoes. Some of the tastiest red potatoes I've ever had. I could have eaten just a whole plate of those. My omelet was pretty good. I ditched the pancakes because all they had was maple syrup which I'm not a fan of, plus the omelet was pretty big. My mom ordered the scrambled eggs with cheese, fruit and pancackes. Dad ordered two eggs with potatoes and pancakes. Portions are quite large.  The forks are a tad awkward. They're too big and clumsy. Nice options, pretty big menu. Would defintely return for breakfast.

Went to Yolk in the South Loop during the week for lunch with a friend.  The prices are about average for the area, but the extra fees pushed them over the top.   For example, I asked for some mayo for my burger.  I received a small container of partially congealed, tasted like cheap generic mayo and was charged 50 cents. Was charged 75 cents for tomato that was advertised to come with the sandwich. My friend was charged 1.50 for an extra piece of bread.  They took the charge for the tomato off the bill but argued that the burger was not listed as coming with mayo.  If you head to Yolk, better take your own condiments. Better yet, skip it. Five guys has a better burger, is cheaper and comes with mayo.  Food was just so so.

Definitely a bit of a wait for Sunday brunch, but well worth it. Yolk lost a star from me because of the chaotic entrance atmosphere/hostess attitude. Other than that, everything was wonderful: from our charming server to our delicious meals.  I had the Tour de France and was pleasantly surprised that it wasn't overly sweet. It's French toast, so of course it's a sweet meal, but the differences in flavors, along with the fruit toppings and peanut butter really elevated the dish for me. I also tried my friend's margherita frittata, which was another fantastic vegetarian find. The basil came through perfectly and the melted fresh mozzarella on top added just enough flavor, without weighing it down.  If you're looking for juice with your breakfast/brunch, this is the place to go! The strawberry orange juice is the perfect complement to any meal!

Seated instantly. Got our food within five minutes of ordering. I ordered the two eggs and a meat a/ a red velvet french toast upgrade, and my friend got a works omelet. Fast, delicious, and fantastic! I highly also recommend the strawberry orange juice.

Had the margarita frittata and the fruit & nut pancakes. The frittata had a great texture and the marinara sauce that came with it was great. The pancakes had a denser texture, but I still thought it was great. Overall, everything was quite good.

For the love of God, stay away from this place on a Sunday morning. I've been to almost every Yolk in the city, and I really hate this one. The service is awfully unfriendly, and the wait times are always through the roof. Save yourself some time (and get fed quicker) at another location around town - I'd suggest the Streeterville one. As I stated in my Streeterville review, as far as the food, I think Yolk does a great job with their menu - I love the healthy options among a lot of fun and interesting ones as well. I think their prices are a little steep, but as far as brunch goes, I think this is a Chicago staple that is worth a shot during non-peak times.

My cousin ordered the red velvet french toast and it was DELISH. Not as sweet as we thought it was going to be.  I got the chicken and big ass waffle and it was just ok.  I'd still go back to try other things...or the red velvet!

One of the best breakfasts I've EVER had anywhere in the U.S.! I've read a few of the negative reviews, specifically regarding the long wait, hard to hear PA system, average food and décor. I'm not really sure where these reviews are coming from, but I can attest that my entire experience here was absolutely excellent!  While on vacation, I came here for Sunday brunch @ about 9:30am and there were definitely a good amount of people waiting. The diner was bustling inside with lots of people, but it seemed the table turnover was really quick as people were always getting up as new customers were arriving. Also, with the diner being real big, there were tons of tables, booths and bar seating as well. The décor inside was very simple, clean, but it definitely had a bright "morning" feel to it with the yellowish paint. Despite what others have said, after only about a short 15 minute wait, we were called thru the PA system (which was loud and clear) and seated at a booth! When seated, we started scoping out other tables nearby and everything that was coming out looked amazingly delicious! The menu was huge and the options (Classic Breakfasts, Benedicts, Omelets, Skillets & Frittatas, Pancakes & Waffles, Crepes, French Toast, etc) were limitless. We just wanted to order everything because they sounded so good! Ultimately, we settled on the Countryside Skillet and Tour De France French Toast. Also, I ordered a plate of corned beef hash on the side. When the Skillet and French Toast came out, they smelled so good, we couldn't wait to get started! The Countryside Skillet was really cheesy, but there was a ton of potatoes in there mixed with the other ingredients (bacon, ham, sausage, mushrooms, onions, green peppers). With every single bite, I could taste all the ingredients in one shot. I loved the combination and it was a perfect mix in the skillet! As for the Tour De France, it was a flight of 3 pieces of French Toast (Banana Nut Bread, Sweet Orange Bread, Lemon Poppysead Bread) with bananas, strawberries and blueberries on top. The French Toast was extremely soft, moist and toasted perfectly. The addition of the syrup made this concoction even more potent and really brought out all the flavors of this sweet, savory goodness. To conclude, the service was also excellent as our waitress was very attentive and always came by to check on us. They were very fast and the food came out relatively quickly despite the amount of action in their kitchen. As I said, it's one of the best breakfasts I've ever had and couldn't be a bigger fan of it!

I went to get breakfast here today and I would've gave them a better review if it weren't for ONE thing.... I order the create your own omelet where it stated on the menu that ALL add in ingredients were .75 cents! I got my check and saw that one of my ingredients (anduoille sausage) was $2.00, I asked the waiter and he stated that some of the ingredients cost more. Though some may say its only $2.00 the fact that its not indicated on the menu I feel is unfair to customers. When I pointed out at the register to the cashier she just stated " Oh you're right its not on there" and still charged me anyway. I am BIG on customer service and if something is advertised one way, thats what the customers need to be charged. I did enjoy the food however, I was not please by the way that was handled and I'm unsure if I'd want to go back :-(

I only have three words to say to you....French Toast Flight!! I was in 7th heaven with this dish.....poppyseed cake with fresh blueberries and hot lemon sauce, banana bread with fresh sliced bananas with PB on side and finishing with Orange bread with fresh strawberries.  All three sweet cake slices were dipped in French toast badder and grilled.....boy, it was good.

I would enjoy to tell the tale of a nice breakfast story that ends in a happy meal, no not that other place destroying the world 1 steroid cow at a time, but me thinks this is not the place for this kind of happy ending story. Other reviews have warned you about the wait, the various menu choices and the décor and wait staff, long, plenty, open and happy, BUT ... What we learned on our first and last trip was that this seems to want to meet the speed need of most in most out, if they can turn the table fast they can seat more, and that translated to very undercooked and short cut prepared dishes.  Basically everything on both our plates could have been gummed down without so much as a picture of a molar, let alone the full sets we both thankfully still own.  Really, cook the food, prepare it with care and a little more time, we live in a city of 3 Mill- I don't mind waiting for good food done right, not ok food done fast.

First day in Chicago ever and breakfast is an important start. From the moment I walked in I was made to feel right at home. The service is friendly, the bottomless pot of coffee is much better than I expected (I'm a coffee snob from Melbourne so I usually end up at Starbucks when I'm stateside - tragic, I know) and the food is just fabulous.

Just as good as the other Yolk locations, but they don't have outdoor seats here. For Yolk, you know the deal, all omelets, scramble eggs, and crepes are great. And don't forget to order the fresh juice!

Went here with my girlfriends for brunch on a Friday  morning and was seated immediately (heard there's a bit of a wait on the weekends). I can't remember the name of our waitress but she was great-she was friendly and on top of our needs. The food was GREAT!!! I was full until dinner and even then I still wasn't really hungry. While the food keeps you full, it was light so you can still make it through the day and don't feel like sleeping after this meal. I will def be returning when I come back to Chicago.
This place isn't very much different form the other populare breakfast chains such as Eggsperience and Jam and Honey. Great food tho!

We stayed just a block from here over New Year's.  What an incredibly creative breakfast menu!  Some of the best locally-roasted coffee I've ever had.  I even bought a bag to bring home.  You know it's a good breakfast joint when the SWAT team is walking out with leftovers as you're walking in.  My husband had the southwestern eggs benadict with chorizo.  It was just amazing!  To the point that we recreated it when we got home and it has become a family favorite!  I had the fruit waffles which were a little too sweet for my liking but most everything is too sweet for me.  :)  Service was excellent.  We will definitely be stopping here for breakfast whenever we're in town! PS - The SWAT team officer gave his leftovers to the homeless guy on the corner.  Truely Chicago's finest, way to go, officer!

I have been here three times now and I can honestly say it's just ok. The first time I think I enjoyed it more and the second time, not so much. the third time was really just like getting breakfast at any place by my house.  I have had pancakes, omelets, eggs Benedict... I have had friends get some special plates and we share. I just didn't see what all the fuss was about after the third visit. The orange juice is good but way over priced.  This place is always busy so be prepared to wait for quite some time. I have sat at the bar before, in a booth, at a table, all of which are fine. The decor on the inside is very fun and lovely. I guess if you're downtown I would actually recommend Wildberry over this place. Which is actually on 130 E. Randolph St. Chicago, IL 60601, to be precise. Sorry Yolk but you're not as fancy as you used to be when you opened. Maybe it's also because you are more of the "Columbia College" kid scene you may be trying to gear towards them.

I must admit wasn't the biggest fan due to last couple visits the wait and where our party was seated. I do believe in giving a place a couple chances stopped in today and food was really good made my own skillet. I will be back

Yolk seems to be quite popular at each of it's locations in the city, so I had to give it a shot. I've been to it 3 times and I have to say that it's just not for me.  The service is great! Friendly host and waitstaff every time I've gone. It's the food and pricing that's not very good.  I ordered an omelette and they put the cheese on top of the eggs, not inside of it. I really do not like this type of omelette.  The dish also comes with red potatoes on the side that were not very tasty. The pricing also seems to be a bit too high for the quality of the food.

I have been here several times, and Yolk never fails to disappoint. I came here most recently back in March. I ordered the West Coast Crepes, which I've had before. I have also had a couple versions of the eggs Benedict dishes. I have always enjoyed my meals here, and you get a ton of food, so you'll always leave full and satisfied. Also, the prices are very reasonable for the amount of food you get. I personally like Yolk better than Bongo Room and Nana, and probably any other brunch places I've tried. The only drawbacks are that this places doesn't take reservations (such is life when it comes to brunch places) and the wait for a table on weekends can be long.
Great place for breakfast or brunch! The price is not expensive at all! Worth it!

its a breakfast place and the menu has what you would expect.  They do it right though.  Waited about a half an hour on a Sunday, so that wasn't too bad, all things considered. Service was friendly and the food was fine.  Not sure I would rush back, but if you are looking for a breakfast/brunch place, this should be on your list.

The menu here is ridiculous. What DON'T they offer here?! After perusing for an hour or two, I decided on the west coast crepes with a side of pancakes. Super delicious, but the portions are enormous! They charge an extra $2 if you split with someone else but I'd rather them deduct $2 and serve smaller portions. Latte was just ok but my friend got the strawberry oj and raved about it - duly noted for next time. The wait wasn't as bad as I thought it'd be for prime wknd brunch time, but our server could've been better. The decor was obnoxious... I felt like I was eating in an Ikea. And the byob situation? Tsk tsk Yolk!
Noisy.  Very active.  But good food. Great coffee.  Had the scramble.  Tasted great.  Worker bees (waiters). Personable.

My husband and I were visiting the city and found this to be our favorite breakfast spot. We were delighted at how close it was to our hotel AND that the food was delicious! We got the strawberry pancakes (as good if not better than original pancake house) and the 2x2x2x2 which had 2 eggs, 2 bacon, 2 sausage, and 2 crepes. We'd recommend upgrading to a special crepe as the plain ones were good but okay. Coffee was hot and refills were frequent. If in Chicago this place is a must go.
Great breakfast, had the Ricky Omellete (egg whites) with fruit and pancakes, everything was delicious, sat at the bar and had great service.  Would frequent yolk if I was a local.

My favorite breakfast spot in the city.  Love there Biscuits and Gravy.  South of the border Benny is SUPER good. Service is always stellar sometimes in the weekends you may have to wait 20-30 mins but always well worth the wait. They use really good coffee can't think of the name right now but it is super good.
I built a skillet then destroyed it. Standard breakfast fare but the coffee was surprisingly good. Service was great. Not blown away but I would def come here again and again

Seriously fantastic breakfast spot on the south loop.  Went in around noon on a monday and we were seated right away.  Trying to decide what to have was not easy- sweet/savory?? What to do!  I originally planned to go for Oatmeal- that went out the window once I saw the other choices.  I went for the pumpkin roll french toast- a winter special that was fantastic, huge portion and the flavors were out of this world.  Daughter had crepes with mushroom, egg, avocado & cheese- delish, light and perfectly seasoned.  She substituted toast for a piece of red velvet french toast- yes I said red velvet french toast!! Moist, delicious and topped with strawberries.   Our server was fantastic- gave great suggestions about the menu and was always there with a coffee or water refill. His comment about my oatmeal " our oatmeal is great but there are so many other things.....sold!"  Was in the area for a conference but would go back again in an instant.  For those who said portions were small- I can't fathom that 4 pieces of french toast or two large crepes would not be enough????

Oddly, even though I've lived in the South Loop for about three years, I've only ever been here twice. I'm giving four stars because of the cheerful decor, great, attentive service we had the other day, and the variety of food on the menu. I am slightly put off by the fact that nothing is organic or particularly healthful. But I do enjoy the ambiance and quick, friendly service. Here's a little tip: Never, ever go to Yolk on weekends, especially Sunday. You will wait in line forever and it's just not worth it. Both times I've been here have been on weekday afternoons when it's been nearly empty and it's been very pleasant. This is not the best food but the place is clean and friendly and you will definitely leave feeling full.

Absolutely love this place!! I come here everytime I'm in Chicago! Huge portions at a great price! This time I made my own skillet with chorizo onion mushrooms And avocado- amazing!!! I couldn't stop eating it. My boyfriend got the big Texan omelette and it was to die for as well! Definitely come here but come early bc there is usually a wait.

This place is amazing. Chocolate chip pancakes will make you have a food baby. They load it up with chocolate. Bacon was delicious. And the lemonade was tip top as well. 5 star rating for a 3 star price. I'd say about average cost for a breakfasts diner. Other than Denny's. There is also no need to be drunk to go here.

Great place for breakfast/brunch.  Have never heard of it despite its apparent popularity in Chicago.  However, it was close to my hotel and I needed to get a good breakfast before a full day of meetings.   I avoided all the crowd as I went early in the morning on a weekday.  Service was fast and the food portions were enough to fill me up.  Would love to have tried some of their sweeter dishes...maybe when I return to Chicago someday!

So believe it or not, I don't eat eggs but I love Yolk. This is one of my favorite places to get...waffles! Yes, waffles. They give you a really large Belgian waffle, the juice is fresh squeezed and can be mixed (try grapefruit, pineapple and orange together) and it's pretty inexpensive. Like any well-known brunch spot in the city, there will be a line on weekends but it's usually about 50% of the stated time for 2. And actually, on nice days, it's nice to just breathe some fresh air and sit outside on the planter walls and talk. I like it alot.

The service at Yolk south loop may be the worst I've ever experienced, anywhere, in any type of restaurant.  The wait staff is painfully slow, the food is clearly dumped on your plate from warming trays in the kitchen and often poorly cooked.  Each time I've been there people around me have been sending stuff back to the kitchen.  I received 3 pancakes that were pitch black on one side (and of course turned over so that I wouldn't notice till I tried them).  I got two teeny tiny spoonfuls of crumbled, dry scrambled eggs that must have been scraped from the bottom of a tray.  I didn't eat most of what I was served but didn't send it back because I was with two companions and wanted to avoid any unpleasantness.  As I was paying, i did mention to the manager that I didn't feel that I should have to pay for an upcharge ($2.50) tacked on without my permission, and the manager tried to insult me by saying that the kind of customers they usually have don't want to be bothered with being told about upcharges (as if Yolk with all of its pre-cooked and pre-packaged food is actually upscale).  He then caused a hissy-fit scene by calling over the different wait staff members who had served me to interrogate them about whether they had mentioned the charge. Last, he slung the charge slip on the counter for me to sign.  When I commented that this behavior was uncalled for and less than gracious, he responded that it was appropriate since i was getting free food.  ALL this over a $2.50 upcharge???  REALLY????  Since my bill was close to $60 for three people for a basic breakfast that was, to be sure, rather poorly prepared, I can only say that there is something really wrong with the manager of this location.  Don't overlook the fact that that there are MANY other reviewers on yelp who have very similar things to say about the food and this particular manager.  Why does the owner put up with this guy?  Are they related?

The food is good but the customer service experience I just had there was terrible.  I ordered eggs florentine to go with fruit on the side. It normally comes on the side but I always ask just to be sure. The woman at the register told me it doesn't come with fruit. When I said that wasn't right the owner came over and had a back and forth conversation with the woman.  I came back to pick up the food. The fruit was there stewing in with the eggs so I asked if they could put it in a separate container. The manager came over and told me they don't do that unless you ask. I told him they've been doing it that way for me without asking for over a year now. He told me I was wrong.  My point here is that the conversation should have gone: Me - Can I get this fruit in another container? Owner - sure, but we don't normally do that unless you ask. Me - I did ask. Manager - I'm sorry. We didn't hear you. Here's your food. Have a nice day. Instead, 5 minutes later he calls me a bad customer because I'm arguing with him... but it's not me that's arguing. It's him, needing to get in the last word and be right at the expense or having a satisfied regular customer. I didn't yell. I didn't call him a name. I didn't insult him. I just stuck to my guns. I should have just walked away. $12 for eggs is not worth it if the experience leaves a bad taste in your mouth.
