I don't normally eat in the restaurant because it's always crowded, it closes at 2:00 and the acoustics are pretty bad - making it hard to hold a normal conversation.

Favourite place for breakfast! Salmon platter is a must for seafood lovers. Friendly stuff and bottomless coffee makes this place very special. It is not too crowded during the weekdays, however, if you plan to come over weekends you might end up waiting for up to 30 min for a table.
Yolk'me Yolk'you!! This large 5 egg breakfast omelet was the bomb! It was oozing out Avocado with every tear into it, the hash browns were cooked well and delicious,  the service was very friendly.

The loud ambiance, jam packed tables, and high prices were diminished by perfectly cooked medium scrambled eggs with no runny parts, light and fluffy pancakes,nearly perfect crisp, moist, flavorful potatoes, and coffee made with a heavenly love.  The wait for a table can be annoying on a Sunday morning...yet, it was well worth while. The homeless guy who ended up with a dollar instead of leftovers said, "I hang out here because the food is so damned good!" Now if that's not a good review, I don't know what is: You have to believe a man who can eat virtually anywhere he wants!

A really good pick for a breakfast place in the city. I've eaten there numerous times and I've never had anything I didn't like. The muffins on the side are fresh. Whenever I do pick up the place is packed. The interior is cute and the food is plentiful!

First time being in Chicago and thankfully this spot was a few blocks down from my hotel. The food is excellent! Try their 2x2x2x2. The Staff and service is fast and friendly. Glad I got to have a great breakfast within walking distance

It's a great brunch place to go with some friends. I ordered the tour de france but was disappointed with the small portions... My friend ordered the South of the Border Benny and I think we eyed each other like we should have switched orders. Loved how packed it was. Yes, you probably will have to wait 20 minutes in line for brunch on a Saturday but it's lovely to see so many people and their families in one place for brunch.

Love this place.  It's a great value and the food is stellar.  Outstanding ingredients and excellent service make a great experience.  For breakfast, brunch or lunch it really does not get better.  I had the yogurt, bran and berries as well as some oatmeal.  You'd be surprised how many places destroy these foods.  My brother had crepes.   All outstanding.  Can't wait to go back!!!!
Large selection and good for brunch.  Can get crowded.  The seating is nice but not great.
I definitely recommend! Great options for breakfast. They really know how to make an egg tastes delicious. The ambient is cosy and nicely decorated.

I've organized quite a few breakfast lunch outings for the office here, and this place has failed to impress on all counts:  food, service, and management.  They'll let us make reservations, but will refuse to seat us until the entire part of 15 is inside the building, even if 10 of us have made it through the front door and the other five are standing outside waving through the window because the front area is too packed for them to get in.  Yup, we had to wait until enough other parties were seated so the rest of our party could fit in the door. Food-wise, their tour de france is the way to go, which allows you to try three of their french toasts.  Other than that, I've been unimpressed with what I've ordered.  The three tiny pieces of my cinnamon roll french toast looked sad on the huge plate it was served on, and didn't fill me up.  The one time I ordered a skillet and asked for some items to be left out they weren't, the waitress didn't offer to have it remade, and I was still charged for it although it sat at the table pretty much untouched. Service here ranges from great to meh.  Sometimes we'll be hooked up with a birthday crepe for the guest (or douche, depending on the coworker) of honor, other times we get attitude if we say no when told we have to pay for it.  One time on the way out as I paid the bill at the register, the manager asked me if I was sure that was all I wanted to tip.  Um, the bill totaled $250 and I left a $50 tip.  When I asked if I should adjust the tip down to 15% of the subtotal, he shut up.  Note:  Be advised that if you order takeout over the weekend and they mess up your order, they won't put a rush on fixing it.  When they messed up my friend's wrap, he was told it would be a half hour wait if he wanted them to redo it, no cutting to the front of the line.  Awesome, when you waited 45 minutes for it in the first place.

I really like this location because it's spacy. Waiter/ Waitress here are great.  There will always be a line on Saturdays, you can't avoid that. It might seem like a lot of people are waiting but they line goes really fast. Just make you to put your name down when you walk in, and just somewhere away from the door and they will call your name with a microphone so you won't miss it.  The dishes are reasonably priced with great portions, around $11 ish. Try their sunny side up skillets or any omelet. If you eat a lot and like to have big portions I suggest you for their omelet with roast potato cubs on the side, it's a very big portion. The also come with toast or pancakes which is great! Even bigger!  Too bad there is no parking outside the place, but you can find parking south of Roosevelt on Michigan ave or Wabash or state.

this place is a must have stop every time I visit Chicago. Their breakfast items and wait staff are amazing. I highly recommend grabbing a nice breakfast.  I also order the bacon waffles & husband orders the skillet meal. Never a disappointment. I also love that they complement each item with a fresh cut orange.  They have decent coffee, nothing to rave about. However, their glass of OJ is simply amazing... worth the $4!  Can't wait to visit again.
Portions are nice and price is reasonable. The only bad thing is that on weekends there is a wait. It is also a great spot for families with kids.
The food is good, the portions are big, and it's all reasonably priced.  I wouldn't say that Yolk is worth going out of your way for, but it's a solid choice for brunch in the South Loop.

Best Breakfast food... I have to say that my husband and I are pretty picky when it comes to breakfast joints. I didn't like the 40 minute wait but the food was worth it. Everything is fresh and very tasty.  The portions are very generous and so many different varieties. It took me the whole wait time to decide what I wanted to order.
The South of the Border Benny Eggs Benedict with crumbled chorizo packs a truly delicious explosion of flavors your taste buds will absolutely enjoy!

Went here for my birthday breakfast, Love this place all locations are awesome ..but this is the original one . Feels like home everyone's nice and attentive if it wasn't the waiter it was the manager making sure we were ok . Really enjoy it every time I come here. I had avocado for the first time in my skillet and gotta say it was amazing wow! Avocado mushroom & ham Delish!!!!

I enjoy Yolk. I've been there several times in the last year and have been satisfied each time. I usually order Pot Roast Benedict; a which makes for a great brunch item, especially during winter! The beef is spiced nicely, tender, generous portion. The halondaise sauce is average, the poached egg is always cooked just right for a Benedict.  Yolk gives generous portions of fruit on the side of all meals; which I really enjoy. Today, the fruit was grapes on the vine, a cantaloupe slice, a thick slice of pineapple and orange slices.  A refreshing desert to have after a savory meal.

Just an ordinary breakfast stop. Had the eggs Benedict. Just average. Coffee was good and very hot. I ask prior to ordering if the bacon was thick or thin. (I prefer thin ). The waitress replied thin so I ordered a side and asked for it crispy.  Uh it was thick when delivered to our table and if can imagine - shoe leather when crispy.   Overall a clean well lit place.

This place is often busy and I have been going there a lot until the spring last year. I noticed that the quality of food and service also for pick up orders has really declined. I don't appreciate waiting for 20 min for pick up order that has been sitting on a counter behind the cash register for the whole time. I don't appreciate eggs being undercooked either. They can't handle how busy they get.  I stopped going for a good eight months but went again two weeks ago on a cold Tuesday. It was slow and things were good again. I think if you see it's busy skip it because it can be a disaster.
Great food, the portion sizes are large. Enough to share.  Try the countryside skillet. Yum!
One of my favorite brunch places in Chicago!  Food is always fresh, a big portion, very affordable, and super yummy.

I don't know how this place doesn't have a better rating. I went on a Saturday morning around 11 am. There was no wait. Service was great and the food was AMAZING. I had the build your own skillet. Everyone was more than happy with their food. Only complaint is that it is so loud inside.

I have gone to Yolk at least 25 times in the past 5 years and today was probably my last time.  The quality has gone way downhill. This morning I met someone for breakfast and when I looked down at my napkin, there was a long hair on it.  That's gross, but I was willing to excuse it.  I asked the waitress for another napkin but when I looked at it *surprise* there was another hair.  What?!?  My meal didn't taste too badly, but my stomach has hurt all day (and I hadn't eaten anything else).  I have had other issues with the food recently, but I think this is it for me and Yolk.

Stopped into the Yolk South Loop for some breakfast based off a recommendation that largely panned out. 1 star for service, they were attentive and quick 1 star for the atmosphere, large, well lit, clean, ample seating 1 star for the food, it wasn't bad, it wasn't to die for, it definitely wasn't worth the 1 hour wait to get in, but it was good 1 star for price, affordable breakfast, wasn't overkill Overall it was a good experience. I likely will return if the wait was more reasonable. Otherwise, definitely not worth waiting an hour to get a seat.

This has to be one of the best brunch places in the city. Came here on a Saturday morning and even though they told us it would be a half hour wait, the wait flew by so quickly. The space here is huge and if you're willing to sit at the bar, the wait goes even faster.  The food is delicious and you can get a savory dish and pay extra to get a specialty pancake/waffle/crepe. Two people could easily split one dish and pay the $2.99 to get a specialty pancake and have plenty of food. I got the California omelette (they use 5 eggs to make their omelettes! I know. Crazy) and got the blueberry pancakes. I didn't even eat half before I had to give up and put it in a doggy bag.  You have to get the strawberry orange juice. OJ is usually too sweet but this was the perfect balance of tart and sweetness. Sooo good.  Tip: there's a parking garage next to subway, one block south of yolk on Michigan. It's only $6 for four hours. It's even cheaper than the garage that Yolk tells it's customers to go to.

Of the brunch spots in the South Loop (and we have a LOT of them, for some unknown reason), Yolk is my go-to. Like the other Yolk locations, I find the food (which is always an egg dish of some type for me) to be consistently tasty - well portioned and reasonably priced. And most impressive to me? No upcharge for egg whites or egg beaters. Score.  They churn a lot of people in and out, so service is always prompt and efficient, and food comes out quickly. Despite the mass of humanity, I never feel ushered out, and the wait is never long assuming as you come with one or two people (and especially if you are willing to sit at the counter). If you are that a** with a group of 10 for brunch, and then whine about the wait - well, what did you expect?
This is my FAVORITE breakfast place!! Love South Beach, crepes, egg benedicts, apple muffin!! Awesome breakfast place and reasonably priced

I am a big fan of Yolk.  Bottomless coffee, a HUGE menu, friendly and attentive staff, and consistently great service.  Eggs, French Toast, Frittatas, Crêpes, Sandwiches, Burgers, you name it, they probably have it! They offer breakfast/brunch/lunch at very reasonable prices, and I love that they give big portions.  I always leave with a box of leftovers that I devour for my next meal. They serve up your standard no-nonsense diner food (for picky eaters and traditionalists) in addition to their many Yolk speciality items.  I personally am a fan of their breakfast omelettes.  They have a huge selection of ready-to-order omelettes and create-your-own omelettes with the options of egg-whites or egg-beaters at NO EXTRA CHARGE.  For your sweet tooth, they offer an extremely decadent Red Velvet French Toast and a melt-in-your-mouth Cinnamon Roll French Toast.  It's nearly impossible to leave here without feeling satisfied. Recommended.

I would have given "Yolk" five stars, BUT my dining experience began with a scene which left me visually disturbed, I found my grapes caked in the hollandaise sauce from my Eggs Benedict. It was not until I demanded a new plate of fruit that things began to look up. Further, the Eggs Benedict, while tasty, was touted as the best in the city, a lofty distinction that is most certainly untrue. The high point of the meal was that every time my lemonade was refreshed, I was also given a fresh lemon in my glass!!! Also, the corned beef hash was quite succulent! Helpful tip: do not bother taking the Yolk wristbands, they snap when you try and put them on your wrist, and my poor wrist has been stinging ever since!

The ambiance of this place is wholesome and a great brunch spot for nearly any crowd. I enjoyed the atypical menu options, including the freshly-squeezed strawberry orange juice, unexpectedly striking the perfect combination of tangy and sweet.  HUGE portions, in classic Midwestern fashion. Best Value: Combo with 2 eggs, 2 pieces of bacon, 2 sausages and 3 pancakes/pieces of french toast ($8.95, plus $3.99 to upgrade) I'd recommend going for the upgrade because the options are too intriguing to pass-up. I got the cinnamon roll french toast, and now wish all cinnamon rolls could be lightly toasted and crispy on the outside, moist on the inside- a delectable contrast. I'd go here over the Cheesecake Factory (my usual brunch spot) with family, and would only miss the broad assortment of breakfast cocktails when out with girlfriends.

This review is long overdue. I will never be going back here again. My friend & I decided to eat here back in June 2013 & I was 8 months pregnant at the time. We must have come on one of the busiest & hottest days. There was a 45min wait. Granted we should have just gone somewhere else now that I think about it, but my friend had traveled from out of town & wanted to eat here. We tried to wait outside, but it was just too hot. Inside the air must have not been working & there was no room to sit...people just sat on the floor. I was so pregnant & hot, I thought I was literally going to pass out. I simply asked the hostess (who is there ALL the time--elderly lady with short grey hair) for a glass of water (clearly I'm pregnant & about to pop) and she told me she couldnt get me any & to buy bottled water. She then simply refused to look at me & turned the other way! Who does that? 3 separate waiters then asked me if I was ok and got me water. Luckily the staff was much nicer than this lady who clearly had no mercy. After waiting for an hour, we were seated. I was so famished, that we ordered right away. When the food came out it was the wrong order!! I knew that, but I was so hungry that I just started eating it. The waitress noticed it was wrong order 15 min into my meal, but I didn't care at that point. Even though I live in the neighborhood, I'm never going back there again! And neither are any of my friends

Stayed a few blocks down and asked the front desk for a place that has cheap eats. Not only did I get that but I got good service too. I was greeted right when I walked in and sat at the bar where I got immediate service w water. The friendly server took my drink order which was some of the best hot chocolate. I placed my order and didn't have a long wait to get my meal.  Food and ambience were great and I love how there is a place at the side to hang your coat. Server was very attentive and when I left, I was acknowledged as well. Can't wait to go back.

Four of us had a very nice breakfast before venturing out on a very cold Friday morning in early December. All four of us enjoyed their selections. Wait staff was attentive and prompt with hot team and our meals.
The food was ok, nothing worth paying for.  The service was barely existent.  I won't be going back.

The first time I came here a few months, I got the California crepes with a side of pancakes, which were so good that I promised myself I had to return for more pancakes. The California crepe itself was great and the portion was huge! But it was really the pancakes that made me want to go back--fluffy, soft, and delicious. So the second time I got a combo that came with two sausages, two slices of bacon, two eggs, and two pancakes, which I upgraded to their famous banana-crunch blueberry ones. The blueberry pancakes were fantastic, though I think I'd prefer it without the granola in the pancake. The granola in the pancake ruins the fluffy texture by adding crunch to the pancake, in my opinion. Also, because there was so much granola in the center, the batter in the center wasn't cooked completely through so it definitely wasn't fluffy there. They were still great pancakes though. I was also surprised by how much I enjoyed the breakfast sausages, which I am usually not a fan of and almost never eat. The bacon was a bit on the salty side and pretty average.  I will definitely return for more pancakes; next time I think I'll get chocolate chip ones!

Amazing! Food came out within 5-8 minutes-super fast! I got two eggs and meat: sausage is some of the best sausage I've had at a restaurant! Service is great. No complaints and I give it an A+. Came during the week around noon and wasn't that busy!
Fantastic place for breakfast.  Build your own skillet with ham, bacon and chorizo was fantastic!!!!
The food was fresh and the salmon breakfast scrambler was amazing !! So was the fresh squeezed strawberry orange juice.
3 years later and I still love this place. The line can be a little out of control on the weekend but mid week there is not a wait at all. I love that the prices are still totally reasonable.

ordered a latte with an extra shot to go. Charged $2.00 for the single extra shot, pulled from a pushbutton automatic machine behind the cash register. Over $6.00 for a coffee. Most expensive, least drinkable latte I've ever had. Let's hope they don't do the same sort of thing with the other items on their menu. I wont be back to find out.
The food was amazing. If in Chicago this is a must!  I had a sausage skillet with my eggs over easy. Yum. Every plate that came out was beautiful!!! Enjoy

I don't often spend over $20 for breakfast, but when I do, it'd be at Yolk.... I had the Santa Fe Fritata and it was perfectly done. Just the right blend of cheese, egg, potato, and other fillings. A ton of food but somehow managed to leave without feeling over greased. The coffee had flavor (imagine that!) and service was very prompt.  The downside is the price. I can't see spending this much every day or even every weekend.  Definitely worth a visit to see what paying twice the standard greasy spoon diner will get you.  Food is four plus. Price minuses a star.

Good food for the price. It's not your gourmet, fancy spot, but the location is great and the portions are a nice size. I've never been disappointed. I come here whenever I visit Chicago since it's near my usual hotel. Try the "Hey Ricky!"

You can't go wrong with this place.  The wait is long, but don't let it keep you away.  The staff is fantastic and helpful, the food is some of the best in Chicago.  We are big fans.  The week we were there we ate there 3 times and never had anything but exceptional food and service.

Yessenia = the worst server EVER!! If you have her, request someone else. When I was a server, I knew I was working for a tip, so at least tried to do a good job. She forgot drinks, got our order wrong, was probably the least friendly person ever, and checked on us once.  Also, why would a restaurant hire someone who had been fired from the show Restaurant Impossible for eating fries off of a customer's plate . This guy was just sitting there next to the kitchen doing nothing! Ew, I was hoping for a good experience here.

Pros:  The menu is pretty solid with the basics like eggs and anything batter based (the French Toast and the crepes especially). They know how to serve a breakfast.They have a great assortment of vegetarian options, and can make a good breakfast sandwich as well.  The wait staff is incredible, and knowledgable. I've seen people complain about a couple of the waitresses in the past, but they will warm up to you if they see you come in frequently. I've had amazing conversations about music, movies, job leads, workout routines, and things to do in the city with the staff after they picked up that I show up fairly frequently. I once asked management and was told they like picking up a crew of "understanding outsiders." It makes sense after you've been there for a while.  It is also an amazing location, great for people watching and seeing the city. The counter (which is very classy and well built) is a great place in case you want to meet someone or just have a moment of solitude while you eat. And if you have a large group they can accommodate you pretty quickly if you give them fair warning. Cons:  They can be a bit inflexible with substitutions on the menu from time to time, and I've noticed that things can change depending on who serves you or is managing the place at the time. The hours are a bit odd too, as it could be kind of nice to have the place open a bit later in the day.  It can get very loud, and VERY packed quickly, and I would not recommend trying to come to the place on a weekend unless you show up before 8 or after 1:30....you find a ton of people from out of town, or people bringing relatives on it. But these really aren't problems with the service or the structure, more just a sign of how word of mouth has spread on the location.  It'd be nice to have WiFi.

I wish I could come here for breakfast every morning. The first time I came to Yolk there was a long wait for a table (typical for a weekend) but it was so worth it. The servers are friendly and attentive and the food is amazing. If you want something sweet the Tour de France french toast sampler (banana nut topped w/ bananas, sweet orange topped w/ strawberries, and lemon poppyseed topped w/ blueberries) is ridiculously good and if you're looking for something savory, I recommend the Irish Benny (eggs benedict on corn beef hash and sauteed tomato). The portions are huge so you definitely won't be leaving here hungry. The meals are a little pricey, but the quality of the food is really outstanding. Highly recommend!
Our concierge suggested Yolk so we came. There was about a 20 min wait, but you can have your coffee (which is bottomless).  The food was amazing and I will definitely be back when in Chicago.

This is seriously the best breakfast I have ever had in my life! I really like breakfast, but like a typical New Yorker, I get it from Ihop or a local diner at like 2 pm on a saturday or sunday. This place had me getting up at 9 am - while on vacation!! The line on Saturday and Sunday was at least an hour - but soooo worth it. On the weekdays we had absolutely no wait. I had many variations of omelettes and fritattas, all amazing. And the coffee - Oh. My. Goodness. Before we even headed back to NYC, I was already lamenting having to return to Ihop. Please open a Yolk in New York. I actually just got sad.  Next time I'm in Chicago, breakfast will be at Yolk everyday!

Our company was recently in town for a convention at McCormick Place, staying at the Chicago Hilton. When the Hilton gave me zero help in trying to organize a group breakfast for 17 people each day of our stay, I looked nearby and was lucky to find Victoria and her team at Yolk South Loop. They went above and beyond to accommodate our group, making sure that orders were taken quickly and the food expedited so that we could get in and out as quickly as possible. The wait staff was fantastic and the food was great. I highly recommend the Yolk South Loop -- great food and great service. Thank you Victoria!
Great pancakes! Very good friendly service. Omelettes, too, are good. Great bowl of fresh berries!

First time here! I had the Belgian waffles with eggs & bacon. My bacon was in my waffle batter which wasn't for me. It was still good and the waitress was beyond nice and friendly. It was a Saturday so it was busy but we still got right in. I like the brightness of the place. I would deff stop by here again, the staff is nice and the place is clean and the food is good. We also had the egg cheeseburger which could of used some seasoning, it tasted like meatloaf but the fries were good!!!

OMG I love that they DELIVER! Yummy breakfast and I don't have to leave my apartment when I'm hungover! If you do feel like leaving the house to go here on a weekend, expect to wait like 30 minutes. But it's worth it! Country time Skillet is sooo good!

There is a really big menu. It took me a long time to decide what I want to have for breakfast. The food was delicious. My husband had the cinnamon toast that came with icing. He said it was really good. My omelet was huge! You can get either toast or pancakes with it. I should have stuck with toast! I could not finish my meal. If you come to Chicago, this is a good breakfast spot.

I love this breakfast place. The interior of the restaurant is so stylish and upscale, you would think the prices would be high. However, the prices are very reasonable, considering how much food you get, and how good it is. The wait is usually long, but again, it's because this is a great quality breakfast place. I've been here a few times, and I highly recommend it to everyone.

GREAT, AWESOME, YUMMY, THE WORKS!!!! One of thee best breakfast restaurants I have experienced. You get the diner, cozy effect with 5 star quality taste. The only reason I give it 4 stars is because the waits are ALWAYS ridiculous *But with great food, it is expected* Fav dish, stuffed red velvet french toast!

This was a great place for breakfast. We stopped here on the way to Fields museum and I am glad we did. I am a potato pancake fanatic, and the ones I got here were some of the best I have ever had. On the down side, it is very loud inside.

Went to a Bears game sunday arrive way to early for anything hop on a cab to look for a breakfast place stumble upon this and not regretting it. Best place in the loop wait wasnt long food didnt took long and it was heaven to my mouth. I absolutely recommended to ppl in the south loop looking for a breakfast place. Employees were fantastic server always coming asking if we need anything. Sat in the bar and let me tell you me working in the restaurant business and  kitchen those guys can cook and keep the food rolling. They have earn 4 stars.

Nice large breakfast place with a menu that contains all the favorites with a few interesting options. Everything I had here was done well and served in large portions. Despite being busy, the service was efficient. Coffee: Some people say that this makes or breaks a breakfast spot. This wasn't spectacular but was done as well as most of the good coffee spots in the city. Prime rib sandwich: Nice texture and flavor with plenty of meat. The horseradish sauce was light in flavor but was enjoyable overall with the fries. The works omelet: Bacon, sausage, ham, mushrooms, onions, and tomatoes -- great flavor combination. Simple but tasty. Citrus blast salad: Light and tasty with fresh ingredients. The chicken breast was tender and flavorful. Corn beef hash: Done well, no new surprises but enjoyable. Pancakes: Nice and fluffy with good flavor. Overall, a good place to go for breakfast although it can get busy at times.

The food is awesome! I've been here several times with friends, family and today to celebrate my hubby's birthday!  We had the prime rib Benedict and the Big Easy skillet. Both were great, the tea was really good and we left very full!  Why the three stars? Because I have yet to feel like anyone on the staff cares if you are here...other than for the table turn. Before we could even get through the door the host barked "2?" and started walking us to the table. Without any eye contact, gesture, a slowing of pace, or even a nod, placed two menus on a table and continued walking to the back. We weren't sure if he was checking on another table, wanted us to sit, or wanted us to follow him. When we asked, he gave us a "I don't have time for hospitality look" and said "yes, that's why I put the menus there".  The server was pretty equally indifferent. No smiles, no particular pleasantries, just took the order and walked away. Which is fine, for Denny's, but I think for the extra $4 you pay, a little more is expected!
This restraint was fantastic. The wait for seats was not too long. And we didn't have to wait very long for our food. Our server was very sweet and my Nutella crep  was delicious!

Not good for vegetarians that don't eat eggs!!! The vegetarian wrap was not good. The banana/blueberry pancakes were good but the belgian waffle with chocolate chips were basically typical of most brunch spots. Lacto vegetarians are at a loss here. The staff was good though!

We had been to Egg Works in Vegas which the wife loved this place looked like the same idea so we had to give it a try.  The wife ordered the french bread trio, she was not overly impressed, on the dry side not as much flavor as she hoped.  I ordered a typical breakfast meat, eggs, potatoes, nothing very exciting about my choice or the flavors.

3.5. It's quick, fast, cheap, and portions are big. Comes with alot of stuff. Food is nothing special, but I can see why alot of people come. The corn beef hash wasn't bad, with egg white, potatoes and pancakes. Huge pancakes!!! Barley finished half.

Great breakfast! I had the two eggs with bacon, potatoes and toast. It was a ton off food! The eggs were just like any other scrambled eggs, potatoes were chopped rather than hash brown style but were really good. The bacon was a nice thick cut and cooked great. The wheat toast seemed homemade and was also great. The fresh squeezed OJ was really good as well. Service was good, we were served quickly. I would definitely make this a regular breakfast place.

A great place for breakfast right downtown in The Loop.  Lots of vegetarian items to choose from, and I went for the Eggs Benedict. It was a large plate of food and I added avocado to mine - which added to the deliciousness. I might ask for the hollandaise sauce on the side next time to keep it off the fruit side that comes with the meal.  Service was friendly and speedy and I would recommend this place to anyone looking for a solid breakfast.
It was okey ...would rather to have my breakfast in nearby Bongo Room for the same price as yolk and better quality

The food is decent. I had the eggs benedict and pancakes. Pretty standard but, the bernaise sauce was little too sour for my taste. I would only with the food 4 stars but the extra star is for the RED VELET FRENCH TOAST. Seriously, it is the only thing you should order if you don't know what you want. It is so good and rich and I'm not even a fan of red velvet! I shared the order but honestly I wanted it all to myself. What can I say,  I was hungry and greedy and it was delish!

This is a mixed review.  I had the Benedict Caprese which was very good, and had the lightest hollandaise sauce I have ever had.  Have no idea how they get it so light.  However my wife had the carnitas breakfast sandwich and it was really bad.  Meat was dry, and what was supposed to be a sour cream pineapple salsa was actually hunks of cream cheese.  She had to add hot sauce to it just to get any flavor.  The place was nice enough and the service was good.  There are better options in the South Loop.
Very generous portions but bland. My husband's Caesar salad had a tiny bit of dressing and lots of large clumps of blue cheese. I had the eggs benedict but the sauce was just too bland.

It's no wonder this place has stayed open for years and has been busy all along. The service, portion size and variety of the food is unbeatable for the price. My fiancé and I ordered the Irish Benny and French Toast combination.  Both dishes were delicious and filling.

om nom nom nom nom nom nom.   bright and cheery. delicious delicious breakfast and brunchy type things.  fast service and decent prices.   downside: can get very crowded. insane amounts of people also love this place. weekends can be daunting.  totally worth the wait.  nicely done yolk!
Yolk has underwhelmed me too many times. So many better brunch places in Chicago without the ridiculous wait.
Food was OK. The biggest drawback was an absence of real cream for my coffee no refrigeration required creamers do not count.

Went there for breakfast on Sunday morning around 9. No lines when we arrived there but in about 45 minutes, the line started to back up to outside. I can't complain about that one because we were already at table eating our breakfast. I had ham/cheese omelet, that was YUMMY but very hot (temperature) which is good to get my food to the table while it was hot. Not crazy about the hash brown, boys had pancakes and wanted more! It was great breakfast and we were FULL for the day. Will love to go back there again when we are in town.

My opinion: Over rated. I've been here twice, both times on weekends. Food wasn't worth the 30 min wait for a table. Nothing wrong with it, but nothing to get excited about. Good service, though. Very professional service staff who were on top of their game and never rushed us despite waiting customers.
It was worth the wait. The omelets were awesome! Fresh ingredients and really good service.  Sit at the counter if you can.  You are in the action and coffee service is almost immediate.

Pros: great looking place, great location Cons: Service (why is it ALWAYS service??) was, once again, apathetic. Waitress barely spoke above a whisper and this place is diner-style loud.  You would think after the third time we said "What?" she would have gotten a clue. She didn't mention any specials or even draw our attention to the specials menu that was hiding under a  few things at our crowded table.  Sad thing is, we probably would have ordered something off of it.   The food: is just ok, slightly over spiced (and I am a fan of spice); the multi grain pancakes were kind of cardboard-ish.  My not-picky kids with big appetites didn't even finish them and they eat alot of pretty much anything.   This restaurant is right next to a hotel so I am guessing they are immune to feedback with their somewhat captive clientele but they really should step up their game, especially for the location.

I would put 4 stars due to the wait, but since the restaurant has little to no control over that and they were very organized despite the crowds that showed up the morning my mother, sister and I went, FIVE STARS IT IS. Great food - I ordered the vegetarian skillet (cannot remember what it was exactly called). I loved every bit of it - not too often that you get a breakfast skillet with zucchini in it! Attentive staff, friendly hostess, and the three of us collectively felt satisfied and that the food was well worth the half-hour wait. If you're staying at a hotel on Michigan on your next trip out to Chicago, check this place out.

Long wait but they do their best. We sat at the counter and everything coming through the pass looked so good. Had the Huevos Rancheros, never had better!  Even the young lady sitting next to me commented that it looked amazing....it was.

Great place for breakfast! You cant go wrong with any menu item. Yes, the wait is a little long if you arrive in peak breakfast time (we arrived at 10 and had a 30-40 min wait for 4 people), but it's worth it. The food came out quick and was delicious as usual. On our menu were the Nutella Crepes, Pancake Combo, and Crepe Combo. All plates were cleared as much as we could - portions are large. Definitely a "must eat at" in Chicago!
Excellent food, excellent service. And very fast during rush hour. Would recommend to others.

The reason they call it yolk is because after you eat here you will feel like you have egg on your face. Five of us ate here at 2pm yesterday. My croque Madame was so god damn dry that I needed to ask for extra syrup. The fruit on my plate must have been in contact with my sizzling sandwich for some time before it was served because all of the fruit tasted like meat and half of it was cold and half of it was over 120 degrees.  My companions had similar bad luck with their fare. An order of apple cinnamon crates appears to have been placed under a warmer for some time before it was served. It's a shame they didn't use the extra time to prepare the dish which only included about 1/4 of an apple.  In addition, a steak and eggs entree arrived without the steak and the rest of the dish appeared six minutes later.  Now for the service. Warm water without ice was delivered to the table and the server told us the restaurant was out of ice. Then the table next to us was brought water with ice and when I asked out server for the same she argued with me that they didn't have any ice and relented when I pointed out the glasses next door. If your restaurant runs out of ice again send someone one block south to the jewel .... Ridiculous.  Suryp was not served with the crapes or the croque Madame and only arrived six minutes after we asked for it. I had to ask the server numerous times for more coffee and she never asked me on her own if I wanted more. If you were our server yesterday and haven't figured out who we are, we were the table who gave a $5 tip on an $80 bill, and that was because I lobbied that your effort wasn't worth $10. Next time don't count your chickens before their hatched.

First of all, for some people this might be a four star restaurant because of the wait, but since I am not an impatient person, let me tell you that this my friends is worth waiting for. From the service to the food, everything was a big hit for me.  After my 10k competition, I had told my parents about this place I saw here on yelp called the yolk. So since the restaurant wasn't far from where the race took place, we walked over to Yolk. As we were approaching the restaurant I saw a lot of people and I mean A LOT and I thought are they waiting or is there patio sitting?? So as we got closer I saw everyone sitting down and yes I knew this was going to be a long wait. I was expecting about more than an hour to wait because there was people waiting inside as well as outside, but surprisingly when I asked the hostess how long the wait was she said 45 mins, and I turn into my parents and told them the wait time and we went ahead and waited.  Now, I am pretty sure we waited 45 minutes exact or even less. As we were seated, a young server came and offered us drinks. Her tone of voice and the way she smiled made me smile and feel cozy in the place, I even asked her to take a picture with me. So our drinks came out I had the plain old coffee which was really good, and both my mom and my dad ordered orange juice. After a few minutes she came and took our order. My mom had the Santa Fe Frittata with wheat toast on the side, my dad had the Tour de France, and as for me I had the Egg Benedicts (voted best in town) with red potatoes and fresh fruit. The egg benedicts were amazing. The English muffins were toasted to perfection and the pouched eggs were also perfectly cooked, now top that with some amazing hollandiese sauce and you got a exquisite egg benedicts and the potatoes were perfectly seasoned and cooked. Every bite was amazing. I agree with the best egg benedicts in town  I would definitely go back again.

A fun place to visit. The interior is bright and inviting. The place was packed the day I got there but they were moving people pretty good so the wait wasn't bad. I ordered the cinnamon bun french toast which was quite delicious. Basically they take one of their large cinnamon buns cut it in 3 horizontally and dredge it in their french toast batter. Needless to say it was quite sweet but it was out of the ordinary so I had to try it. Service was friendly and prompt with my coffee cup always full. I would definitely go again.

Frequent during the week. The servers are always great and we are treated well every time. The portions are big. The tortilla and chicken soups are excellent. Mint iced tea is excellent.  One of the few negatives is the quality of the greens in the salads. They often appear wilted or in worse condition. I've also had questionable chicken from time to time and have gotten food poisoning afterward more than once.  It would be great to see the menu expanded/changed a little, perhaps a pasta dish. The wait is only bad during the week when there are events in the city or at Columbia or it is a holiday.

Came here with family for breakfast on Sunday morning. This place was crowded, so we had to wait about 30 minutes for a table. This place was buzzing with activity. I had a California Crepe dish which came with pancakes, others had Eggs Benedict, Eggs with Corned Beef Hash, and a skillet. Coffee was good, service was good, but the food was so-so. I liked the pancakes more than I liked my main dish. The crepes were too sweet for the California filling for me. Really, I just can't see waiting 30 minutes again for this place. You can get breakfast just as good and better in many, many places. It was OK, but really not too special for me to understand the crowd. Cheers to All

I actually had breakfast here while breaking up with my ex and I loved the food but hated the company.  This place is that good!  Portions were huge, diverse, and was over all clean.  I took enough food for lunch and dinner on my way back home......ALONE!  ;)

6 years on yelp and 15 years in the restaurant industry which is why this is my first review.  Two friends and I rode our bikes from Uptown to meet a friend staying at the travelodge downtown on a Sunday so we knew what we were getting into. 45 minute wait outdoors in 80+ degree heat because their 10x20 waiting room had no seats. It had a nice 50" plasma but no seats. So we sat outside with the other 30 people to wait.  20 minutes into the wait we finished the water in our bottles so I go inside and speak with an elderly woman at the host stand/register. I explained that we rode here from uptown and finished the water in our bottle so I asked politely if I could have a refill for one of the bottles to share. The crypt keeper straight up said "NO" without batting an eyelash. She then told me "I'm not sending anyone back to get you any".  You've got to be kidding me. If it wasnt for my two friends and our out-of-town guest I would have let loose and gone somewhere else. They should be lucky I practiced a modicum of restraint. I went next door which was coincidentally a bike shop and told them what happened. They said they were not surprised as they graciously filled my bottle from their utility tub sink.  I will NEVER frequent any Yolks ever again. It's a shame too because the food is pretty good and my gf drags me out to brunch every Sunday. In one of the bike friendliest cities in the country, Yolk is not.

Despite large crowds, we were able to get a seat at the counter on a Thursday morning.  We tried to go back on a Saturday and realized there was over an hour wait.  We were bummed to not get to go back. The food was delicious, paleo friendly, and large portions.  It kept us full for a whole day of sightseeing.  Friendly service.

We came here a couple of times for breakfast. We ordered the pancakes and eggs.  The food was just average.  The service was just average.  The place was packed, but luckily we didn't have to wait.  Don't think we will be back.
Pretty damn good breakfast. I was in a hurry tho so i didn't get a chance to fully enjoy the food, but on my next visit to Chicago i'm sure i will be stopping in.

Confession: The main draw was the Strawberry Orange Juice :) We also enjoyed the Tuscan frittata (Chicken breast, sun dried tomatoes, fresh basil, and red diced potatoes all scrambled together and baked. topped with goat cheese makes for a bombastic flavor-powered skillet of goodness) and it was only 9.99!  Then there was the Hey Ricky, a spanish omelet with avocado, chorizo, jalepenos, onions, and melted jack and cheddar cheeses. Served with sour cream and side of salsa, also only 9.99!  I say: What a steal! The ambiance is sunny and bright--not one of those homey breakfast nooks, but I don't have any problem with that. Great portions and delicious food--conveniently offering several locations, too!
I have to say I love this place. Variety on the menu is awesome. Service is very fast. However, waiting line on weekends could be a little crazy.

After waiting for 40 minutes in the very hot waiting area, I was expecting the brunch to blow me away.  How disappointed I was when we were served basically average breakfast items.  If I'm going to wait that long and be that hot, I want to be Wowed!!  The waitress my husband and I had was really nice to my husband and snippy with me.  She made me feel dumb when I asked questions about the items on the menu.  We will not be returning.

Love love love this place.  The food is yummy, portion is big, and not expensive. Went here with my family (party of 6), we got seat right away (thank God because this place is usually packed).  My fave is red velvet french toast, its soooooo thick but moist. The last time we went here, my kids were sooooooooooooooooooo annoying and cranky. Thank God our waiter was so patient.  Will be back here for the gazillion times.

OG breakfast spot.  It's nothing wildly special on the menu but I've had most of it and it's just good; quality good breakfast food. I always like the service here. Never had a compliant about this place.  I don't come here a lot because I know there is going to be a wait. I come back here because I know it's good, the place is clean, open kitchen, etc. Want to get in quicker with a small group? Tell them you're willing to sit at bar.  Best thing is their t-shirts that say, "Handling your huevos since 2006" - or I think it's 2006 but huevos reference is pretty funny..

would say 4.5 stars for the food. The service however was ATROCIOUS. Not only did we see our waitress 3 times ( we were a party of 8, but I promise you, quiet and respectful) which included order, and check, but she LITERALLY took food away from my 7 year old, who was so hungry after a 45 minute wait for a table, he was literally stuffing his face. As he's munching on his bacon, this moron takes his plate away from him because she is convinced it's someone else's order. It took 6 adults to start yelling "BUT HE ALREADY TOUCHED IT! you can't give it to another person!" At the end turned out that it was HIS order to begin with. I was livid. How do you even do that?

I had a friend come to visit and this place was of coursed packed on a Sunday. We had to wait an hour, but the wait was worth it as usual. The food came out quickly and was cooked really well! Waitstaff was super nice, despite being completely slammed with orders.  Last time I got the Countryside skillet so this time, I got the Tuscan Frittata, which is chicken breast, sun dried tomatoes, basil, and potatoes. All of that was then topped with a generous helping of goat cheese and served with pancakes!  OMG, it was so good! The goat cheese really did it for me and the pancakes were super fluffy!

If you've read my other reviews, you will already know that I hate crowds and waiting more than 30 minutes for a table. The other times I've been to this location I've experienced both so I was wary about coming here again when a family friend was in town this past weekend. I told my family that we had to be there at 9am to be comfortable and not wait over an hour for breakfast.  My sister and I got there a little before 9am and it was already pretty noisy. I put my name down and we walked over to the waiting area (or cattle room, as I call it, since there are no benches/chairs and people just stand there). We were waiting on 3 other people so they couldn't seat us, which is understandable. When everyone showed up, I told the hostess and we were seated within 5 minutes. So far so good.  We sat down and looked over the menu. I ordered the veggie skillet with egg whites and an English muffin. It had asparagus, tomatoes, mushrooms, spinach, zucchini, cheese, and 2 eggs on top. It was huge and I had to take home half of my plate. I had coffee and the refills were plentiful. My cup wasn't even half empty and the waitress topped me off.  I didn't try anybody's food but everyone seemed satisfied with what they ordered. My parents both ordered the French toast combo (my dad finished his plate, my stepmom couldn't and gave her French toast to my dad), our family friend ordered meat and 2 eggs, and my sister ordered the cheesy egg sandwich. All in all, we had a nice breakfast here. I wouldn't be averse to coming here again, but I'd definitely arrive between 8 and 9 so I can eat and get on with my day.

I'd heard about Yolk from a friend and I went there for lunch with a colleague. The food was average  and the flavor was unimpressive. For what it was, I found it to be expensive. Overall, not a memorable experience, apart from the atmosphere (which I'd describe as confused modern/diner). There are so many better places within a few blocks, there is really no reason to go here, especially for non-breakfast.
The Red Velvet French Toast I had here changed my life. Good coffee, too. Really inventive things done with breakfast food.
Tons of options, yummy food, great prices, and super fast & attentive service. We came in when it was packed inside but we got our food within less than 10 minutes of ordering!

So after hearing all the positives about the Yolk up north on Wells, I decided to stop by the south loop location for breakfast this morning, total waste of time! Burnt pancakes, sausage, and eggs! And whatever you do, don't opt for the turkey link over pork, yuk!!! I would have complained about the food to my server, however, she seemed so uninterested in coming by our table, so I just ate my side bowl of fruit and left the main course pretty much untouched.  There wasn't much of a rush when I went in, so I don't really know why my food, and my friend's (who recommended this place) was so bad. I must say I was pretty upset after paying $30 for bad, dry, burnt food. So much so, I felt the need to write my first yelp review. I'm always up for giving a place a second chance, however with so many other options, it'll be a long time before I see myself visiting this place again. Positives - Portion size was nice, but stay away from their French toast, pancakes, eggs, and turkey links!!!

Leave this one for the tourists who don't have better sense to venture away from the avenue. Menu sounds great, execution lousy.  A lot of better breakfast places for the money in the loop.  Don't have time for a long assessment here.  Just the highlights. Fruit on side had only half the grapes on the stem (for all of our plates) and quite a few rotten ones left on. Huh? Okay one star for recycling.  Just kidding. I hope I am.  I had the good morning burger-it is a pre-formed, tight, definitely not homemade or hand formed (in texture) and tasteless.   The server came back and said and I quote, " I got so caught up in all of your modifications, I forgot to ask how you wanted your burger cooked"  and gave me that you are pain in the rear look.  Really, no bun, no cheese, can I have extra lettuce to use as a bun?  That threw you for a loop? and I am the problem?  My dear, the real world awaits and you better hold on tight.   My side of bacon was really hard, definitely they are pre cooking and reheating these things that could double as tongue depressors.  Brown spots on my avocado. Over cooked egg.  Overall pretty bland.  Just an expensive belly filler diner.  We were laughing at ourselves because we had a feeling going in we should of gone elsewhere.

NOT worth the "wait" While the table service was excellent and the food was above average. The service at the front was rude and insulting. One of our party was parking while the other two of us went in for a table for three. We were required to wait for our third even though there were many open tables. While we were waiting in the very hot bull pen up front, the front staff had an altercation with an elderly gentlemen who mistakenly thought he had a reservation. Rather than deal with him patiently, the staff shamed him. He and his family left. I wish we had done the same. Instead, we waited in the hot area with no water or coffee on offer. In the more civilized cafes water and coffee are available while you wait along with seats and menus. This place literally has an open area for people to stand around in. This day it was very sunny and hot in that area. We, fortunately did not have to wait very long, because as I had explained to the rude and obnoxious front staff, my husband was merely parking the car. It was very unpleasant standing in the heat needing water and looking at no less than five empty tables. When we were finally seated we were seated at the front window at a very hot and dirty table. I guess the tables that had been open all the time we waited were props or something. By the time we left, the place was busier and there were ten or so people waiting in the hot bull pen. I don't know why they would bother to wait. The food is mediocre and certainly  not worth standing in the heat with no water!

This is our go-to breakfast place--when we have time time.  Often times, the wait is 30+ minutes. But it's generally worth it. The food is good and there's plenty of it. I especially love the potatoes. I don't know what they put on these potatoes, but it's delicious.  The french toast made with different breads [banana, orange, etc] are awesome! Omelets are good with plenty of filling options, as are the crepes. I wouldn't recommend the flavored orange juice, but coffee is good. The thing about Yolk is that you need to be prepared for a lot of people. It's generally crowded on the weeks, and it's loud. I don't know how people eating breakfast can be so loud, but they are. Always. But I don't mind when all I want is a delicious breakfast.  The service is so-so, but it's tolerable. Or it must be since we keep going back. I've never gotten a wrong or bad order, so that's good in my book. Tip: if you don't want to wait so long, get there early. If you want to sleep in and then go for brunch here, then expect to wait. You can lessen your wait time if you're willing to sit at the bar. But it's awkward and a little crunched, so get a table if possible.

The Good:  "Tour de France" french toast plate - a trio of Yolk's banana bread (with a side of creamy peanut butter!), lemon poppyseed bread topped with fresh blueberries and a slice of the orange zest bread with strawberries! All so moist and flavorful, no syrup was needed!  Fresh Squeezed orange juice Service was quick and responsive The "Bad" (really not so bad): Saturday morning breakfast/brunch WAIT (to be expected, but well worth it! Get there early) BYOB - i.e. no mimosas here unless you bring your own bubbly :(
Worth waiting for. Try the bacon waffles. There's bacon in the waffle batter. Also, the portion sizes are fantastic for the price.

I came on a week day at noon and while there were a good amount of people, I was seated right away.  Since its summer they had a seasonal menu so I got a mint iced tea which was perfect for me.  I ordered a garden omelette and though I'm trying to be healthy...I'm quite picky with my veggies and cheese and thus had a lot of requests for substitutions but my waiter was understanding helpful about it!  The omelets have a whooping 5 eggs which is why I chose egg whites...best thing about egg white substitution was there was no extra charge!  The fruit side was okay but I did love the pancakes.  Everything came at the right time and over all I was quite pleased!

had a wait of about 30 mins on a Saturday morning which wasn't bad minus the hot sun. Take a look at the menu while you wait so you can put in your order as soon as you get it! The menu is pretty extensive so this is why you should also look prior to being seated esp if you're hungry. I flopped back and forth from a few options but ultimately ended up with the Countryside Skillet because I wanted bacon and eggs and something that would stay hot during my entire meal.   When it came out it was a pretty big skillet.  Quite flavorful BUT OMGoodness!!! The country gravy was soooo delicious!!!  Seriously, it was that good!  My gf kept eating off my plate to get some of that gravy.  YUM YUM.    We also got the red velvet french toast.  That was delicious as well.  Thick, moist pieces.  Not overly sweet which is perfect for my taste buds. They're realllllyyyyy fast with your order too!   There was 5 of us and all of the food came out at one time within I would say 10-15 mins which is amazing for how busy they are.  Service didn't lack either.
Food was hot and tasty. A bit of a wait for only 1 person. I got the French toast combo and it was ok. Bacon was not crisp, but otherwise ok.

If you go on a weekend, be prepared to wait for around an hour as its very popular. Overall, I'm impressed with Yolk's food. They have good coffee and good french toast. I have had both the standard and cinnamon roll french toast. I definitely prefer the standard french toast. On the negative side, I would pass on a side order of bacon. There are only 3 small pieces for over 3 dollars and they are just average. I was always left wanting more. My friends have gotten other dishes and were pleased overall, unfortunately I don't remember what they ordered.  It can get quite loud, so conversation is difficult. Also, because of the popularity, seating for large parties is very difficult.

I've been coming to this specific Yolk location since it opened and I keep coming back.  It's one of the few spots in the city to offer different offerings of oatmeal which is my go to breakfast item.  They also offer an extensive menu with frittatas, omelets, pancakes and everything else you can think of.  You will find something to eat here that you like, guaranteed. Another perk is the staff.  The bussers are amazing and wait staff are almost always top notch.  The space is large, but this places packs it in on the weekends so expect a wait.

Phenomenal breakfast or brunch! Portion-to-price ratio is inhumanely in the customer's favor.  I strongly recommend the Tour de France for you French toast fanatics, each of the 3 types was uniquely delicious and a separate experience from the other 2. Cinnamon rolls are also incredible - not to be taken lightly though, I figured it would be an add-on to my Tour....no way....just added on to the blissfully button-popping pain I endured that afternoon. MUST consider wait time! Area out front is always crowded with people waiting, so definitely show-up an hour before you are ready to eat.

A little busy but the two of us were seated promptly by a man who I didn't think worked there at first with his street clothes. I ordered the cheesy egg sandwich with sausage and pesto - little meh but the fresh fruit was good. Ate more of my dates frittata with meat and feta cheese; I highly recommend it!

Good brunch, bafflingly large portions. If I were home in Atlanta I probably wouldn't make this place a "go to" - the waits are too long, and the food isn't anything I couldn't cook at home myself. Still, it's tasty and friendly, and even if there's a long wait you have unfettered access to coffee, which makes the wait bearable.  Split a dish with a friend, and you'll have a cheap meal that's quite tasty.

There is so much good food to choose from that I almost took longer than our wait to decide.  I ended up getting the west coast crepes.  It was great, but the potatoes were a little meh.  Lack of seasoning, but quickly remedied with a little s&p.  I think it's awesome that they have the little International Delight coffee creamers.  Not like I expect them to change their whole set up, but having the little buzzers for when your table is ready would be a lot more pleasant than having to strain your ear over the loud conversation outside to see if the last crackle/scream of the speaker was for your table.  If you have 2+ hours to kill on a weekend morning, check it out.  When you're stuffed to the gills like we were, walk from the restaurant to the John Hancock center and take in all of the magnificence that Chicago's lakefront parks and Michigan Ave have to offer.

While in Chicago on vacation, I came here on the suggestion of several locals who all sang Yolk's praises. I was also fairly warned about the long wait that would likely ensue without a reservation. I got to Yolk with two other friends around 11:00 to have more of a late brunch/early lunch and for three people, the wait only ended up being half an hour! Yolk has a very enjoyable atmosphere and a very fast turnover rate. Once we were seated they also very promptly served us coffee and kept it coming! The three of us ordered three dishes to split amongst us--this was before we realized how big the portions were! We got the banana blue crunch cakes, the california omelet and the cinnamon roll french toast. All three AMAZING. All three very FILLING on their own. The cinnamon rolls had to be my favorite. They fresh, warm, and catered perfectly to my sweet tooth :)

Got here at 10am and the wait for 2 ppl was already 40 min. Large restaurant good for big groups. We ordered the eggs florentine (the dish itself was eh maybe a little underseasoned, but the potatoes were cooked very nicely, not too oily, seasoned well) and the big easy skillet (hearty, fresh veggies) with a side of BANANA NUT FRENCH TOAST - omg, the highlight of my brunch - super fluffy, not overwhelmingly sweet and the peanut butter was just divine - I started eating the pb on its own after I finished my french toast.
yolk was very busy in a good way. Great atmosphere. got seated right away. The santa fe skillet was great. I loved it.
We got here early, 8:00 AM and there was no wait. The food was good, and the coffee hot!  I was pleased to find that they had flavored creamers, what a treat!

Fantastic breakfast spot.   It can take a while to land a table and they are only open until 2pm or so.  So plan ahead and don't all rush in for the weekend!   Most plates have a beautiful presentation and the food always tastes great.   I love their cinnamon rolls.  They are the same as the cinnamon rolls at a quaint little coffee shop I used to work at, so I definitely stop by this Yolk from time to time just to purchase a cinnamon roll or two to go.   The waitstaff is attentive and pleasant, definitely busy, but good enough to keep your glass full of water.  Better than that of the Streeterville location.  I recommend

Met a few locals on back-to-back weekend mornings...wait was long, not quite worth it.  Potatoes were perfect, but omelets for me and my partner were overwhelmed by avocado.  Frittata was not hot enough.  Staff was very good, attentive and energetic.  Good, not great.
I little over priced.I liked the strawberry orange juice. I had pancakes, turkey sausage, and scrambled eggs. It was pretty good.
first time here, definitely coming back. the portions are huge and the orange juice is so good. I had the countryside skillet and it was really good. cute decor and good service

Tried the South Loop location on a Saturday with my girlfriends around 10Am and had about an hour wait. I don't mind waiting if the food is great and that's what I was thinking it would be since there were tons of people outside. Food was just OK. I think people hype it up because it's the niche breakfast spot to be at, I've had an equally good breakfast at Golden Nugget. Ordered the hash and eggs. Hash was nothing to write home about, tasted kinda canned to me. Mint Lemonade was delicious. Staff was very attentive and pleasant. Prices were reasonable for huge amounts of food. The food was eh, if I was in the area I would stop in and grab a bite, but nothing to make a special trip for and wait an hour. Definitely better places in the city for breakfast/brunch.

We were looking for a breakfast place close to the museum campus, and Yolk appeared to be the closest. We stopped in and immediately loved the atmosphere. Very vibrant. They had people seated at nearly every table, yet it wasn't too loud inside, which I thought was impressive. But anyway, on to the food. I got French toast, scrambled eggs, and bacon and all of it was good. The service was also very friendly. Our waitress checked with us regularly and never let our drinks become empty. I'd definitely recommend going here, especially if you're going to be making your way toward the museums.

We were visiting Chicago this past week, and decided to try Yolk because it was around the corner from our hotel. The food was delicious!! There were five of us and we had breakfast there everyday and all ordered something different...nothing was disappointing-it was all delicious! The banana nut french toast and carrot cake pancakes were my favorites! The potatoes were also fantastic and the guys loved the farmhouse. The food was not expensive and it was a lot of food. Depending on the time though, it  can be a 20-30 minute wait to get a table.

Obviously a long wait for weekends. However, the older hostess (grey hair) was extremely rude and when I questioned the time of wait( we were told 20 min) she snapped - you checked on at 11:04, it's not been an hour-it was 11:58, pretty damn close. The wait staff was overworked and I asked for coffee and cream I only got cream, he forgot the coffee. Food was fine but eggs are truly not difficult. Huge hassle overall.

Food is sooo good! You can order anything you crave! I'm sure you will love it! I've tried at least 7 dishes that are all amazing! There is always a wait, but what do you expect when the food is this good?? The coffee could use improvement, as I really enjoy coffee that is good enough to drink black, but at least they got everything down on the food!

Saw that there were lots of reviews for this place so had to check it out while on my business trip.  I had the corned beef hash with eggs, potatoes, and pancake. The hash was good, eggs were over easy, and potatoes weren't so oily. The pancake in the side was very good. I prefer to like my pancakes on the moist side so that is what you would expect.  I think there are other dishes that are more well known here so I plan on coming back another time to try out some other dishes.  Overall, I had a good experience and the server was very attentive.  Reasonable prices too.
It's just ok.  This is not my first time eating here.  I have not had the experience others have had.  My pancakes were cold and my potatoes were not cooked through.
AWESOME breakfast - possibly the best in Chicago! Great quick service, fun and friendly staff. Flavorful, quality food which doesn't always happen in breakfast joints.
Average at best.  On the postive, the portions sizes were huge and extremely well priced (less than $100 for 7 people -- including a 20% tip).
I love this place! I visit every time I'm in town. Consistent, delicious breakfast food.
Solid Brunch place.  Not the best, but definitely a tasty spot.  Good skillets, eggs and pancakes.

The food here is amazing! I highly recommend the South Beach and the Hey Ricky! Neither one of these options have ever let me down. I would give Yolk 5 stars if it weren't for the cashiers and hostesses....if you're placing a to-go order expect to feel rushed while ordering and save yourself time by checking your order before you leave. I come here for the food not the friendliness.

Best brunch place in Chicago, hands down!! I'm really surprised it's still so affordable, given how popular this place has become. Get there early, and be prepared to wait, especially on the weekends.

Come on Yolk! I realy want to like you! Yolk is 4 minutes away from my house so I go here often on Saturday mornings. They were great with delicious foods, great service, and good portions... But recently, they've been losing their touch. Lot of times the potatoes were undercooked and the service was terrible. The lady that served us seemed very unhappy to see us and she never came to our table. Come on bring it back! You used to be superb! Now you're just a mediocre brunch place with just lot of crowd.

Went to the location on Ohio Street for the first time.  We were in town for a musical and were looking for a good brunch place; Yolk came highly recommended by the hotel concierge, and he gave us a card that allowed us to skip to the front of the line (awesome)! I had 'The Works' omelette with the fruit and almond pancakes.  It was a huge amount of food for not much money, and it was good- but nothing special.  There wasn't really a signature or anything that differentiated the omelette or pancakes from typical breakfast fare.  Also -- though this is probably the fault of the concierge, not Yolk -- most places that bill themselves as "brunch" serve alcohol, and Yolk does not.  Definitely more "breakfast" than "brunch." Overall, we enjoyed the environment and food, but we'd probably scout the city for a unique offering before heading back.

Busyyyyyyyyy i love brunch.. and this place delivers a good brunch..the portions are big and everything is so delicious.. but the service was just slowwwww.. granted we were there saturday around 10:30.. but even when we were eating.. the waitress was not exactly the most attentive i feel like giving it 3 stars is too low but 4 stars is too high.. it's a solid 3.5 stars... but with a few better breakfast places that i've experienced in chicago like m.henry, the bongo room, lula cafe, etc

Food was good, service was not.  French Toast here is pretty much amazing, it's definitely a must have.  The "crispy" bacon was not crispy, and the eggs needed a little salt and pepper.  It's better than something like Denny's or IHOP, but it's not mind blowing either.  Our waiter was pretty bad and inattentive, and we're really low maintenance when it comes to dining out.

Stumble at this place when we took the train to the museum and planetarium. Got interested since we saw a long line of people waiting to get in. We got lucky since it was pretty outside since we finally waited for 30 minutes outside (they have a speaker system wired outside to let you know once you can wait inside) and another 15 minutes standing on the line inside. There's a park right across the street that you can sightsee in case you're getting bored, just make sure you're back when they call your name. I tried the banana nut bread French toast which was pretty good and the portion is huge! Another honorable mention from our group is the red velvet French toast. Just like any other breakfast/brunch place, it's only open 'til late afternoon.

Always packed on the weekends.  The omelettes are huge and come with home fries and pancakes or toast.  The sausages are delicious, as is the coffee.  Splenda isn't on the tables, but they'll bring you some if you ask.  The food is always delicious and the service is great.  Prices are much more reasonable than the other breakfast places nearby, and it's very family and large group friendly.  If you have a large group paying the check can be a pain because you have to pay at the door, but paying is always a pain with split bills, so I didn't mind.  One of my favorite neighborhood brunch restaurants.

Potato pancakes! Try them :) Very filling and yummy with the applesauce and butter that comes on the side.  I love that every dish comes with some fresh fruit to lighten up a heavy breakfast. Worth the 20 - 45 minute wait during the brunch hour !
Stopped here while walking  from the Blackstone hotel to the field museum.  Great stop for lunch, big portions and nice kids meals. Only a 5-7 minute walk to museum campus from here.
BEST BREAKFAST IN CHICAGO!! waitstaff is friendly, food is yummy every time, big variety on their menu and super clean.  One of my fav places to eat. I recommend the nutella crepes ;)

My first experience at The Yolk was well over one year ago. I stopped by with a friend for breakfast back in February and that will probably the last time.  I ordered a scrambler with Italian sausage, cheddar cheese, and broccoli with a side of pancakes and fruit. When our food finally arrived I was so hungry and eager to dig in. It wasn't until after my 3rd or 4th bite that I noticed a yellowish liquid floating around on the plate. I didn't think much of it and assumed that it might have been "melted fat" from the cheddar cheese (very stupid now that I think about it). I took a few more bites and realized it was actually RAW YOLK. I SHOULD have complained, but I didn't. I don't really like being "one of those" people, but I learned that sometimes it really is necessary. By that point we were already there for awhile and I didn't want to deal with talking to a manager and waiting for a new order so I ate a few pieces of fruit that were untouched by the raw yolk, finished my pancakes, which were alright, paid about $10 and left. I didn't think I'd have to let my waiter know that I wanted my omelette fully cooked, considering I've never had that issue at any other restaurant. It was disgusting. I would have preferred to wait an extra 5 minutes for my omelette to cook properly as opposed to receiving a runny, half assed breakfast.

In for breakfast with my daughter around 10:30 on a Friday. While they were busy is wasn't crazy; we were seated within 5-minutes. The front of the place is bright yellow which is befitting of the name of the place. A really neat looking place with prompt service. Now for the food. Your two main takeaways are (1) you'll get lots of food reasonably priced and (2) it will be prepared well. I got the country skillet which also came with pancakes and my daughter had pancakes, eggs and sausage.  We both left full and pleased.  Its right across the street from Museum Park, so we burned off our meal with a nice walk afterwards.  If we're ever back in Chi and looking for breakfast, this will be the first place I think of.

Awesome!!!! The sausage links melt in your mouth. The Mexican frittata was the bomb and I mean that in a good way!!! Bacon mushrooms avocado cheese sour cream potatoes. Those potatoes melted in my mouth as well. Loved this place!!! Definitely would go back!!
Great portions and prices for breakfast! Friendly service, but always busy. Be prepared to wait at least 10-15 minutes.

My family just had breakfast there earlier this week and were pleasantly surprised at the quality of our meals and the service we received.  My wife and I are South Loop residents and are lucky enough to have several breakfast options within walking distance (Bongo Room, Waffles, etc), but we generally avoid Yolk because of the long lines.  So it's been over 2 years since the last time that we dined there.  That was a BIG mistake!  The dining area is huge and the turnaround time on our meals was very fast.  I ordered the California omelet and my wife ordered the eggs florentine.  The pancakes and potatoes were excellent and they serve Metropolis coffee.  That was the best breakfast meal/experience we've had in a long time.  We will definitely go back even if there's a line of people waiting outside.  AND...they are baby friendly!  HIGHLY recommended.

I like coming here on the weekdays at 2pm because it is pretty empty at this time. I normally get the Irish Benny because I love Benedicts. This is pretty good here for the most part, but I don't like how the sauce and the fruits get mixed together. You can always ask them to separate it for you though. The other thing that my gf normally gets is the Works omelet. This is also pretty good if you are a meat lover. Their diced potatoes that comes with the entree is so yummy too. The service here is what bothers me because it is pretty inconsistent. Sometimes we get good service and sometimes we get crappy service. I just don't see how you can't do a good job when the place is pretty empty by 2pm. Also, the breakfast here is on the pricier side, but you do get pretty decent size portions. I wouldn't come here as my first choice for breakfast, but I do come here once in a while.
I love Yolk. No question. They have great Pancakes, although the Veggie Burger is to die for. The onion chips are great. Love Love Love Yolk. :)

Really busy around 10:30am but were seated within 10min. We sat at the bar which was surprisingly comfortable for me (my bf thinks otherwise). The coffee is excellent and important for me when going out for breakfast. The skillet and pancakes were average but tasty. The Irish Benny was the best I've had so far :) Will definitely return!

Cute, busy brunch place with a big menu right on Michigan Avenue by Museum Campus.  I met two friends here at 11 on a Sunday and we were seated in 10 minutes even though they told us it'd be 30, so off to a good start! The strawberry-orange juice was soooo delicious and fresh-tasting, I've been craving it ever since.  I ordered the Big Easy Skillet, because skillets are my favorite freakin' thing in the world.  This was a generous portion of diced potatoes, green peppers, tomatoes, onions, cheese, an absolutely obscene amount of andouille sausage, and two eggs sunny-side-up on top (because, duh).  The wheat toast on the side looks like white toast that is just a little tan - not a fan of that.  Can't you get some real multigrain toast?  So I can PRETEND I'm not a total brunch fatty?  Thanks. So the skillet was pretty tasty, in the way that cheese and meat and veggies and potatoes and eggs must be because there's no way that it could be bad.  Would've liked more veggies and less sausage.  There was just an absolutely stupid amount of sausage in there.  i was sorry I ordered it and wished I'd just gotten a veggie skillet.  It just wasn't balanced, and made the dish seem soooo heavy and unhealthy.  It would've been lovely to just have small chunks of andouille throughout instead of these massive slices layering the entire bottom of the skillet.  But if that's your thing, you'd probably love this.  They do have a lot of skillets and a build-your-own option so if you understand the allure of this amazing breakfast combo, give Yolk a try.  Order meat at your own risk! Sort of overpriced at $10.50 for a skillet, and something like $3.50 or more for a small glass of juice.  Big portions, and clearly they don't need to lower their prices since they're packed every weekend!
